4Ec9yf0BPkJo2ywN0BtJQw.text: Yet another review to say that the customer service needs work. I came by today for a latte after finding this place on the Yelp app- it's still difficult to find, as it's in a nook of the plaza and can't really be seen from the street. I guess their exterior signage is still being developed, because right now there's just a tarp printed with "Coffee & Waffles".  Went in and there seemed to be some sort of lounge affect going on. I made my way around a group of women clustered near the entrance talking, perused the posted menu, then stood behind a guy chatting at the front counter for a good five minutes before the woman he was speaking to realized I was a paying customer, and said she'd help me.  I find it a little tacky that the employee (who seemed to be one of the co-owners) was not more attentive to the fact that I was waiting in line to place an order. As it is, she excused herself in such a way that I felt I was inconveniencing her.   Regardless, I ordered a skinny vanilla latte- originally planned on getting a sandwich, but it seemed this would have really been a problem to her, so I just stuck to the drink. It was tasty, even if the foam was overflowing along the lip of the lid.  Found a table of samples toward the back as I waited for my drink- the cinnamon sugar waffle and the bacon-cheddar waffle were both really flavorful, though the former was nice and crisp while the latter was more on the limp and soggy side.   Location seems like it'll be good for students, and they seem to have a lock on the niche market- doubt bistro waffles are offered anywhere else nearby. Hope they succeed, maybe I'll be back when they work out the kinks- namely waiting for the novelty of business ownership to wear off enough for them to prioritize customer service. Their product seems like it'll do well.

5xld5twatMb8_2dExNIv8A.text: The waffles were great: they did a great job with a vegan waffle! The smoothie: not so much: very thin and grainy. They had a pretty awesome pistachio latte. It's the kind of place that does a few things extremely well!

6NutSwXIrRyssOxRt5OZDQ.text: Tell them you're staying if you want your latte in their cup with a foam design. They didn't ask me and put it in a to-go cup. Such a bummer for me since my whole reason for coming was for a fun latte.   It was a 3 star but the menu still has me curious (half the fun) so I give it 4 stars. There are lots of vegetarian options (even a coconut bacon, bacon alternative which is shredded, roasted coconut with ketchup/liquid smoke and other ingredients that give the coconut a more savory flavor over a sweet coconut flavor. They also offer a V ice cream alternative).   (4/5) I got a small pistachio latte because of my love for pistachio ice cream. It did not disappoint in terms of flavor. What brought me here, though, were the pictures of the fun drinks with waffles on them. Visual appeal simply makes everything taste better. My latte got defaulted into a to-go cup  even though I was never asked for here or to-go. I'd even set up my spot to study and my drink came after 3 others drinks so there was time to simply glance over and see I was staying (not populated at all, regardless of the three previous orders). So if you come and want a foam design, verbalize that it's for here.   (2/5) I also got the kale chocolate chip cookie- the green cookie. I'm all about the healthy way of life but this did not make me want to stay on track. Yes, you could taste the kale. The cookie was fluffy (I'm thinking lots of flour), and had I not had my coffee I wouldn't have finished it. It wasn't sweet like a cookie, but it did remind me of a scone without the shape. I probably would have liked it if I was thinking I was getting into a scone, actually. Subbing out for larger chocolate chips would have also added to the texture in a positive way.   I asked a lot of questions, some were answered with "I don't know" with no intention on finding the answer (such as when I inquired about the different types of cookies) and others were answered by the guy making the drinks. I sort of felt like an inconvenience and like I should just go and sit back down because they wouldn't elaborate much without me 'pressing.' But the cashier could be new. I don't know.   I loved the menu. It looks really interesting and I love places that have originality.   The restaurant didn't have a warm, cozy feel but it was nice, nonetheless. Fun, far chalk wall mural. Actually, chalk was the main art theme. I liked it.   The music was reggae. I dig. Perhaps a little loud. Startling at times.   Definitely give this place a try, though.

OchRJXWfesxAkLsZtt2GHQ.text: Is there anyone here willing to argue that waffles aren't delicious? That's right, I rest my case.   Anyway, this place was not exactly what I expected when I read the Yelp reviews... I was picturing a cute little cafe with table service. What I got was essentially a coffee shop that happened to have waffles in a strip mall. This is not necessarily a bad thing, it just was completely unexpected. I was planning on getting a waffle and egg sandwich, until I found out that they use those weird egg patty things (they don't, you know, cook an egg), so that was out. Ended up getting the Elvis, waffle with peanut butter, bacon, and banana.... of course this was good, how could that be bad?!?! I also had their specialty latte with the cinnamon that comes with a triangle of the cinnamon vegan waffle (got the latte sans vanilla syrup, you know, being healthy and all... lol).... oh ya, super tasty. Definitely a dessert. The waffle was crisp and delicious, the latte was sweet and dessert -y. The breakfast was cheap and satisfying. I would return!

apH-Cx8ZXtR3RC-P9m8QhQ.text: I have never wanted a local business to succeed more than this one. If you are debating "Is TIABI the right place for me to eat?", I must ask you to consider the following  1. Do you like food? If not, this isn't the right place for you. Actually, you should probably go to the hospital (please see my Yelp! reviews on my favorite hospitals) 2. Do you like food that tastes delicious? 3. Do you like breakfast, lunch, and/or dinner? Do you like smoothies? Do you like coffee? 4. Are you a vegan? If not, are you an omnivore?  If you answered yes to all of those questions, then you will probably love TIABI. Waffles are cooked to a perfect texture that's not so chewy/thick that you want to die halfway through. All of the smoothies are delicious (my personal favorite are the Health Nut and the Avocado, but you do you). Breakfast, lunch, and casual dinner options. Additionally, very extensive vegan menu. Do you have an enemy? Don't tell them about this place. Do you have friends? Do them a solid and meet them there over a Waffle Macchiato and a Break The Fast sandwich.

gtg77faKmgU94QpPrMGS4g.text: An unexpected treasure. From the outside, I wouldn't have assumed such a delightful experience. I came to TIABI after purchasing a Groupon and assuming it was much closer to where I live. Though we drove 30 minutes to get to TIABI, it was worth it 100%. When you walk in, you're hit with a wall of delicious smells. Then choosing your meal is nearly impossible because EVERYTHING sounds incredible. I highly recommend any waffle with Nutella on it, as well as the Tiff's Waffle Macchiato. It's basically dessert for breakfast, in the best possible way. The service is fantastic. Come, enjoy the free wifi and delicious food, and then come back and try something else on the menu!

4RvT8FHLUqikIEaGCbZ_sw.text: This place is near the UNLV campus and is amazing. I go about every other week with one of my good friends.   I really like this place and the food is delicious and all fresh made. I am a big fan of avocado and a lot of there waffle-witches have avocado on them an its so appetizing and filling. They have man options too, including vegan options which is really nice. This is perfect for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. They have amazing coffee too. The drinks are so yummy and cute. They have a special menu in front of the cash register as well. They have a lavender vanilla latte that is so yummy and it has a soft lavender flavor. Also, I am not a big fan of honey but they have a honey creme latte that is so soft and decadent. It makes me smile and it is perfect.  The workers are also very friendly! They are also so nice and help out.  This place is serve yourself though, so they make the food and the coffee but you get the utensils and the maple syrup on a table across from where you pick up the food.   They are always packed in the morning when I go and I really enjoy coming here.

1bRdbRAWlQBQrtW1ksnYPg.text: I've been here twice now, both with Groupon or LivingSocial vouchers. The food is very reasonably priced without them, so I'd probably go back anyways. vkYsvYR6yK6RN-YAr7nk3Q.text: This place really took a beating on Yelp from some of my friends. Did they have a bad day or what? Maybe they've just improved overall? I love this place so far.  TIABI has been over on Maryland near Flamingo for a quite a while now. Maybe it's just out of sight, out of mind for me (since I haven't been to neighboring restaurants like Sakana that often), but it's certainly not too far from one of my workplaces. I was able to stop by for lunch to try their menu at long last.  They seem to be having some issues with music skipping (streaming lag perhaps), but it's a pretty quiet place either way with plenty of seating for studying or just enjoying food and drink. Baristas have all been friendly so far, and it was easy to use the Groupons that I'd recently purchased.  The iced Snickers coffee ($3.35 for 20 oz large size) is appealing, even mildly addictive. Although it doesn't perfectly capture the peanut-y essence of the candy bar, its chocolate and hazelnut combo are a reasonably sweet flavor fusion that provide both fuel and happiness. Plus, it's quite reasonably priced compared to other places.  The West Coast waffle sandwich ($6.59) is an obvious choice for a savory lunch. I was pleased first and foremost by the lightly crispy and spongy, fluffy waffle that's creased so that you can just pick it up. The chicken and bacon satisfied my carnivorous sensibilities. The delicious, fresh veggies (avocado, tomato) brightened the dish up. Finally, although the sauce wasn't that distinctive alone, it served as a perfect complement. Nothing was limp about any of this.  I went for the Pumpkin Truffle Latte ($4.65 for a large) on my second visit, opting for hot rather than iced. What a treat. It's a perfectly sweet, creamy drink with a moderate spice accent, and I wish it wasn't just a seasonal item. Maybe if I just ask nicely and bat my eyes, it won't be just seasonal? It's the drink that has finally sold me on that whole annual fad.  I also had the seasonal Zombie Waffle ($6.50). This red velvet waffle has bacon cooked on the inside. I had to ask because they're not immediately visible, but using a knife (obtainable at a station near the counter) to cut and even cross-section the waffle, I saw the thin fatty strips. This dough otherwise had the same texture as my wafflewich, which means it rocked. Flavor-wise, it's actually mostly savory, with the chocolate syrup drizzle serving more to accentuate the red velvet batter than to tilt the balance toward sweetness. This also needs to be a year-round treat.  TIABI has impressed me so much on my two visits that I wish I hadn't been so apathetic before. It's a great spot for caffeine and fuel to carry you through the day, and I'll be back even after I use the last of my Groupon 3-pack.

My husband ordered the West Coast Wafflewich (waffle folded in half with chicken, Tiabi sauce, bacon, avocado,tomatoe and cheese) and I ordered from the Waffle Bar a Golden Waffle with Thrifty vanilla ice cream, strawberry, powdered sugar and whipped cream. Hands down this has been the most tastiest & creamiest waffle I have ever tasted.   When in town come to Tiabi and check this place out you will not be disappointed.

GhiInc3ExZkzpqSxfA9kdg.text: What Will You Get At Tiabi Coffee and Waffle?  Tiabi Coffee and Waffle is a rather unique counter-serve waffle place in Las Vegas. Located at 3961 South Maryland Parkway, it is at the Mission Center just north of the main UNLV campus. This place has some appealing waffle options that are different from what you'd expect elsewhere.  This spot focuses heavily on unique waffle creations. These include traditional waffles as well as some sandwiches that use waffles.  A Different Approach  Tiabi Coffee and Waffle is a contemporary dining spot that offers various types of waffles. It has many vegan food options and plenty of different coffee choices. It was established in 2013 and continues to be an entertaining place for waffles.  This spot has a rather modern look that isn't too unique or different. Still, it is an intriguing place to visit. It has a friendly look to it that stands out as an inviting spot for all members of the family.  What Does It Take To Get Waffles?  The food here at Tiabi is excellent but it can take a while to get. We waited about twenty minutes to get our food. However, we assume that this is because the food is so intricate and designed with an immense approach to detail.  The people here are friendly and do well with getting orders down. They always ensure that the food is made precisely as desired. The fact that these people can work with vegan requests if desired is an attractive point too. It ensures that people can get a great waffle even if they have particular limits on what they will eat.  Great Foods All Around  The foods here start with plenty of great signature beverages. Tiff's Waffle Macchiato has cinnamon vanilla macchiato with a churro waffle and whipped cream. This has a brilliant design that is creamy and detailed.  The Stiles Java Jolt has a vanilla breve misto and vanilla with a bit of extra espresso. This adds an extra amount of caffeine to create a good taste. Various frappes and teas are all around the place too.  The creative nature of this place is particularly highlighted in the waffle sandwiches it offers. The Waffledilla features chicken, Tiabi sauce and melted cheese and an optional avocado. This is carefully made with waffle patties to establish a great flavor all around.  The classic options here are interesting to see as well. The Strawberry Kisses waffle mixes sliced strawberries with a chocolate drizzle. The Viva Las Elvis waffle has bananas and peanut butter plus chopped bacon. A bit of honey is added to create a stronger flavor too.

roJ3Xi-W8RmXKHQ-r4jgww.text: Arrived at 11 am on a Sunday - not too busy with just one group in front of us and the tables were moderately filled. No matter how many people are here, be prepared to wait a looooooong time to get any food or drink. The restaurant itself reeks of old oil or some sort of thick grease smell that stays in your hair and clothes for hours after you leave.  Took 25 minutes to finally get my Tiff's Waffle Macchiato with a kind of cold, moderately crispy churro waffle. The drink itself was sweet and tasty, and the whipped cream is quite thick. But 25 minutes for a drink?? Way too long.   10 minutes later, got the Red Velvet waffle w/ whipped cream, strawberries, and bananas. Boyfriend ordered the Waffledilla w/ avocado. Although good, it looked and tasted like something I could easily make at home in half the time.  People who came in after we ordered would order food to go and get it in 10 minutes or less. Some would then sit and eat inside. Maybe the key here is to order your food to go regardless of eating there or actually taking your food to go?  Will not be coming back due to the extremely slow service and decent quality food.

0MtiAX0QrJLx2N3owsVRJg.text: Customer service: 5 stars   Food: 4 stars because this place is no different that any other waffle place around town.   Location: 1 star because the area is horribly run  down And completely inconvenient to get to unless you work nearby or attend UNLV. Also the inside needs some serious TLC  All around I'd give it 4 stars because it was good, but it's not worth a drive to eat there.

XrDejDvV6wXuYsGp6qdzSQ.text: I was looking for a quick bite and pick me up so decided to try Tiabi's on my lunch break. It wasn't busy at all and I was glad that the service was great! The guy who took my order was helpful and friendly, it made the ordering process easy.   I ordered the signature drink - Tiff's and it was good, I like the top off of a cinnamon waffle! I ordered a savory sandwich (forgot what it was called but it had chicken cheese avocado and the house sauce) it was pretty good.   They have a decent selection of drinks and quick eats, I'd go back if I was in the mood for waffles.  Overall the quality of food was good, the staff was friendly. The only critique is when I sat down the bench was wobbling and the table was sticky.

grfIFZ294E95dsvLPiIkDA.text: Coffee and waffles? YES PLEASE!  Came across this great spot on the Yelp app - on the hunt for something sweet. We skipped the coffee, but sure got our sweet tooth craving fulfilled with one of their delicious waffles.  They have various waffles to choose from with toppings such as nutella, banana, strawberries, chocolate and other sweets. Then they also have savory waffle sandwiches with bacon, turkey - and even egg and cheese!  We stuck with the Banana Tella which has banana, nutella drizzle, almonds and whipped cream. You can make any waffle a "dessert" by adding a scoop of ice cream. YES PLEASE! The waffle was incredible. I would of liked more of a "home made" whip cream - this one was possibly from the can - but it was still great.  We got the chance to chat up the owner and she was so nice! We asked her about the concept and apparently it started as a coffee shop - then they wanted to add some desserts and decided waffles would be a good fit - then decided to hit the lunch crowd so they added the savory waffles. Genius!  Awesomee concept - great folks working there - and a delicious product! Wish I had tried the coffee! Aw, well - gives me reason to come back to Vegas!

Honestly my friend ruined waffles for me. She made a ton one time, 3 different flavors   The one that stands out in my memory was the cookie butter flavor. These waffles were so insanely delicious that now whenever I have waffles, I compare them to the ones my friend made and they are never as good. The other issue is I'm personally more of a fan of the Belgian variety of waffles over the eggo variety. Tiabi has more of the eggo variety, thin and crispy rather than thick and somewhat doughy. They have a nice presentation but I'll probably not visit them again.

p12bGYQiYeobJFp6v6KNGg.text: This place just happens to be right next door to my favorite sushi spot in Vegas (see review for Sakana) so i'm really surprised its taken me this long to try out.  The girl working the counter was super bubbly and nice which is exactly how I want to be greeted first thing in the morning. There is nothing worse then someone working at a coffee shop in the morning who hates mornings.  We ordered:  Tiff's Waffle Macchiato- 4/5  Great flavor and I loved the cute little churro flavored waffle piece that topped off our drinks! My only disappointment came when they were presented to us in plastic drink-ware instead of the cute little mason jars we saw pictures of here on Yelp.  Bananutella Waffle- 4/5  Came out perfect with just enough crunch on the outside and soft fluffy waffle goodness on the inside. Covered in Nutella drizzle, bananas, and sliced Almonds. It was very, very rich. I ate 1/3rd of it I had to take the rest to go. I feel like this would of been better for dessert, too heavy for breakfast for me at least.

joZrCcMP9t9dMHHcYCCeiw.text: When I entered, no one greeted me. There were at least 5 people on the floor. I looked at the menu for 3 or so minutes when someone finally said they'll be right with me. I ordered their waffle macchiato because it sounded delicious. It's supposed to have a cinnamon sugar waffle garnish.  It took a while to make the drink which it fine. It's hand crafted, blah blah blah, but then he handed it to me without the waffle and he said, "the waffle will be right out. I just don't want the espresso to expire."   why not give me the full effect and make it correctly? Why not wait until the waffle is ready? The lack of urgency and receiving a deconstructed version of what I ordered - killed it for me.   The drink wasn't bad, not great, but not bad & the customer service needs some help.

Jvxr3W1-zQoLRFfbgi-_dw.text: The setup of the cafe is nice, there's large tables for big groups to comfortably sit at, complete with a deck of playing cards to entertain you until your food is ready. There's lots of chalk writing on the walls with a bunch of UNLV references and other scrabble, which gives it a local and laid-back feel. It was kinda cool but the colors get obnoxious if you stare at them for too long.  I was pretty impressed with the waffles here. I ordered a sugary cinnamon one, and my boyfriend had one of their waffle sandwiches. I think the only thing slightly disappointing was the coffee. I got a pumpkin spice drink, and the espresso/coffee they made it with tasted burnt and old.  I'd probably return here, but not for the coffee.

VJqCe_lVNxpxeHqnDKG7Og.text: Tiabi is a cute little place hidden in a strip mall. Their concept is simple: WAFFLES. They have waffles for everything, with everything. Waffle breakfasts, waffle sandwiches, waffle coffees. We went here in the afternoon when it was slow; no lines and plenty of staff running around. My party ordered three food items and three drinks. The first two waffles came out in about 10 minutes. The third took 30 MORE MINUTES. The first two were done with their meals (and then drinks) before the last waffle came out. There were three staff members basically standing around looking at the waffle makers. No one looked like they were in a hurry to get our food out. There was no apologies or anything as to why the food took 40 minutes after ordering to be prepared.   The food and drink were good once they were out, but I expect a business, whose sole food item is waffles, to be able to put out items in a reasonable amount of time. I suggest they order an extra waffle maker (or dozen) so this isn't a hamper on their business anymore. I sincerely hope they fix this, for an otherwise fine cafe.

Z7eHB9UU0Tn8RoIHTF9SNg.text: I literally just left this place and already ready to come back for more! I had the kale champ smoothie( which was actually amazing, with 2 full cups of kale) and the Elvis Belgium waffle: peanut butter, banana, savory crispy bacon, and honey drizzled on top of this light flaky waffle! I'm glad it wasn't burnt either because I HATE burnt waffles! Friendly staff and if you're a Unlv student you get 10% off your bill! I WILL be back to try more things off their menu!

nKzV3OuqMgAyp9N9UytZ8Q.text: I recently found this cute little place by the UNLV. They served waffles and coffee. I love the decor here, comic books around the wall supporting local comic enthusiast. Chic, clean and smells coffee throughout.   When you walked in, you will see the huge menu in the wall. The menu was simple and inviting. I decided to try the sweet waffle today: banana nutella and pistachio coffee. The waffle took a while to be ready but hey, it tasted soooo good so it was worth the wait. Waffle was crispy, light and gluten free! What's not to love. Pistachio coffee was also perfect, I tasted the delicious coffee, pretty strong coffee, it smelled really good too. To be noted, they support local coffee, good to know.   I am so glad to find this place and will be back again to try their other waffles!

TGbSoImIlENIGsgxWcglEA.text: Tiabi was great! I got a waffledilla lunch special recommended by Adrian and it was honestly the best waffle I've had! I took the suggestion to add avocado to it and it just topped the whole sandwich off perfectly. Service was great and I will for sure come again, thanks guys!!

eEAjGK6xiRQBZpLj2LjhHg.text: I visit Las Vegas often and this place is mine & my family's go-to place for breakfast/brunch, but sadly the last time we went on Friday the experience was sub-par. The line wasn't long and we were able to find a table quickly for it being busy! We ordered Strawberry Kisses, the Breakfast waffle, a plain churro waffle, and 2 large iced twilight lavender lattes.   It took about 20-25 minutes for our lattes to be ready. That's a bit too long to wait, but we didn't mind too much after tasting it because it was delicious! Unfortunately that's where the positives end. It took 58 minutes for our food to come out. While we were waiting I could hear multiple parties complaining on the wait time. At some point they also had to deny customers because they could not keep up. There was 3 workers working but it didn't seem like there was any leadership so it was unorganized, which may have contributed to the long wait times. When we finally got the food they were not that apologetic that we had to wait an hour for 3 waffles.   The Strawberry Kisses & churro waffle was quite good and had crispy outsides. The Breakfast Waffle had good flavor but for waiting an hour the waffle was extremely soggy. It's unfortunate that the service was bad, maybe it was an off morning. Will probably come back for their Twilight Lavender lattes, but the hour wait wasn't worth it for the food.

jdrVQdhzIbmLm9Hbb4M92A.text: I didn't think I'd be that impressed by a coffee shop that specializes in waffles and I was correct. I guess if you view it as a coffee shop first and a waffle shop second it's not so bad but I think most people that want breakfast want more options than just waffles. I tried the pistachio latte and build your own red velvet waffle with Thrifty ice cream and fruit. My boyfriend had an iced Americano and the bacon waffle sandwich.   I was surprised to see that the coffee came in to-go cups even for a dine in order and I heard the couple behind me remark about the same thing. I guess if their menu shows pictures of fancy lattes with designs in a mug, that's what I expect to get. Regardless of presentation the coffee was quite good. I asked for skim milk and assuming they still used skim milk I found the latte to be very creamy with a nutty pistachio flavor that wasn't fake or overpowering.   As for the waffles... they're just waffles ya know? My boyfriend's breakfast sandwich was pretty bland. If he hadn't added bacon to it it would have just consisted of scrambled eggs and shredded cheese. Adding the bacon added a bit of flavor but without drenching it in syrup it didn't taste like much of anything. Plus think about the texture of a waffle and scrambled eggs.. bacon is pretty much necessary for a crunch factor. My waffle was a little better, it had a bit of crunch on the edges and the red velvet was rich and gooey in the center. My favorite part was definitely the Thrifty ice cream though. I had a choice of strawberries and/or bananas for the fruit and I just got the strawberries. Overall it was a bit of a sugar overload and I can't see myself eating here very often if at all. Prices are definitely a little steep for what it really is. Not understanding the hype of this place at all.

RD_EXZbsdJTQ5-jTGouInw.text: I really like the concept and service at TIABI. Laid back atmosphere where you can hang out solo or with friends. There are people working on their laptops or hanging out with friends. Their specialty is their vegan waffle. Either sweet or savory they have options for both.  There is a a big board on the left when you walk in for the menu. The customer service at the ordering  counter has been consistently friendly. I've had the West Coast waffle sandwich and that has chicken, avocado, bacon, and their signature aioli sauce. I really like it, but sometimes I get it without the bacon. Their chicken waffledilla is a quesadilla made out of waffle instead of tortilla. Very cheesy and hits the spot when you're in need of comfort food. The only drawback is that sometimes the food takes a while to come out. I've tried calling ahead for pick up, but was put on hold for a while and ended up driving there instead. However, I'm never disappointed when I get my food though.   I do want to differentiate that this particular shop has a more soft and fluffy texture than a super crispy outside kind of waffle. I personally like the softer version, but for some people the waffle texture was too one noted. I have yet to try their dessert versions, but the strawberry and whipped cream seems to be very popular when I've dined in. The prices are very affordable too. Lunch with a drink will be around under ten bucks. All in all, it's a cool and casual spot worth giving at least a try. May call way ahead of time before the busy lunch hour, but it's definitely on my rotation of lunch options.

x_EihssgYF8azpwBXO88ig.text: To Inspire & Be Inspired - So this place and me go way back. I found them when I was still a wee one getting my Bachelor's degree at UNLV. The two owners were super sweet and Alumni rebels!!! I have not seen them in a while though :( I loved the Snickers coffee. It was not too sweet and a refreshing addition to their tasty waffles. The waffles are crunchy and a great vessel for their sweet toppings. If you are in the mood for something a lil' sweet... highly recommend this place to settle down that craving! Also, make sure to use 10% off Yelp check-in.

I came at a good time since they offered an afternoon special. I ordered the waffledilla with a coconut truffle iced coffee. The waffledilla was so delicious and packed with cheese which I enjoyed very much. The coconut truffle iced coffee tasted delightful as well. Before leaving, I ordered my boyfriend a snicker's iced coffee that he liked very much. Now that I've gone once, I want to come back over and over again. Luckily, since it's near campus, I can imagine myself studying here or stopping by for a snack.

KSV6_ABX7xNeiobbjMnz5g.text: Gluten free waffles aren't easy to come by! I ordered their Banana Tella Waffle, which was good. If you're looking for a super soft waffle, this isn't for you. It was pretty crunchy, which I didn't mean. I also ordered a side of scrambled eggs, and a Twilight Lavender Latter (with almond milk) which was A-MAZING!! Staff was super friendly when I went to pick up my order. I definitely recommend this place if you LOVE waffles!

My friend and I came here for some grub before a music festival and thought this place was unique and had great reviews. Those reviews did not disappoint.  I ordered a West Coast wafflewich and since I'm not the biggest fan of bacon, they allowed me to sub it out for ham. This one entree was freakin' amazing, and I need to come back to Vegas to eat here again. I think my friend ordered one of the sweet waffle entrees, and I'm sure that was good too but I don't quite remember.  The place itself looked nice, and the service was great. Looking forward to coming back.

scIxhjsxc8bxdy6F7ZTE-A.text: Nice service and nice tasting food but not all ingredients are fresh. Not sure about the waffle mix but my sausage, egg, and cheese waffle had a perfectly round egg that looked like the ones that come in the frozen breakfast aisle at your local grocery store. For the price I was expecting a more "home made" taste rather than fast food. In the end, I will probably go back again though if I find myself on Maryland Avenue (#DMVnative).

Yxvns9baLG36Z6f16Hhc2g.text: I really love this place. They make an amazing cappuccino, great shakes, and I love the 'kisses'  regular styled waffles. So good. Haven't had a bad tome here yet, so glad I found a great coffee shop, way better then any big time coffee shops.

DlvYbnabnWguHiNUum0bTg.text: When I went the second time things were missing on my to go order. I spoke to someone one the phone and she told me she would take care of the next time I went. Then when I went back I told the snobby girl about my things that were missing, and she says well that's a lot of things for you to forget, well I'm not the one making the food to go and bagging it so that was not my problem, so she acts like I'm begging her for a cookie, chips, and the waffle side that comes with the tiffs coffee. I tell her to forget about it, then she tells me it'll take 30 min for my order to be ready so I told her never mind and she has the nerve to give a 10% off for a future purchase which to me it was a joke.  I was not asking for a discount I just wanted the items I had paid for that were not in the bag. The customer service was very poor, how is it my fault things are not in my bag when I'm not the one behind the counter, you have the technology to keep track of orders and is not being used. I would never step a foot here again and waste my time.

3A1gEAVXRwZP9uiV6nclXQ.text: Amazing waffles and coffee. Service is great.  Staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is awesome.  We are in town for a few days and will definitely be back.

tpYjhNmyF0-_s5vkzRuRwA.text: The guy forgot my drink. The food tasted oily. Value, quality and service can not compete with Dougie J's Cafe, not even close. Will NOT recommend this place. I am going back to Dougie J's .

OLrNHiN3sTQl3QFhT0exBQ.text: Taibi is AMAZING!! The staff and owners (Tiff & Mae) are super friendly and make some awesome food! This is gonna be one of the main things I'm going to be missing now that I've moved away from LV.  For UNLV students: there is wifi and electric outlets for studying AND a discount if you say you're a student.  For vegetarians and vegans: there are some great options and the variety keeps expanding. Also, they have almond milk options for all coffee drinks! Hint: try the "Maddie in a Basket" (vegan wafflewich made with a kale waffle)

WQGR49qYD_QkM5wevaHBuQ.text: I made the mistake of discovering this place on Groupon as something new to try while visiting Las Vegas. The deal was for 3 - $8 vouchers to be used by 1 person with only 1 voucher per visit. Understood. So I go over from the Strip and plan to order and leave then come right back; then I was going to come back again before leaving town. Well I get there and they tell me I can't leave and come right back because it has to be on a different day or at least a few hours later. I tell them that is not ideal because it's a $40 taxi ride roundtrip from the Strip, plus that is not what the fine print says. They tell me it's up to them to determine what qualifies as a visit. I tell them that needed to be included in the fine print since they want to stick to the fine print. They said it's their decision and I can't leave and come back within a certain time period. ((So if I order something and decided it was really good and want another one, I have to wait a few hours before I can come get another one with my Groupon. Foolishness)) At that point I didn't want any of the food because the poor customer service and the bad attitudes of the employees made me lose my appetite. So I can't comment on how it tastes. But as far as the customer service and employees' personalities are concerned, they left much to be desired. If you don't mind crappy service then go for it. But if pleasant service is an important facet of your dining experience, then don't waste your time.

VtQ75FWhjxjJ9NrNNv5ImQ.text: Staff were really friendly and welcoming. They have really yummy drinks, teas and coffees. Their waffle sandwiches are really tasty. They serve their drinks in cute little mason jars. A great little hangout for friends and also a cool place to study.

7e4QgSvcolHfw66BuKnilw.text: Tasty waffles. The vibe is still being figured out but the variety of waffles and what you can put in or on them is good. A hip little trendy spot that offers coffee drinks and a variety of savory and sweet waffle options.

qYjqjT-Q8ZAyz-b941puxQ.text: Friendly service and great Belgian waffles , must visit especially if you are  Vegan.

vym93Mtqggp9w6GaLpbK_A.text: We were on vacation and stopped in since we saw a groupon and we were glad we did! I got the banana Nutella and upgraded it to a Belgium and it was super yummy! My husband got the break the fast which was also really good. I got the red velvet drink and my husband got the pumpkin pie spice drink and both were good. We went around 1 on a Saturday and there wasn't many others in the restaurant, but the service was friendly and helpful and the food was fresh

i0mNKpbgOqdm3AjUr9xC7g.text: Avocado smoothies and awesome waffle sandwiches. Vegan friendly and the food was delicious. Small hole in the wall type place.

Cegd8USsZReHpyRh4JIY1g.text: Great selections and coffee! Waffles are too crispy..almost burnt! I would recommend asking for them not to cook your waffle so long, unless you like them that way!

_gBmX6koZnmbpWkBnKMcbA.text: Saw a Groupon for this place and was intrigued. I was surprised that after attending UNLV the past few semesters that I had never heard of this place from anyone since it's so close to campus. It's a a whole in the wall with wonderful charm. I really love that there are decks of playing cards at every table and board games to play if you so desire.  Now for the food, my boyfriend and I asked for the cashier's opinion about what was popular and we went with four of her top recommendations. Both she and the guy in the back were super nice and helpful. I ordered the Kale Champ and one of the waffle sandwiches. My boyfriend got a hot caramel coffee (which they brought him a cold version instead of the hot he ordered, but he enjoyed it) and the Elvis banana peanut butter bacon waffles (Seriously amazing, the crispy bacon worked so well with the all the other ingredients, a must have). Everything was really delicious and despite the small mix-up we'll definitely be going back again.

93rp-ePeQsI1OVR_ILG9lw.text: Solid food - interesting menu and concept with traditional waffles, sweet and savory waffles, waffle sandwiches and all things waffle.  Quality of food is very high with very good quality ingredients, and super friendly staff.  UNLV location and staff/ownership with UNLV connections is a major plus - they appear very committed to UNLV and the general community.  Great to see good quality, creative and fun places like Tiabi develop in this neighborhood, which benefits from this type of energy and creativity.  Highly recommended.

Kb2TsFzIucNV9IF5zNz28A.text: Do not eat here!!! Gross waffles, I am assuming someone screwed up the waffle mix recipe that morning because if that's how the waffles taste everyday I'm truly surprised that place hasn't gone out of business yet.  The waffles just had a weird texture and an off taste. They just did not taste right. We also ordered a "hot" coffee but it was cold, probably had been sitting out all day. If you serve nothing but coffee and waffles you better have fresh brewed hot coffee and decent waffles but they couldn't even get that right.  Worse than the sub par food was the service, when the server came to check on us and asked how the food was I told him it was not very good and he just said "okay" and avoided eye contact and walked away! Wth!!! What kind of service is that?! No apology, he wasn't even interested in asking why I didn't like the food for the sake of feedback. He did not offer to call a manager over, just said "okay" and left... That is NOT OKAY!

iKFLDZvYeUhzGDLDULvgOg.text: You had me at vegan baffles and almond milk. nom nom nom. Two things which are very hard to find, especially in Vegas. The boyfriend got The Hof (he's the carnivore) which was this pretzel bun with roast beef, arugula, cheese and agave-mustard sauce and loved it. I had two vegan waffles with macadamia nuts and strawberries with an almond milk latte. I also got the kale salad to go and it was really good. Not too heavy on the dressing. Just perfect. Really cute spot. Not the same boring menu you see everywhere. Very attentive service, good prices. Really happy I found this spot. Taste buds happy :)

FI0Zl--eAvl-81xIUQo83A.text: I have always loved unique coffee houses! They peek my interests when I travel and I enjoy when they have a good, cozy vibe. Above all, the coffee must taste great and not be ridiculously overpriced.   This place is so delicious! They have friendly service and prices are reasonable. On top of all the yummy coffee options, they have tasty food. The second you walk in, it smells amazing. They are waffle bar and I often find myself having random cravings for their bacon waffle, but they have great sandwiches too! They have tea if you're not a coffee person. No matter your mood... you will find something here! Also, the names are fun and different. Definitely a change to your average coffee house.

hJkrgnendapqinu5vK9M7A.text: At first glance this place looks like any other privately owned coffee shop. When you walk in the mood is calm and relaxing. You're greeted with a smile and upon looking at the menu excitement builds as you can tell that this is no ordinary coffee shop. It becomes obvious that the proprietors Tiffany and Mae put a lot of effort into creating menu choices that are not only healthy, but delectable and unique. The coffee is wonderful and flavorful especially if one's tired of the over roasted bitterness of Starbucks and many others coffee. As far as the food goes I have trouble ordering anything other than either the hashtag breakfast sandwich or the mixed berry salad. My favorite smoothie would definitely have to be the kale champ as it is not too sweet and tastes incredible.  frequent this establishment as I feel others should as well. Oh yeah and if you're having a bad day you should pop in for an ice cream waffle. It makes everything better.

y6ufa675fSlAkF5lfrJ65A.text: Great food and awesome service! Staff and environment are very welcoming and friendly. The Velvet latte is delicious!

eoFVCaEk3lXTHid4Rd9A-A.text: Tiabi is great for a lighter version of Belgian waffle plates! It's located next to Target and there's a huge parking lot. I was a little hesitant to order the Bananatella because I thought it was going to be one of those heavy hitters that would make you feel overly full, bloated, and that it would be like having dessert instead of breakfast, but it was just perfect! The waffle was light, warm, toasty, and cleanly presented. For me, the dish was a good amount of sweetness topped with banana, almonds, and whipped cream. It definitely filled me up but if you're coming in famished, you should probably check out the savory wafflewiches. The woman taking our order was super friendly and was more than welcome to give us suggestions. I can definitely see this place being popular with UNLV students because there's a couch closer to the front of the store, free wi-fi, and random decks of cards at the tables but since it's the summer right now the place wasn't crowded. I'll probably have to come back and try some of the other items on the menu!

RsfAWhLZS0LqS306ShLCYw.text: This place is has got to be one of my favorite spots locally for coffee and a quick bite in vegas!  I've tried the vegan Wafflewhich and not that I'm vegan but thought I give it shot and it was DIVINE. I will definitely be going back to try the rest.

HqR2LbZ2Tc7IM3jq63jkZw.text: Ordering process takes forever. Spent at least 10 minutes in line with only three parties ahead of me. That being said, waffle macchiato is delicious as was the West coast sandwich. An inexpensive breakfast just barely worth the wait.

rupApzkNppxTY3BPmiQzBg.text: There's nothing that makes me more happy than a crisp, delicious waffle and a lovely latte.    This is exactly what I found when I wandered into Tiabi Coffee and Waffle last week.  A coffee date with a couple of friends turned into a couple of hours of eating, sipping and go-fish.    (This place has cards on every table and when you're sitting there you can't help but pick them up and start playing card games from childhood, which was a blast.)  I ordered the smore's waffle -- which probably wasn't fair because I've made some extremely delicious smore's waffles myself in the past..  But it was quite delicious! My friend ordered the bananutella waffle (which I actually preferred to mine) and my other friend ordered a waffle sandwich + the captain berry crunch smoothie (which was bomb, but only order it if it's all you're going to have because it was dense and filling and super sweet.)   I have already been back to this place to order the Honey Cream Latte, which was amazing and will definitely have to make a point to stop by whenever I'm in the neighborhood!   The staff is very friendly and the place is inviting.

QCgyjzI3eK7MCwOHYqVStA.text: I came to Tiabi to scope it out for future use with my dessert meet up. I am not hugely familiar with that area, but it was easy enough to find. Up the street from the Boulevard Mall, in the Target parking lot.   When I arrived I was kind of nervous because we were the only people there on a Saturday around 4pm. I took the lack of business as a bad sign, but I was wrong!! Maybe not enough people know about it?? I'm not sure, but if you aren't going to Tiabi, you are totally missing out.  As I said, this was a recon mission, so I had to order a little of everything, right?? We ordered 3 of the Wafflenuts - the white chocolate macadamia, the red velvet, and a vanilla one that wasn't listed on the menu. For waffles we got the Strawberry Kiss, but instead of strawberries we subbed bananas (on a Belgian waffle) and customized a classic waffle with blueberries and white chocolate. Everything was fantastic!! Everything was cooked to order perfectly. Hot, melty, sweet and so delicious!! I almost always get a to go box, and this is one of the few times ever that it was so good...I couldn't stop. No to go box needed.  The have lots more on the menu I would like to try...including their coffees. I am excited to go back. I, also, heard there might be ice cream coming in the near future. Fingers crossed!!  You should definitely check them out. They are worth a drive even if you don't live down that way. They are pretty affordable...$20 for everything I ordered plus a bottle of water. Portions are perfect...not too big or too small. The establishment is clean and relaxed. They have games and decks of cards on the table should the mood strike. Staff is super friendly and helpful.  I will definitely be back!

Q2GGy1zdz5whP220xhiWcA.text: Enjoyed a simple Mother's Day lunch at this fun spot in the Target shopping center. We each got a different waffle and shared. My daughter always goes for the breakfast sandwiches and got the Hashtag sandwich. She loved it. I got the Waffledilla and the hubby got the West Coast Wafflewich. All were very good. Unfortunately, their Belgian waffle machine was down, so we couldn't try that type of waffle. Also, the drinks look yummy, but we just opted for water. Service was very friendly and there were games and cards around the tables leading to a killer game of War (I did not win).  Looking forward to returning soon to try one of the sweeter concoctions.

GiJEfj4l3Bh97I7mgRU8Qg.text: I ordered the breakfast sandwich and substituted the bacon for avocado. It was a dry waffle with a side of smelted cheese, 3 tiny slices of avocado and frozen eggs than were disgusting.

wSN-hHB5vFSwVBV8K5JZsA.text: This place was so so good. Got the pecan candied vegan waffle just for kicks (not vegan) and coffee with almond milk and vanilla. So fantastic. Can't wait to try this place again. They seemed to have a fantastic variety of fresh juices too.

sCYC98G7t50ZIFar5sjiJg.text: The waffles and coffee here are good. Honey in coffee? I know sounds weird, but it's good. Wish they had real eggs  though, they only have egg patties. The utensils could be cleaner, they had a lot of hard water spots that might bother some people.

Iy4wr9dkSmfZOFh_G2qeWw.text: Every time I visit here I try something new, I have never been disappointed! The wafflewich is a must try! I love how fresh everything is made, I leave with a sweet satisfied feeling every time. I like the vegan/vegetarian options as well. Friendly and helpful staff keep a positive atmosphere, one of the reasons I really like this place

_ZvC9AxElLvHtI4CUCeA0w.text: Tiabi is on the Maryland Parkway side of the Target shopping center. Right now they have a tarp sign that says something to the effect of "Coffee and Waffles" instead of their name.  Although there is a chalkboard menu on the wall grab a menu to get the full details of the items. Order your food at the counter. Ordering was slow when I went, but hopefully will get better with time. Then find your own seat. I would recommend ordering 2 wafflewiches since they do not come with sides (besides chips) or adding items to your sandwich to make it bigger. They are petit. Here's what we ordered:  Break the Fast Wafflewich- The actual waffle is delicious. I like that it's a little sweet. It's also a harmonious texture combo- sturdy and moist. Inside were scrambled eggs, thin bacon, and cheese. The items inside were sparse and the bacon was the thin kind. The price is right (about $5), but I would gladly pay more for a fuller sandwich. I think next time I will ask for extra eggs and maybe avocado on the side.  B.A.T Wafflewich- Same great waffle housing bacon, arugula, tomato, and a delicious sauce. We also wished this sandwich was fuller. The tomatoes were great. I bet this one would be great with avocado.  Regular Coffee- I drink mine black. This coffee was a-ok and came in a to go cup.  Iced Americano- Also a-ok and definitely caffeinated.  I'll definitely be back now that I have a better idea of what to order. Businesses in this area need our support so give Tiabi a try.

j1MlwDAlEduYIvco_brlgQ.text: I found this place on Groupon and had to stop by after reading the yelp reviews. The shop itself was not very busy at the time, so it gave us some time to chat with the owners. They were super friendly and gave us recommendations on all their yummy waffles. I ordered the red velvet waffle, nutella wafflenut, and a Hey! Arnold. I loved everything, but the Hey! Arnold which is just an Arnold Palmer (cute name though!). My boyfriend ordered the Amaretto Power which was really good! We had a nice breakfast together & definitely recommend!

zf9U4k94Q9FQ5L_EjX_Q8A.text: Viva Las Elvis! A Belgian Waffle stuffed with peanut butter, topped with bacon and bananas! Sorry, no photo. It did not last very long!  Good coffee and chai. The South American Waffle Sandwich was pretty excellent, too!

YTOFYddf5_WcYgB76e1hjQ.text: Found this place on Groupon and had to go back! I've never tried waffles with anything other than syrup because I always thought it was weird any other way but this place proved me wrong... 6iQaU6CuXs2YXpVL9jXEpA.text: I ordered the Viva Las Elvis and the waffle itself was underdone, soggy, and not crisp. Batter was still runny inside of it. My friend's waffle was fine according to her. Will not be returning.

RnxRsVNGg9TsuT5BMBggQg.text: If you have not ate here, you should! Amazing little restaurant! This will be a stop every time we pass through!

n5Wavye7bsqso2Qs9uy0wQ.text: BOOM!!!  A hidden gem in LV. Great atmosphere and good food. Actually was so good that we came back 3 days in a row. So the food was good, but the coffee. WHOA!!!  They know their coffee. Literally the best coffee I've ever had. Seriously this is worth a visit.   Good food, GREAT coffee, and really good service. Definitely coming back to this place.

N3Z4a2TNlFZhOHjdoS8cWg.text: Very solid little cafe off the strip to get a waffle and coffee fix that won't leave you broke. The creations are also pretty darn creative so you don't really lose with any choice, sweet or savory.  I went with the Viva las Elvis cause peanut butter, bacon, and honey are a match made in heaven. My only complaint (and I feel like I'm disappointing so many people saying this) was that there was too much peanut butter. It completely overwhelmed the bacon. I also had visions about adding some chocolate to this dish so I stole a chocolate chip off my brother's waffle and yes, it was 100% worth it. Also, paired it with a honey cream latte - yum!  Brother went with the red velvet waffle. He said it was pretty simple, but it was still very good. Mom and dad shared their choices a wafflezilla and west coast waffle with a fruit cup. Both enjoyed the savory/sandwich twist for their breakfast and they were also impressed with the fruit cup which featured fresh chopped fruits. Mom had the pistachio latte, which is definitely more on the sweet, not really coffee side. The only caveat was that food prep was a tad slow. Each person's meal came out one by one. Hard to have a holistic breakfast this way....but it's a small operation.   All in all, it was a delicious experience.

It's also very cute inside and quiet, which I appreciate because I went in for breakfast. Much better than some coffee shops with loud music or loud customers. I'll definitely be back soon.

I was amazed that they had vegan options as well.   The honey cream latter was exceptional. It blew my mind.   I ordered the vegan waffle with daiya cheese and egg. Omg, I just can't believe how good it was!  They should open a location in Los Angeles :))))

yuhvBxMJw5arcPy28Wb0nA.text: Full from a weekend of eating buffets in Vegas?  Think again.  While you may be stuffed to the core, what you thought was going to be a to go stop at Tiabi Coffee & Waffle will end up being a sit down eat everything on your plate once they serve it to you no matter how full you are kind of afternoon.  It's just that good.  While you thought you were full, you didn't realize how hungry you were once you take a bite out of one of their delicious desserts, that they serve to you on a plate since it looks better that way than to go.
