kdKKAnOmM65u35-RAyMeAg.text: Great place. me and my lady tried it. food was delicious. service was very good. the woman was very thoughtful and took care of us. forgot to leave a tip though. felt bad about it. looking forward to returning even though its far from my house.

NxTSi3GU45LVMdzVfGGdmg.text: Great energy, good coffee, nice waffles and good people. Mae the co owner has a great energy

ESKhs7A3MrKkwokB4Nw3_Q.text: Really, really slow. I know this isn't McDonalds, but 30 min. to get half our order and another 20 to get the rest? This was 9:30 am and there were only 6 other people in there the entire 1:15 hours we were there. Really cute place, small portions at great prices; but it just doesn't matter when they are so slow. Seriously, the woman behind the counter was even moving slow, no sense that people might be coming to her food establishment because they are hungry. And - the reason for 1 star- I could see her work because I was facing the counter, she was handling all the food with her bare hands. Picking up waffles, slicing strawberries, AND taking cash, answering the business phone, texting on her cell phone, never putting on gloves to handle food AND never washed her hands. Disgusting, I won't be back.

iWwBjbPOTUd59N1oxtq_QA.text: Great Food, Great Prices, Great Staff. Can't really ask for more. I don't even really like Waffles in general, but I love eating the kinds that they make. They are really the kings in the Waffle game. Everyone there is real nice and the service was quick.

xnIDi4jESu1KX1_vmQm3Mw.text: This place is amazing! They have great waffles, shakes, sandwiches, salads, espressos and cookies!! There are tons of vegan friendly dishes too. It's a great spot, really happy we found it!

5XQ8dk5SWtOl6IkVRvxtaA.text: Their Waffle Carmel Macchiato, Bacon infused waffle and red velvet waffle sticks are TO DIE FOR! This place has it all and they are close to the strip and convention center for quick made to order catering needs!

j2bey184KXqTBKDuIZwGYg.text: Ordered the vegan waffle sandwich and Las Elvis vegan style. The coconut "bacon" was a very nice touch added on top of the agave, peanut butter and bananas. The waffle sandwich was the perfect amount of savory. Very good! Great coffee too! Will definitely eat here again!

RYDyG8lga75xE2Zql1nXLw.text: I've gone here twice now after buying a Groupon worth $8 each for three visits. My first visit was early in the morning on my way to work and I decided to try one of their lattes and salads out. I ordered the green tea latte to drink there and the kale salad to eat for lunch later on. The green tea latte was very good. The size was reasonable and the price is what's expected even without the Groupon discount. The kale salad was also very good, decently proportioned and reasonably priced. The lady that was working there was very kind and helpful. It's good to say that my first experience there was rather pleasant and I was excited to drop by again to try the waffles.  I came in the second time with my boyfriend so that we could both try the waffles. I was looking forward to purchase the red velvet waffle since red velvet is one of my all time favorite flavors lol. After ordering, I sat down and waited for our waffles to be done. I noticed an uncleaned table the table over us. This table was not cleaned the entire time we were there. Now, I used to work at a food establishment and I can be very understanding in certain situations. One, the place wasn't busy. There were probably 4 people eating including us with a few customers coming in to order. Two, there were three people in the back because I counted 2 guys and 1 lady. One of the three could have easily cleared out the table the entire time I was there. It's just professional to keep your establishment clean. The workers seemed rather distracted and too busy talking to each other rather than checking the dining area for mess.  We finally got our waffles after 15 minutes or so. I feel like that's rather a long wait for just two small orders of waffles. I ordered the red velvet one (of course) whereas my boyfriend ordered the regular golden waffles. We both agreed they were good after finishing them. They only gave us two waffles per order and you'd have to pay an extra $2 for another one. But for the price, you get what you paid for so it was fine. However, on the website's menu, it says that you get more with the waffles like bacon and eggs. This is very misleading because I did not. It doesn't say on the menu at the store so I wasn't so surprised when I got my food. I just think that the website menu should be updated so that future customers are not mislead.  Overall, the waffles were good, the coffee was good and the salad was good. The customer service may need a little work however.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Velvet Waffles

9I1ur6m8ife9gNqVxNmWbw.text: Found them next to our favorite sushi place. Delicous red velvet waffles with a pistachio latte.. yes please.

QZVwo5HDTRlt-xF4FxMP_A.text: Love, love, love this place. The staff is so nice and welcoming but the best part is the variety of unique waffles. You must try the Maple Bacon Waffle and the Red Velvet (so yummy and to die for).   I can't wait to return and try some of their other items.

sy0JS3eEyJZ7LyJsZFnfVg.text: Really chill place with breakfast options. Getting the iced coffee and Waffeldilla. Super clean place. Friends love this it too. Free water

s1hEPNkmxc8JqbmVyRj_dw.text: I had a groupon so I kinda went all out.  I ordered the Country Chick Sandwich with avacado, chips and a green tea, a chicadilla, the cinnamon sugar waffles, and the wafflenut with Nutella and almonds-- OMG I'm full!  This place is pretty awesome.  Definitely not a dieting place though lol... Their waffles have got to be one of the best I've tried.  Served up fresh and warm, the waffles are nice and crisp on the outside, and chewy on the inside.  Loved it.    It's located on the corner of Flamingo and Maryland in the Target complex.  Really chill environment.  Great for breakfast or lunch, or maybe a snack or dessert.  There were 2 girls behind the counter cooking and taking orders.  Super friendly staff.  I think they have wifi, because a lot of college students look like they were meeting to get work done.    Definitely enjoyed this place.  I just wish it was closer to my house!

fucnP_FOTCwmCc4TYNgbdA.text: Wonderful! Bravo! Excellent! The waffle is handmade and is so tasty. The special sauce of them is amazing. I'm a tourist from Taiwan. If i have enough time, i would like to come second,third,many many time even live near here!!!

9nN1Cw51OkNtGcsX0TpPjg.text: Excellent latte!   The smoothest and easiest drinking coffee I had on the weekend trip.  It blows away the $7 coffees on the strip easily.  Hashtag waffles - I have to assume they were excellent.  The kid devoured both of them in addition to the fruit toppings they came with.  This was the first time ever she finished an adult sized meal by herself!  Hashtag breakfast sandwich - This was good - the standard eggs and sausage.  If it was a runny sunnyside egg, that would have been much better.   I'd probably pass on this one to get a...  West Coast Wafflewich - now this  was a good combination of flavor and texture.  Put bacon and avocado on anything and you have a winner.  The sample of strawberry kisses was a nice way to end the late lunch.  I think i prefer the round crunchy waffles over the thicker style just because they retained their crunch.   But the coffee will definitely bring me back the next time I'm in Vegas.

KPF0bNb1eZmEc9NymxXBjw.text: I found this place randomly about a year ago when I was craving some breakfast food on the way to UNLV. Just a quick search for "waffles nearby" and I came across this lovely gem, and boy, I am glad I did! I've come here often enough for the staff to recognize me and have tried a number of things off their menu (and there's still plenty more to try!). I've recommended this place to people and have brought friends and family here, each trip ending up in a generally positive reaction the the food, atmosphere, and service. The waffles and drinks offered here are numerous and delicious. From savory wafflewiches to sweet treats, theres something for just about anyone. The most popular item amongst the people I've brought here is probably the West Coast wafflewich or the Bananatella waffles. But if you can't find anything tempting on the menu or can't decide, you're welcome to create your own. And that can be anything--drinks, waffles, sandwiches, salads--if you can think it, they'll make it for you. Just to prove it, my boyfriend decided one day that adding chicken to their Bananatella would be a great idea (he's an interesting one). And while our server found it an odd request, they fulfilled it anyways. (Surprisingly, it didn't turn out that bad!) For the less daring, my personal favorite is a customization as well: the Strawberry Kisses waffle with bananas, paired with the Snickers iced coffee. As for the place itself, the atmosphere is chill and welcoming. They have a nice rotation of music playing and a deck of cards on every table. The furnishings are quirky; tables with mismatched chairs, antique-style lights, and plenty of photographs and waffle-and-pop culture inspired paintings on the walls. It's a perfect place to eat and chat with friends or to catch up on some studying while sipping on some coffee. The servers are nice and friendly, always up to explain the menu and the new, seasonal items they're promoting at the counter (ex. Egg Nog Latte at Christmas-time or the Pumpkin Spice Waffle during the fall). The downside is that it gets pretty busy in the small space during peak lunch hours, and service can begin to get slow. The place isn't usually meant for a take-out and run, it's definitely better suited for people willing to sit, eat, and chill. I definitely recommend this place to the Leslie Knopes of the world. In other words, it's the perfect place for a waffle-lover with time to chat.

UXu-8G6HUw0yS7YmmyWTcA.text: Loved how they had vegan options. Very hipster scenery. We got banana Nutella waffles. Very taste. Really would like to try other options next time I'm in the city.

FCIJ1FPbogQfRhiwrXgFPQ.text: I got waaaay too excited at the thought of a waffle bar, but my wafflewich ended up just being decent. Swapping bread out with Tiabi's waffles didn't really change the overall taste of my breakfast sandwich, which contained eggs, sausage, and cheese. Their waffles aren't very flavorsome alone. I doused my order with srircha.   Despite my table's seemingly simple wafflewich orders, we were left waiting for our food for an unreasonably long time period. There were only two people working in the shop, sharing the responsibilities of taking orders, preparing and carrying out the food, and attending to guests. Needless to say, the service was definitely lacking. One of the owners actually asked my friend and I to wait before ordering, but she completely left us hanging. There was a moderate amount of people in the shop, but it wasn't terribly busy.   By the end, I don't think anybody in my party was super impressed with their wafflewich nor their wafflnuts, which tasted super doughy and undercooked. However, all of our meals were savory. Tiabi's sweeter breakfast choices might be a better option when ordering.

TLDg_EJAiR9nM9FGkykiUA.text: I was so excited to go to this cafe once I saw that they had waffle sandwiches because I LOVE Bruxie's waffle sandwiches, but they don't have one in Vegas. Tiabi gives you the option of the classic waffle (thin, round waffle) or a Belgian waffle (thick, square waffle) for the sandwiches. The classic waffle reminded me of the one at Bruxie, but the quality and service were lacking.   I ordered the West Coast sandwich and it was decent, but I felt like it was lacking flavor and thrown together a bit sloppily. I also got the red velvet wafflenut and it was super sweet, doughy, and just seemed like it wasn't fully cooked. There were only two people working, so it took us about ten minutes to order and another 20 minutes to get our food. For the amount of customers that were there, they definitely would benefit from having another employee.   Overall, cute place, vegan friendly, but they just need to work on their consistency and their service.

v-8PyDcvzisVCr_zShWy3A.text: Yummmmm! Hubby and I shared 3 different waffle sandwiches this morning and all 3 were phenomenal! We will definitely be back... There are so many more menu options to try! Not to mention coffees and smoothies... Gotta try the kale champ smoothie... So good!

6ymiJxjwMs5liAPF-JzGpw.text: Delicious food and they actually have good vegan options too! The Frankenstein signature drink was the best!!

jlLYgohO5zRRnSKEKr9xug.text: So I got myself the waffldella.  Who was the first time there surprise my wife was a red velvet waffle

6yuNukNPKpcd0pQYldZ2pA.text: Delicious!!! I got an avocado, bacon, lettuce and tomato waffle sandwich! It was great and just the right amount of food. Also got a coffee that came with these churro-esque waffles. Overall, friendly staff and had a cute atmosphere. Would definitely return the next time I'm in Vegas.

s2l02wkL-2QqjkMQdGu-Gw.text: I went there for the first time today. The waffles are fresh and delicious. I tried the Bananatella. It is two square belgian waffles topped with whipped cream, sliced almonds, and Nutella. The waffle is crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.   I am taking off two stars because the interior is unappealing. The decoration does not look good, the paint color is unappealing, the furniture is mismatched, the table looks old and dirty (even though it was clean).   Overall, love the food and dislike the atmosphere/interior decoration.

Very happy with this waffle house. 4 stars only because pricing is a bit higher than we'd like as well as distance.

IZZHmwZWWGPqQLUxO6fv2Q.text: I have to eat gluten and dairy free and they had options and it was awesome!!!! They are so friendly. I highly recommend this place for people with allergies and no allergies!

RlqomZ8mlbDORHj810-hfw.text: Excellent Waffles and awesome drinks. Great food for breakfast, lunch and brunch. Tried it out, then went back for more while we were on vacation. Great concept and good execution too.

QKUYA_01LIKnJaBMgI_rbQ.text: Banana peanut butter is fantastic!!  Daughter-in-law had the honey latte which was also great! Great service. Even though it was busy, the service was fast. Would highly recommend.

AriHtBcgbM9ZJXqdxU0kXQ.text: Waffle looked and tasted great!!  Lots of options if you like waffles, Just wish the bacon was thicker. The staff was very friendly and made sure you understood your options or would make something for you.

9OKtPebnr719JvF1D3ZiIQ.text: Love the pistachio latte and waffledilla. The staff is great. I always feel welcome. My 8 month old loves everything she's tried.   There's always people having meetings in here. Really a great place to catch up with friends, people watch a little, and waste some time.

tBXsdhJFdJaGpPW8_8S2SQ.text: Great hidden gem near the home!  Great atmosphere, and very hospitable staff. I usually get the waffle breakfast sandwich, which is an amazing concept. I also like the fact that it can serve, as a local starbucks replacement. The espresso is nice and strong!

2s-CSoqacXesU4zb5AC3Ow.text: Very friendly staff and the waffles are light, fluffy, and flavorful enough to be the perfect pairing with any sandwich or speciality waffle you get! I can recommend the West Coast Wafflewich and the Avocado grilled cheese from experience ;) Their Honey Vanilla latte was also just as yummy as it sounds!!

JLOy5VrfsAa8GrfmVXzdIg.text: False advertising!!!!! The place looks horrible... staff has whatever attitude... the food was blah ... picture they put on IG do not look like that ... the breakfast sandwich looked like dog food .... ... and I took my guests from Sweden here I'm so embarrassed

rKkDhQOuiGxAIxh-oGzjDw.text: I will and forever have a soft spot for TIABI. When they first opened, I LOVED the welcoming vibe the owners gave me and my friends. They stopped by our table and shared with us that they were UNLV alums (go rebels!) and friends who decided to open up this cute spot together!  Since their opening, I've tried plenty of their menu items. With my go to being the West Coast. It's savory and refreshing (thanks to the avocado). Other notable favorites include Kisses and the Red Velvet Waffle for those with a sweet tooth.  The only thing about this place is that you never know what to expect with service. There are times when it would be swift, friendly, and efficient. You are going to be welcomed with a bright smile from the cashier and get your order in a reasonable time. But there are times when you are greeted with a blank, cold stare as if you've obviously interrupted them with their cleaning and get your order after a longer than usual wait.  Do yourself a favor and if you are return guest, do a call-in order. You wouldn't wait as long and you have more time to eat and less stressing.

Xtg7MItfw8O9cB9GSjU8BQ.text: Random place my friends and I chose while yelping brunch, after getting gas. I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with brunch because he always misses breakfast. Right when we came in, they greeted us. Since it was our first time here we took a while to choose what we wanted.  I ended up ordering a West Coast. It was okay! I wish they put more chicken. The cheese melted with the waffle which made it taste good! I also ordered a honey cream latte. I'm no coffee person so I can't tell what coffees are good but my friends and boyfriend said it was "really" good. The last thing I ordered was a Red Velvet. I personally liked it because it wasn't as sweet. It kinda bothered me because it was so perfect... (Hahahaha). I had a weird urge to stab the holes... When I'm near Vegas again, I am definitely coming back!   Stars for the customer service! There was one lady who was kind of rude but then two other employees took her place right away when they saw our faces from smiles to me and my friend looking each other giving "She's so rude" look. (Yes, it's a thing haha.) Usually they would charge for Avocado and Chips but they just gave it to us for free with a smile. Thank you again! :D

j4BPdouwIOJG19Da698jtg.text: Excellent mom/pop Cafe in the Central area in Las Vegas near UNLV. The few times I've been here in the past months have been amazing. The Baristas are very engaging and accommodating to your needs. The owners are very passionate with Coffee and inventive with their food items that they offer.   **A little FYI, I'm good friends with these former green apron workers for years. If your interested about their background ask about their story and how they come to have a coffee shop. Personal favorite is Stiles Java Jolt and West Coast Wafflewich, must try items along with Tiff's Waffle Macchiato and Coconut Truffle Iced Coffee drinks. Ambience is pretty much straightforward with emphasis on artwork and pictures of random travels of the owners with a hipster vibe.   Cool place to hangout with friends and expect a lot of millenials and tourist here since it's near LV Blvd.

f6hq7lC0QVUquzgr8h-zHQ.text: (Longer review to come)  Tiabi is a much welcomed oasis in the hectic rush of Las Vegas. We tried the Savory Thai Basil and West Coast waffle sandwiches. Both were absolutely delightful - crispy on the outside and filled with fresh ingredients on the inside. We'll definitely have to try the sweeter waffles and drinks that they're known for. If you're a visitor to the city, it's worth the (very quick) drive to make it here. Much tastier and less soggy than Bruxie on the Strip.

JDrUJpQn7J8wXAz4QC6jCQ.text: Filthy!! It looks like the owner hasn't stepped in here in ages. When you order, you are looking at that filthy floor, filled with food remnants, looks like it hadn't been cleaned up since last night. It turned my stomach inside out. The waffle machine was filthy. So was the counter. There was no clean silverware. When we asked for some, the guy in the back wearing plastic gloves (who was just carrying a bucket of dirty plates) cleaned a knife and handed it to me holding it by the blade while wearing the same disgusting gloves! The garbage can by the door was gross, drips all over, what a way to be greeted.  There was no plastic glasses by the water fountain. That's what happens when you let a place be run by kids. No one cares and no one has any clue about food safety. If the health department had walked in there today, they would have had a field trip.  Oh, and the waffle we got served had a piece of crushed avocado under it. Gross. The coffee I was given had a cardboard sleeve with a bunch of grease stains on it and finger stains. Seriously!!  Gross.  It's a shame bc the waffle was actually decent. But the owner needs to start getting his/her act together or this place will close down in no time...

s53Bg6-2Wf6qtfPv4hU9mA.text: Great waffles! Met a friend here and we split the strawberry waffle and the peanut butter waffle (both have much cooler names, I just totally forgot them) and the waffles were nice and crisp and the toppings were very tasty. She enjoyed the coffee she grabbed there. Located a bit south of the strip and definitely was hustling and bustling but I never felt like it was too busy for great service!

rgRvuJ8UBml0cm5ED76skA.text: The best waffle sandwiches hands down. Great cafe atmosphere and the employees are the best. The food is great, the smoothies are great, everything is great. Can't wait to go back.

0UhLAXofI72Me0l_F6xPgQ.text: The customer service was great.  The shop was very cute. The coffee was delicious. However, I was not impressed with the food. I had a breakfast sandwich with turkey sausage and it leave me with a huge tummy ache.

B0ziSzY1m27ze0X0mn-7fg.text: Dude. Epic. Great small but complete menu with delicious coffee, waffle, and waffle sandwich options. Also vegan friendly if desired. Great service, everyone should try it.

VcoIN8ogCM1eskTzJkFh2A.text: Walked in. Got my hopes when at first it seemed quiet. Then realized it was just a pause between intermittent loud rap beats. Hopes dashed, I turned around and walked out. Still in search of that one-in-a-million cafe that doesn't blast music.

yGfNwX70N9g1-WG1UW8cSg.text: My boyfriend and I had a great time. The service was great and the food was so tasty and fulfilling. Definitely recommend and will be coming back!

6QXvnScKuDQsnaIJIP5G_A.text: Simple, tasty, inexpensive. At under $10 a person, my whole family enjoyed breakfast here, despite needing to push two small tables together to sit the five of us. Would recommend the banannatella waffle, twilight lavender drink was great, as was oolong tea. Staff were friendly and helpful. Inside could use a bit of sprucing up, and the location isn't the best, but I'm a fan nonetheless.

_uS9ifV3QeAN2qD8-aqd1w.text: Don't be fooled by the busy traffic.. TI...ABI. Yes! You said that right!  WAIT, Take a deep breath, don't pass out!  .. it has Vegan specialties!  This is the perfect place to have a simple waffle and a hot cup of coffee. Maybe you have more of an appetite...Well let me mention the waffle sandwiches. They are good! Maybe you just need a latte and a place to set down your laptop, they have plenty of tables and space for you to do that!  The employees are kind and take care of you promptly. They have fun there and it's nice to see an establishment where the employees enjoy working together!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9XxR6uwl8HPzpoJQpuA-sQ.text: This place is a hidden gem!  Their waffles are cooked right, menu items are creative and tasty. Coffee and tea is great quality and made fresh.   Their signature drink is Tiff's Waffle Macchiato and it's really good! Plus it includes a mini churro waffle to go with it.  I've had their Thai Basil sandwhich and it's great! Their Tiabi sauce is savory!  The avocado grilled cheese and west coast are both delicious as well. I like to get the tea latte and every time it's a hit.   I've been coming here for quite some time and  I always leave happy knowing the food and drinks were delicious and service is exemplary.  They off BOGO 1/2 off on Wednesday's and offer student discounts.   The place is clean, prices are fair, and waffles are wonderful.    Go for this local gem. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado grilled cheese
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large earl gray latte w/almond milk
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

oU6CFGtX6TsNmYyrtDNoMg.text: My friend and I came to TIABI because they had good Yelp reviews and it seemed like a quick place to grab a vegan-friendly breakfast before I took her to catch a flight. Let me start by saying that my food was actually pretty good - I had one of the (non-vegan) waffle breakfast sandwiches and a pistachio latte - my friend thought her waffle was a bit overcooked and also ordered a hot tea.   Although it was in no way under the restaurant's control, a health inspector stopped by just after my friend and I had ordered for a surprise inspection. This seemed to be a fairly standard visit to someone who used to work at a coffee shop and had encountered health inspectors myself, and in no way a reflection of poor practices. It was however a bit disconcerting that the staff seemed to fly into a complete frenzy and totally disregarded the customers in order to deal with the inspector.   My friend and I sat for about 20 minutes without receiving even our drinks; at that point we asked how long it would be because my friend had a flight to catch and were told about 5 to 10 minutes; we proceeded to wait for another 10 to 15 minutes without observing any action in the open kitchen, at which point we asked again how long things would be and were told probably another 5 to 10 minutes. In the meantime, we saw people who had arrived after us receive their food.   When our breakfast fare finally did arrive, we had to get it to go and rush to the airport. Fortunately, my friend did make her flight, but at what cost?

MW0wDxD2yqp3-c1wgQguXA.text: OVERALL: pretty good waffles, more of a snack of very light brekkie. Fast and kind service. I would come back.   WAFFLE: I am a big waffle fan and usually of Belgian specifically light and fluffy, not too heavy. This place had thinner waffles, not belgian, but I liked the texture of them. Because they were thinner it wasn't heavy, but if it were a Belgian waffle it would've been quite heavy. I had a churro waffle which was pretty good but a little too sweet for me... I dusted off most of the sugar cinnamon seasoning. I don't really have much of a sweet tooth, not sure why I ordered it. Retrospectively, I should've ordered the red velvet. I am a little sad they don't have sides like eggs or protein selections available either, but that would definitely require a bigger restaurant. It's more of a snack or light brekkie.  What I didn't know was that they're vegan, which I'm not much a fan of vegan and gluten free foods, I couldn't tell the difference.   SERVICE:  pretty fast about 10mins. They give you your waffle order and leave the strips on the counter for your ease of access.   RESTAURANT/SEATING: tiny restaurant longer than it is wide, however still can seat parties of 6. They do have a bathroom towards the back

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro Waffle

v8QiWMklsVxp4kia99hb-w.text: Hidden gem outside the Las Vegas Strip. It's run by friendly staff and the food is inexpensive and tasty.  They take Apple Pay and the food is made to order.  It's in the same place as Target, behind a cat tire dealer.

hmwMhS0wxb0q_viQUw7UGw.text: My sister bought me a Groupon for Tiabi for my birthday and I'm so glad she did! Bf and I got the California waffle which has chicken, avocado, bacon and their house sauce and it was soooo yummy! Couldn't believe their waffle recipe is vegan!! It's super fluffy and has amazing texture, I also got the Snicker's iced coffee which was surprisingly not too sweet. My bf ordered some kind of ice blended coffee which was just ok, a little too sweet.

is_APip-Vz2L43vJOPehsA.text: First and foremost...Jay was ultimately the most awesomely host and cashiers that I have encountered in awhile! The calm & graciousness of his soul really exudes from him from the very first words that proceeded from his mouth. The experience of being sereved by him was a delight within itself, even before we received ANY food or drink! Once the drink were ready they were very cold and both tasty with natural herbs (from the Citrus Mint) and beans (from the coffee w/Dark Chocolate). They both were hitting the spot! Afterwards, the food begin to arrive...first, the Avocado Grilled Cheese! Ping, Pang, Pow...it knocked whatever idea we've had for a grilled cheese sandwich, "OUT THE PARK!" The "just right" sweet flavor of the waffle combined w/the avocado and basil special sauce as well as cheese, was a perfect combination which provoked a symphony of taste throughout the palate! The other Waffledilla sandwich was not as tasty w/an AWESOME waffle still until Jay gave me some of honey sarachi sauce on the side, which elevated the sandwich to what was needed. Oh, oh, OH...dont2 let forget how awesome and "should be bagged" were their homemade crinkled chips were...just perfect seasoning w/salt!  This a "Gotta Go To Place!" Will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana/Strawberry Waffle
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffledilla w/handmade chips!
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado Grilled Cheese

Na8-66SbnvVGFp-y8w36mw.text: These people are saints for putting up with my indecisive ordering. Sooo, first tip is to take your time and read the whole menu before you go up to the counter lol.   Being vegan, it's extra difficult to find interesting breakfast food, especially on the strip. On this particular trip to Las Vegas, I had already had oatmeal several times, and I was ready to just skip breakfast at this point. Fortunately my friend found this place and off we went on a waffle adventure.   I was super excited at how many vegan and gluten free options they had. I ordered the Thai Basil waffle sandwich with a gf waffle and veggie patty. The flavors were on point, DH even liked it. He got something that looked meaty so I didn't even examine it. His feedback: "It was good" He had more rave reviews for the Pistachio Latte. I ordered the Waffle Late with Almond Milk and it was pretty tasty. I recommend asking for it less sweet if you don't like your coffee drinks super sugary.   The whole group (there were 5 of us) enjoyed their waffle sandwiches and we decided we would definitely come back on our next trip to Vegas. Yay for vegan breakfast options!

sa53rz_oXmO7p4YoIBKg5w.text: I'm always looking for places to try new coffee just because I really love the taste and tasting different notes and such in it. Unfortunately for this place I had left and had to throw the coffee away. Ordered a Medium Drip coffee to go to take to UNLV. They had made it really fast and to order which was pretty cool I thought, speedy service and fresh coffee will make me happy. When I had a sip it was anything but pleasant.   The coffee was lukewarm at most. When I make my coffee at home its right around 185-195 Degrees during its brew time in my siphon Coffee Maker. So it was a bit surprising that it was so almost cold. When I drank it my taste buds were shocked at how sour it was. It was definitely under-extracted. If you've had a bad espresso shot that was sour, just imagine a whole coffee sour. Absolutely horrible. Unfortunately I had already left and couldn't really go back. I ended up taking a few more swigs out of it and throwing it away due to how sour it was. For a place that has 'Coffee' in the name I was really hoping they wouldn't have messed it up so bad.

aBoWyihf-D-5fPs3XXzv1g.text: This is the new spot to come get breakfast food when I come to Vegas. I love it here. Well priced food that tastes and smells delicious. I got the Java Jolt and the Waffledilla and it was bomb.

mS3H9RJTYz4hXGdOmy28jw.text: Ewww. Come here if you like eating with utensils wiped with dirty rags. Seriously, we watched one of the staff wipe forks and knives with some gross dirty rag before handing them to us to use. Will never come here again.

Regrettably, I was underwhelmed with my  avocado grilled cheese waffle.   The wait time is painful and there appears to be one toaster oven used to prepare their crafted waffles. My waffle was flimsy and mushy with no crunch or boom boom pow quality flavor.   Pricing is reasonable and the coffee is decent. I did love my sugary cinnamon waffle slice offered with my drink.   Sometimes once is enough!

mVaxwf2DsZ5A1luVlaY1pw.text: Would I come back? Yes. Would I fly all the way to Vegas just to come back? Probably not. Service was fast and the staff were friendly. The area of town was a little rough, lots of homeless people in the parking lot and on the street. I got a golden waffle with strawberries, Nutella, and whipped cream. The strawberries were really fresh. I probably could have just ate those and been happy. The waffle itself was not very memorable. It's flat, not fluffy. I'm not sure if it's a special kind of waffle I'm not used to or just happens to be the waffle iron they use. The lavender latte was unique. I'm glad I tried it, but I would order something different next time. They had a birthday cake drink I wish I could go back and try.

kJgv0ftsVn8AFW2oVg7-Pw.text: Not impressed. Took over twenty minutes to get our food. No silverware available. Had to ask for syrup and was given a mostly empty bottle. The waffles themselves were thin and crispy. The red velvet waffles had better consistency but the golden waffles were more crunch than anything. The coconut bacon was coconut flakes flavor with bacon and left a bad aftertaste. I can see how this can be a good idea for a restaurant but I feel it did not deliver.

HNNh9x9PP6wUWJ0Ax9H8nA.text: Being 8 months pregnant, the waffle cravings have been getting stronger. This place did not let me down. The atmosphere of it is very unique and trendy. Definitely a hidden gem in Vegas. It's a nice little spot and the owners have really tried to change up the place and make it unique. As far as seating goes, there was were plenty of people when we arrived, it was about noon. My sister in law had to go snatch a table once people started to get up. The menu is simple and creative, you can even create your waffle (waffle base, toppings). I ordered the Strawberry Kisses (fresh strawberries, chocolate drizzle and whip cream, I added bananas). My bf ordered the Breakfast Sandwich, same as my brother and my sister in law ordered the Churro Waffle. The iced coffees were good and strong. My waffle was delicious and mouthwatering. The breakfast sandwich was a surprise. Let's say looks are deceiving, it looked simple but it just melted in your mouth with all the ingredients. The Churro Waffle was good but not a breakfast meal, more of a dessert. It was sweet and the ice cream on top completed the duo. Highly recommend if you're looking for something different and unique. The bathrooms were also nice and clean with a bit of modern decor.

xmz4Vb3besLNSdQaReei0g.text: Loved this little coffee shop in the middle of a not so great area. Was looking for a caffine lift and found this place nearby where I was. When you walk in it is a very cafe vibe-not so much coffee shop. The decorations are super cool and there is a lot to see inside this small place.  They have a nice variety of waffles both regular and vegan. I think this is a good choice for breakfast and even for vegans and non vegans so they can eat well together. They also have meat waffles such as bacon, fruit waffles and tons of other tasty choices.    They have a hot lavender Infused latte which I loved, and many options for cold coffee as well. If in the area its a great choice for a nice homemade waffle and a good coffee.

BRVnOGxWF_H5z85gPqX_NA.text: Cute coffee shop off the strip.  Coffee was good and the waffles were nice and crispy.  We ordered the waffle macchiato, tuxedo frapp and the Thai chicken waffle sandwich.

Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuxedo frapp and waffle macchiato

ozaRy6YSTEcOijXGrpWNDg.text: Bought the groupon so I had the opportunity to check out this spot 3 times. Suffice to say, after all 3 visits, I thought that it was OK.  I guess that this place focuses mainly on waffles used in a traditional sense, with sweet toppings, as well as savory preparations, such as using a pair of waffles as a bun for a sandwich.  First off, I would say that using the groupon was pretty difficult here. I had 3 of them, good for $8 to spend. The waffles ranged from 5-6 dollars, and the coffee drinks ranged from 4-5. You do the math. I think it would have been better to offer 2 $5 for $10, instead of the 3 $4 for $8.  The good news first. The fillings and toppings they use are great! For the hashtag breakfast sandwich, the egg and turkey sausage was cooked perfectly and well seasoned. For the Tokyo sandwich, the chicken was moist and tender, and the veggies were very fresh. The sauces they use are well balanced, the sweet ones aren't too sweet, and the savory sauces are packed with flava!  The bad news. I hated the waffle. I've tried both the thin waffle they use for sandwiches, and the thicker Belgium style one. My conclusion is that I frankly don't like their waffle recipe. They both had a strong metallic taste that resonated the more I ate it. This happens when I eat biscuits or other quick breads that use too much leavening, such as baking powder. This may be the culprit. The interior of the waffle is pretty doughy as well.   Also, it took a little longer that I though it would to receive my order. On my last visit, I ordered a waffle sandwich, lolly waffle, and small hot coffee, and I timed them at 16 minutes. It would be better than to rather than to stack 3 separate customer orders at the same time, it's better to do one order at a time, because the 2 other people received their orders 1 minute after mine was ready :/  The coffee is ok but pricy for the portion size. The employees are nice and friendly, but also they seem to be easily distracted.  Wasn't the worst waffle, but not the best. Slightly middle of the pack is where I would put them. If you are in the mood for a savory waffle sandwich, this place would be the place to go because no one else in town is doing it (RIP Bread and Butter). Liked everything 'cept for the waffle itself. 'Nuff said.

Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot coffee

DvWyOA011gYz3yIEn7flcA.text: Thanks to yelp. we found this local waffle house before we headed back home. Attentive staff and a place with characters. Decent coffee (had to have their Waffle Macchiato...its dessert) only one thing missing was they could of roasted the almond on the Viva Las Elvis.   Side note and its kind of unrelated: Why can we have a place like this in Tucson? Last time we had the lemon puppy seeds waffle at Mother hubbard's it was disaster...They effing poured the lemon syrup and sprinkled the puppy seeds over the plain waffle. And we waited for 45 min for that lousy waffle. Still pissed me off today!!!    Solid 4 stars.

DnRo4K-TVxkMbvmhqC-j6A.text: Sampled the southwest waffle sandwich and while I enjoyed the combination of ingredients I felt that the waffle itself was satisfactory. The waffle was not as crispy as I liked it and almost a little under cooked. The interior of the cafe was cute and I felt that it would be a cool place for friends to hang out.

7GJmojcX3OAox-ssc7r_wg.text: We've been coming to Tiabi's since they opened in 2013 and love it!  We bring all of our friends here.    The waffles are a great small size so I never feel over stuffed.  They are so light and crispy, made hot and fresh to order.  The hashtag is my favorite.  I love their coffee too.  We have never had a bad meal.  I highly recommend this place!  It's kind of hidden back around the corner from Target.

blBIk7YJ2IpNQDOVzhyCRw.text: Guru burger is the best veggie burger ive had in vegas (besides the ones I make)   Its just a boca burger i think, but its just so delicious wrapped up in a fresh waffle!   The vegan viva las elvis was tasty, but a bit skimpy on the toppings.  The lady who helped us was very friendly and helpful. I forgot to get her name but we went at 7 or 8 am on thursday.      Lattes with Lots of unique flavors here (like pistacchio)   Next time ill try the churro waffle!  I wish the prices were a bit lower or the portions a bit bigger, but overall i was very happy with my visit and cant beleive i waited 2 years to try it!!! Will def be a regualr!

ZFXYt8r4GR46LElMeQ_JlQ.text: Heading out of Vegas and was looking for light fare that was reasonably priced (unlike everything on the Strip).  Came across this gem on Yelp and had to try it out.  Had the veggie breakfast sandwich.  Yum! Girls had dessert for breakfast, which is fine because we are on vacation!  Would definitely visit again when in town.

ct8Ocvu2GuA3HK-bqYaNrQ.text: Came in for waffles at 6:00pm on a Monday. Place was dead. I thought this place had a lot of promise. But, it seems the kids behind the counter were distracted with their social lives and dating. My waffles came out cold as shit with no butter. When I got butter, the waffle wouldn't even melt. Really poor time management, we watched as our waffles sat on the counter waiting to be dressed while they did other things. Waffles weren't terrible, but who likes cold ass waffles? I asked if that's how they normally do and the apathetic kid said no, and would I like them to heat it up. Who like nuked waffles?  I'll stick to places run by adults. Too bad.

H6BML2qx36lV9xsy6iNCRA.text: YUMMMMM WAFFFLLESSS!! But really, the waffles are amazing. And the lattes I had were pretty darn good.

DGcvW1P6wnV1Z-hypIyvbg.text: I had the red velvet with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. One of the best waffles I've ever had.  They had a bunch of really unique weird ones. Like bacon with bananas which you don't think would work but it actually does.  Anyways, highly recommend if you're in the mood for something sweet.

1td29s2ivjkjbo07pgL43w.text: Great service / good vibes / great food.  Pros:   -Both Vegan & non Vegan friendly  -They have a all flavors for those who love sweet & savory as well.  -good music  -comfy seating  -VERY CLEAN   CON:   I can't find any to be honest

2ZkUaWviVRBO0S_-tai2Ig.text: Delicious local spot. Lots of sweet and savory options. I had the west coast and it was the perfect combination. My kids had strawberry waffles and my husband had the breakfast sandwich. They were happy to customize it and everyone was happy. I wish I lived closer. I'll def. be back next time I'm in Vegas!!

z78NpONtmANhnUo6zTLoPg.text: This will definitely be a go-to whenever I'm in town! I ordered an iced coffee with the West Coast waffle sandwich & it was amazing! Chicken was tender, avocado ripe, bacon was perfect, & waffle was soft with a nice crisp. The staff was very friendly & Israel was helpful in suggesting items on the menu to satisfy my cravings. Atmosphere there is was casual & cozy with good music playing.

WUxzMZNPm__N7oRGf4iklg.text: Wait time was way more than expected, 38 minutes for a waffle is insane. When my partner and I finally got our waffles, they were cold and hard.    My partner requested no whip cream due to her being lactose intolerant. Watching you guys scrape the whip cream off is lazy and unprofessional. There's still traces of whip cream on there...  Customer service wasn't very friendly. We found Tiabi through Yelp based on their reviews and the overall experience was NOT up to par. It was very disappointing.   Environment was overwhelming crowded. The layout is a bit compact and not ideal for a large group of people. We had to sit at a dirty table until 2 mins before we received our food. It was disgusting.   Our drinks (teas) were also not given to us until 2 mins before our food arrived. Water wasn't even offered.   Don't get me wrong, we weren't expecting Ritz Carlton service BUT the basics of dining at a cafe. We might try it again when it's less busy, but I would give our overall experience 1 out of 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We received cold waffles...butter didn&#39;t even melt.

DgWBkBnuuKKpN4CAR5hmow.text: I am thoroughly impressed with this cute, small,  and quiet breakfast spot.  The waffles are oh so good!  I got the hashtag breakfast sandwich with waffles,  turkey sausage, egg and cheese.  The waffles are made fresh and they're so good.  Also I tried the waffle Macchiato and although they took a long time to make the waffle for my Macchiato they gave me an extra waffle and it was muy delicioso.  I will be back even tho I live all the way in summerlin!  I will be recommending this place!

QD7Fr34Vb6Ge5UnFgnd5ig.text: Came in here cause of the reviews , I was expecting for this place to be soooo good and to be worth the drive , but I didn't like there food at all , the sausages  looked like there are just put in the microwave and they just tasted horrible .!!!!! I also had asked for one of there ice coffees and was expecting them to give it to me in the jar like the  pictures I've seen in Yelp , but they gave it to me in a to go cup !!!!! I seriously won't be coming back here again. There food is just nasty !!!!!!

n6knea9Cu6868X1aY9rOpg.text: Another fantastic visit! Had a vanilla cold brew & a waffle breakfast sandwich. The sandwich was DELISH and the coffee is so good that I literally look forward to the one day a week that I can drive across the Valley to have my fix.

UBO18I4N0U7kYT8Fmy112Q.text: I got the West Coast, and it tastes awesome! Couple it with syrup and it tastes amazing! My wife got the Banatella with strawberries instead of bananas and a side of vanilla ice cream and milk. Overall, I'm from Cali but I'm hitting up this place every time I come! Totally recommend!!

MYsS6PbNkdMbF8SlSKVJdQ.text: Eggs tasted like they were pre-frozen. Turkey sausage was cold, and inedible. Cappuccino was it's only saving grace. No need for apologize, or ask me to come be and revisit and give you a second chance. Sometimes in life you have one shot, so make sure each meal you prepare is a make or break. Save the long reply and just put your words into actions.

AuqJQunVmV-1S1j5KKNyDg.text: I ate here alone a few days ago and as far as customer service goes they were great! The lady at the front was very personable and actually conversed with me personally. Most places ask you what you want and want to get on with their day, but it's nice to walk into a restaurant for the first time and get acknowledged like they are happy you chose them as a place to eat today. It was a very cute/creative place. I love how there are cards at all the tables. I will have to bring my boyfriend just for that! Lol. I ordered the guru burger. (Vegan) and it was  interesting. I tasted the waffle and burger and it was weird at first but not gross. I definitely will go back. There is a few smoothies I would like to try.

boS409h4kX9ZyOLEyeyvYw.text: As I'm writing this review, my mouth is watering. I found this spot on Groupon. After some confusion about using 3 separate groupons for 1 person, we were able to order. Based on the line behind me, I knew the food should be good. I had the Churronimo which is the vegan waffle with cinnamon sugar and a latte. OMG, I normally don't order cinnamon sugar items but this was so good. This makes me wanna leave Maryland and hike it to Nevada. The "chefs" were friendly and accommodating. My only gripe is that it took a long time to get our food. Other than that, I would go back in a heartbeat.

Hef2HiDMOVW0YOJj1EjwIw.text: Had the west coast waffwich and it wasn't what I expected. It exceeded it! Great job guys. Def be back.

DA5KELUmyo5W5hz_lxBdUw.text: Wow. SO glad I stopped by this gem on my way out from Vegas! Small place with big flavor! I tried the West Coast with an added egg....delicious their coffee is pretty on point too, great morning after food options and the staff is simply awesome

h1jZA8C00_ZP6Ckix-YtKw.text: This place is a amazing find!!! Found them in a deal on groupon! This will be a stop on everyone of our Vegas trips! They have incredible food and the service was fantastic. Told them I was lactose free and the made my coffee with soy for me and even gave me the vegan waffle on my sandwich since the other one has milk in it - so nice of them to care!! The food was so fresh - they made the waffle on the spot as you order! I had the west coast and my husband has the break the fast - both delicious! We will be back. Clean restaurant too! Thanks for the yummy food! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. West coast!!!
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Break the fast! And iced coffee!

5fnfX5vIPVALx9JFZyA85w.text: My experience there was horrible food was cold i could have sworn i seen a roach i could be wrong i hope im wrong altogether the service was terrible the place is rude shut it down..

auU5Lxvj3M6x430PDlqYOA.text: West Coast waffle sandwhich. Nom nom. It was bomb. Tiabi is located across the street from Toys R Us. Definitely a place worth trying.

DqH1sCfo4inVlL55B4uL4w.text: Amazing food and great service! Nothing better then eating at a place with good food and smiles from the whole staff. Definitely coming back!

xMtuBQocIAOQicIieRyGuQ.text: Such a cute place with an awesome staff! The menu is very creative and have options for everyone-- from carnivores to vegans.  Although my order didn't come out how I had ordered it (hence the 4/5 stars), I enjoyed every bite.

IqQoOgwFZ4ZJEhfjzsVcCw.text: Fantastic food and coffee. We were all happy about our selections - the waffles are way better than anticipated as part of a sandwich or a quesadilla. The food took longer than expected for a counter service restaurant, but it was delicious and creative.

Zg8vilBNZpzg8vpuA8PU-A.text: I LOVE this place. My favorite restaurant hands down! Vegan options, fair price, and delicious fresh food. It usually feels like they don't really have quite enough people on staff, but I don't think the wait is ever unreasonable. Most employees are friendly and listen well. They give student discounts and have cool lil events every once in a while. They have also a Leslie Knoppe quote on the wall, so they clearly have it together. Definitely give this place a try. True Vegas gem

Tdve2fEQG2RzpqsxpuL38g.text: Literally sweetest group of people. The owners are very friendly with genuine, great hospitality. The food was AMAZING and extremely affordable. One of those hidden gems in town.

tLNjQyBb6lskq4sBA4YzZw.text: I love this place. The service was great and so was the food. My son ordered the waffle that looks like Pac-Man, and for the first time in a very long time, he ate it all! I got the red velvet waffles, and boy were they great. Their raspberry lemonade was to die for. My son actually got this but I drank some. Overall it was a great environment; they even had games and books to read which made it feel like a hangout spot.

1-gAfyUOtgRbg9U7BTqwOQ.text: Everything was awesome! Nice laid back atmosphere. Great food. Great price. Great service. I had the viva las vegas waffle. Banana, PB, and bacon. Will come every time I am in Vegas

wae9OSZx0Rb3TNzhIn-hQg.text: Very friendly staff, amazing waffles and the coffee was epic.  Try "Tiff's Special"!  It is a cinnamon latte topped with a churro style waffle.  Amazing!  Can I move the restaurant to the East Coast?!

ep5h7l7UCNIPHcSBx0M89g.text: The Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich was pretty amazing. I didn't quite enjoy the cold brew as much as I wanted, it was a bit too bold and not very smooth. Prices were good since I had a student discount. Would definitely stop by again for the breakfast sandwiches.

CQRL5y3sSlmrOJzJdrAPvg.text: A joke.  If all you want is a coffee and a waffle allocate an hour.  It took over five minutes for my mocha and over 25 minutes for a single plain waffle.  They weren't even busy.  Even worse was watching the cook literally man handle every waffle that came out. Hopefully his gloves aren't latex because he would send anyone with a latex allergy to the hospital with his pulling waffles hot from the iron off with his fingers and then flipping the waffle between both hands then shoving them back on to the iron if he decided it wasn't dark enough. Despite the constant fiddling my waffle still managed to come to me cold.  It couldn't even melt the butter on it.  Flavor wise its not worth anything. My mocha was so over chocolated that the only flavour from the coffee was a bitter under note.  As for the waffle it was so nothing I might as well have had an eggo or poured bisquick shake and pour into my waffle iron   Oh, and they no longer offer Belgian waffles.    Just skip it. Unless you are a hipster wanting to be seen to be tragically hip, there is no reason to waste the time.

NqhEcMI1ZgE9hE81n9re0w.text: Yummmmmmmmmm!  I cannot get enough of this place!  The kale waffle salad is our favorite!  We split that with the Californian sandwich!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale waffle salad!

9TTPGITPaUTtOqfSDV941g.text: I love this little place. Their coffee is phenomenal and the waffles are just incredible.

cr4Fyn4kVuZE2B5w41Bnrw.text: Heard about this place the other day . Wow the prices here are awesome. I had the lolly waffle it's a turkey sausage wrapped in a waffle it was great. I also had the west coast wafflewhich a avacado blt so good. I als had a great smoothie. I highly recommend this place the service was awesome as well.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qYccy9JTsfdNtH5zfyfm6Q.text: Yummy! We decided to find something to eat for breakfast of of the Vegas strip and thanks to Yelp found this great cafe! Great waffles and great coffee! Oh and the people working there are fantastic!!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute deco
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-VnIDixu_MfxKZFn_IVmUw.text: A must stop place. The name was discouraging at first but as soon as we walked it we knew it was going to be good.

FamIKjGagOiIi_aYKOl2EA.text: I would have given them 5 stars, but I don't know why they have been so slow lately. I LOVE them here. They have great coffee, the waffles are de-lish and they have a plethora of vegan waffles. The wait time is a little excessive though. I come in a lot and every time have waited over 30 minutes for my order! I never complain, but when this is a recurring problem then they should find a solution. I will definitely continue to frequent this place, but be warned that you'll be waiting a long time, so plan accordingly.

sQc3xdu35iZ3oUdDkPqDeg.text: this place is awesome! the food is delicious and the service is always so friendly and welcoming. i'll recommend it to everyone!

6D6CBs_V3wM00AqKiD4S4w.text: This is a small 3 person operation.  My wife ordered the bananatella Belgian waffle with a nutella drizzle, slivered almonds and whipped cream topping.  I sought nirvana by ordering a hashtag breakfast sandwich - Belgian waffle with turkey sausage, eggs and cheese.  I enhanced my sandwich with a generous douse of breakfast syrup.  Both entrees were very good as was the strawberry sunrise smoothie that we ordered to go.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hashtag breakfast sandwich
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananatella Belgian waffle
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hashtag breakfast sandwich

1A-abmg69wicJPHNlix7TA.text: I heard from some people in the neighborhood that a new waffle place opened up right down the street on Flamingo & Maryland Pky, so I had to try!  It's a small order at the counter type of place, but everything is reasonably priced (use a Yelp! check-in to get 15% off, or UNLV students get a discount as well!)  The special here is waffles done in all sorts of ways (with toppings, or as a sandwich in some cases).    I went with a waffle with almonds, bananas and Nutella on it for about $6.  The taste of it was OK, presented and cooked well, but nothing too special about the batter.  The disadvantage was it took what seemed like forever to get it (maybe just because I was hungry?).  I also got a hot chocolate which was just so-so.  For the price it's a wonderful place, and it's close to Target so I could see coming here for brunch and doing some shopping, I know I'll be back, but the location and low pricing is the main driver.

LY5hKWTyWAD9aMDGJqW2WA.text: Even worse, the response tries to make me wrong! I'm the paying customer, hello! I'll take my money elsewhere. I feel personally insulted. Awful customer service.

0M275uc4cp74noMUs0A6Pg.text: This place was great! Fantastic coffee (pistachio and their notorious waffle coffees were amazing!) Waffle breakfast sandwiches were terrific. They ran out of turkey sausage which sucks, but even with bacon, the sandwich was really good! Would highly recommend! Affordable and great tasting food and coffee.

HUuVb5vamLafpW3pov7jqA.text: Great place for waffles! The employee, Israel, great customer service and did an excellent job with mine and my girlfriends food!

1J-O5BBJg0IKN64U9g2ecw.text: I am seriously impressed by the quality of these waffle sandwiches - they're not just tasty, the avocado and all the ingredients I have regularly are top notch. Amazing. They may take a little time to make, BUT I promise it's worth the extra couple minutes. The owner is extremely genuine. I never review stuff - but I really am singing high praise. Been back about six or seven times. Waffle breakfast sandwiches for the win!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;Break The Fast&#34; + avocado.

CpT1qztgrufwaM8hogC71Q.text: Wonderful restaurant!! The man at the front counter was extremely helpful, as this was our first visit. We came here Tuesday afternoon for lunch. I had one of the wafflewiches and it was so delicious and filling. Also, all of their food is very reasonably priced. I wish we had some of these restaurants on the East Coast. I know my friends would love it! Such a nice concept and laid back atmosphere.

TEz5rtSGVPWKsr3jBlTJ3Q.text: Best darn waffle I've ever had! If you're visiting Vegas, this place is definitely a must! Good food, great service! I subtracted 1 star only because they are so busy, they can't clean off the tables fast enough and seating is limited. Still, I would return in a heartbeat, it's so good!

DeyFX6WVS_w84gANnyELjw.text: This place is amazing! Fantastic service, really good food and drinks! My best friend and I were visiting from out of town and stopped by this awesome little spot. We are both vegetarians so it was perfect for us. Take the time to check it out!

-KiE4-MYVt3CNtNbhDZtlg.text: We are from out of town and looked on yelp. We found this place and decided to come. It is kind of a hole in the wall and a little hard to find. When we came in  though it was really cute. The person at the front was really nice. We got a kisses waffle that was really good. Not like a waffle i have tasted before also got a vanilla latte with whipped cream that was super good. The bacon waffle also looked good. Next time.

StyReTLw5qEEG53gZODIfA.text: This place is so cute! It has a great atmosphere, the staff is really friendly and the food is great!

a7SCDedwcGH3LcynKsjifQ.text: Oh my god. Go here. Skip your fancy brunch plans on the strip immediately and come to Tiabi instead.  I was hungover AF after a wedding and pranked my meat-loving friends into coming here for breakfast so I could get some vegan waffley goodness and WOW did Tiabi deliver some awesome flavor.  I got the waffle breakfast sandwich (mine had avocado, egg, vegan cheese, and sriracha) and it was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. The lavender twilight latte is also amazing. Even my carnivore buddies liked this place (they have bacon waffles too).  The staff are so friendly and the interior is great - lots of comic books and a comic art wall to display local illustrators' work. Really just an awesome place overall.

DaD0MoaU1JgHz4kyXB3zOA.text: Omg. Hidden gem. I had the bananella waffle replacing the almonds with candied pecans because i didnt want almonds. This was amazing. I chose to eat the sweet waffles and it Truely did not disappoint. I had a side of turkey sausage patties. I really didnt care about those. It was dry. I should have gotten bacon. Cant go wrong with a side of bacon. We had the Just peachy green tea. That was pretty good too. Nice and refreshing. My sister got the West Coast. The tiabi sauce is to die for. I would come back for that sauce. If you want savory, get the west coast. Overall great place to have breakfast. I would come back. I would have given 5 stars. I subtracted a star for the turkey sausage. My only disappoint. Dudes that work there was very nice and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananatella with candied pecans instead of almonds with a side of turkey sausage

ZpXn24PcEXTnoarvhzfTWA.text: Came here earlier this afternoon and I was pleasantly surprised how good this place is ! I'm not a waffle person (I'm personally a pancake or crepe person) and I absolutely LOVED my meal here. I passed by this place probably a million times since it's near UNLV but decided to come here since I got a free coupon from my school for their Tiff's waffle macchiato. I ordered their West Coast waffle which had chicken , their signature Tiabi sauce , melted cheese , avocado , tomato and I subbed their bacon for egg instead. It was pretty delicious and savory for breakfast/brunch and it wasn't too pricey ! And I was impressed w/ their waffle macchiato - I loved the cute little churro flavored waffle. Service was very friendly however they make everything by order so don't plan on rushing here to eat if you have class , etc. Also it's not a good place to study , tables are a bit dirty - it's more of a place to just to sit down & eat. They have Groupon and Yelp-in deals available too so more of a reason to come and try this place out :) and vegan options available. Will be back again to try the Savory Thai basil waffle and other menu items !

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiff&#39;s waffle macchiato
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. West Coast waffle

DLj4XW046QTnH6s_2ZNWLA.text: I think this has to be the most California place I've ever found in Vegas and I loved it regardless. Waffles, coffee, smoothies- what more could you want from your neighborhood cafe? Service is pretty fast and super friendly.   Wish I took a chance to try more items off the menu, but I'll just have to wait until next time I'm in Vegas. Glad I ran into this gem of a place.

n-dJRZBJDztNJ0PJetIFtQ.text: Not bad. I come here because it is so close to UNLV. Good drinks- try the waffle macchiato!  Food is A-OK. I like that they have vegetarian and vegan options, but the waffles and sandwiches aren't anything too amazing or memorable to me. It's worth a try if you're really into waffles, but for me the food menu items are just whatever. So far I've had the cinnamon waffle, elvis, and vegetarian wafflewich. I'll keep trying more items and update if anything deserves recognition. The location is a bit shabby so I make sure to bring my stuff with me. I wouldn't think of this place as comfortable- so it's not a place that you would want to study at. Eat, chat a bit with friends, and go.  As for customer service, don't expect too much. They get the order done.   Groupon has some deals for this business ($24 for $12 or so), so be sure to check that out.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the Waffle-dilla. Cheesy!
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan wafflewich

UU7gOPwcFf4yEEVfk4-ciA.text: OMG I would be here every day if Tiabi were in my neighborhood!! Waffles are one of my faaaaaaavorite foods and these waffles do not disappoint. I think these might be the best waffles I've ever had. And when they are made into a wafflewich?!? Wowwwww, that's just.....wowwwww. So freaking good!!! We ordered the breakfast wafflewich, the Thai basil wafflewich and the bananatella on our first visit here. We came here twice in 3 days. Luckily it wasn't hard to convince my husband to come back since he thought these were delicious too! Yessss! Waffles FTW!!! :)  On our 2nd visit we got another Thai basil wafflewich (obviously our favorite!!!), the west coast wafflewich, the maple bacon, and the Elvis (with bacon, honey, AND peanut butter! All were delicious, can't say a bad thing about any of these waffles.   Thank you Tiabi for the awesome service too, we will def be back!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thai basil chicken wafflewich - our favorite. We got this one twice!
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Elvis!!!! Peanut butter, bacon, and honey on this already delicious waffle :)

6zSmO-3yTOxbcePjB0LILw.text: The coffee is disgusting . The host is rude and doesn't care that you have been waiting in line to hurry up and take your order . The tables are so dirty and the waffles are not great . I don't recommend it at all and I am never coming back

cgXXibV2Kl7aYzrcBqOq8w.text: Churro waffles are absolutely genius! If you are in Las Vegas, take a side trip parallel to the Strip on the east side and grab you a churro waffle. This waffle is thin and crispy, generously sprinkled with cinnamon. Add powdered sugar. We got double ice cream. We forgot to redeem our 10 o/o off check-in offer. They kindly honored it after we already paid. Great service and food. This was one of the best things I ate in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churrowaffle with powdered sugar and double scoop of ice cream
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall menu

v5B36uCMGDvHZqc-YgbBfw.text: This place is soooo dope !!! Get an amazing deal off Groupon which is why I came. But the price is so inexpensive for a great meal! Easily would've paid full price ! It's an cafe atmosphere so really quiet and peaceful. The food and coffee is amazing! Aesthetically pleasing and tasteful as well! Easily would be a top spot if on the strip !

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FYA3FCGuiqvYeyt_8kwBEQ.text: Decent little spot for coffee and waffles.  Tried this place out for the first time today. First impression as you walk in sort of an island feel. Good amount of tables/seating. Friendly customer service. We ordered a "bananatella waffle", which was basically a decent sized waffle with bananas, whipped cream, and a drizzle of nutella. Satisfying, however, seemed to have skimped on the nutella a bit. For my coffee, i ordered a small size drink (two shots of espresso blended with almond milk and ice) It was made perfectly to order.  Two stars missing are for the price, my small coffee beverage cost over $5 and i was just a little disappointed by the meager amount of nutella on my "bananatella" waffle.  Overall, would probably not return due to the price of the coffee, even though i did enjoy it. :/

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananatella waffle. Presentation was great, waffle was made crispy and soft on the inside, but not enough Nutella :(
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Custom small drink, ice blended double shot with almond milk, and vanilla

OeNCjBeFK3noYqiHB5XObg.text: Holy!! This place totally delivered. The staff was very nice and were super accommodating with my slightly high- maintenance order. I tried the TIFF's Waffle Macchiato and SHOOT! It was delish. This will be my go-to place any time. The churro waffle was great as well.

T7ctE5WuKoWmSyK2NBqOpg.text: Awesome! Priced just right and atmosphere is cool. Twilight Lavender Latte was on point!

ReOO_ikN5-BEPEwEoh6VZw.text: The waffle I ordered was the banananutela and it was fantastic. Great texture because of the shaved almonds and perfectly cooked. The coffee I ordered was an Americano and it was also excellent. I now have a favorite go to when I am in Vegas!

YZdRUFgRMoUraEyfcX7bEA.text: This is the best place for waffles and they are so good. They make waffles with whip cream and strawberries with chocolate. The waffle is so good that you don't even need syrup. Then to the drinks I tried the snickers coffee drink and it actually taste like snickers in drink form.

JHw6w-emfiT89hrkYIf84g.text: A churro waffle?? What a goldmine! Was craving a midday snack so I dragged Mom and sister out to try it out.   Looking at yelp reviews, I expected it to be more or less a Belgian waffle with cinnamon and sugar (which still sounds delicious). However, this waffle was much thinner than a Belgian. This kept it nice and crunchy, even with a huge scoop of vanilla ice cream on top.  Super delicious! And the staff was very friendly. I'll have to again next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro waffle with ice cream

w2wOFQA3DFcE1umrRGtTig.text: Smells great and decent pricing for a waffle bar. Busy staff so may take a while to get food.

-fM0Tbdr-5BGIwg5r_gBJw.text: The frankenstein was very good. Six shots of espresso and agave or honey. I was on a low carb high fat diet so they offered to replace the honey with heavy cream so thoughtful

O5GQxOLfVlz5IMCdF0IzRA.text: Got a coffee here once and LET ME TELLLLL YOU BEST COFFEE EVER!!! I also got that waffle sandwich and it was very delicious  can't wait to go again

-wuR8tz9YH4dyI4zUzDf-w.text: Its descent. Worth a try but nothing special. I had the chicken & waffle sandwich. Its good i enjoyed it but nothing special.

1VYWAkIrNTFslE2hfrZCQQ.text: Great waffle bar, very affordable. Go for the great choices & yummy buttery waffles. Family friendly, nice environment. The sweet & savory choices were very good. Mocha latte & wild berry lemonade were delicious. The only negative was the bacon. My family loves breakfast and the bacon tasted like microwaved bacon. The staff was awesome & they even brought my baby girl warm soy milk...lifesaver.(that's like her morning coffee-she can't function without it) Overall we really enjoyed this place & we will be back, everyone gave the waffles a 10!

xJiipylxiTsKLRlac9TrOA.text: Been coming here years. Always a solid 5 stars! Aye!   Friendly staff.   I bounce between the Viva Las Vegas (waffle topped peanut butter strawberries, banana, honey) and the waffle bfast sandwich(waffle egg, cheese, avocado basil leaf, tiabi sauce)   They have even gotten quicker in pumping out orders.  That used to be my only gripe.   So good didn't even take a picture! Aye!!

L5s9pKzhO7dK0DyrDIZKmw.text: If I could give this place 10 Stars, I would.  Pronounced tee-yah-bee, is definitely a #Vegas gem and glad to see many other locals keep this waffle cafe busy.   I ordered the Viva Las Vegas. The bacon bits and mix with peanut butter and bananas on top of the waffle was the selling point. I'll be back many more times to try their waffle sandwiches.   The prices for everything on the menu blew my mind because it's worth it as they cook from scratch! At least it tastes like they do. It's not the typical humongous servings. It's ideal servings.  I didn't do this, but the people in line in front of us did: CHECK GROUPON FOR DEALS.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check out Groupon before you visit the cafe. They might have a good deal before you visit

xyY6i8NJID2BEO122RTDjA.text: Finally decided to check this place out after constantly going to Sakana next door. We tried their cold brew coffee (really good), their strawberry waffle (fresh strawberries on an excellent crispy but fluffy waffle), and the Waffledilla (I added avocado and would recommend to everyone to do the same). We loved everything, the only thing I will do differently next time is to add more cheese to the Waffledilla. It was delicious, don't get me wrong, I just hoped for it to be a little bit cheesier after seeing pictures of it online. Will definitely give it another shot though and will also get the churro waffle next time to try that out. But this place is definitely worth visiting.   PS: the interior design is great, from the different seating options to star wars pictures and the picture line of totoro's adventures in the back.

RnkDINa42GFvdGpoirPcnQ.text: The spot was on point, had the breakfast sandwich with turkey sausage and the waffle was hot and fresh, coffee was hot & delicious!  Found me  a new spot for BK

_MB3kqpBo4-sUHcILJN2lw.text: After reading all the reviews this place was a must stop for me. I tried a variety of foods the west coast wafflewich, the combination of avocado, chicken, bacon, etc was very flavorful highly recommended. I also tried the waffledilla and of course added avocado I think more cheese would have made it banging but it was good overall. Lastly, I had the famous Viva Las Elvis which was scrumptious. After all these foods all do contain a waffle so I topped all of it off with syrup and gave it that final taste! We had a party of 8 and the food was still out in a timely manner. The service was great to us. The inside is very cozy and unique. Waffles are messy but they manage to keep the area clean and organized.
