8FCHZYJfZL4fePgTIzXn8Q.text: After polishing off a bang up porchetta sandwich next door at Karved, I was in the mood for something sweet, and Tiabi Coffee & Waffle Bar satisfied that craving and then some with a fantastic churro waffle sando.   Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  You've got a comfortable atmosphere and solid service here at Tiabi. As embarrassed as I was to do it, I pulled out my phone and asked the server if he could mimic a honey ice cream sandwich that I'd seen on instagram, and within a few minutes I had a great replica right in front of me. Star.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  Because what I ordered wasn't on the menu I don't think myself or the server were really quite sure what to charge me for it, but it turned out to be a reasonable $8.25 for what was a sizable desert. Star.   Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  It's all. about. the waffle, and Tiabi absolutely nails it when it comes to the waffle. Their churro waffle was both one of the better waffles I've had in a while AND one of the better churros I've had - quite the feat. From there the ice cream and honey were standard, but were what I'd asked for. Single Star.   Star 5: Would you be excited to go back?  Great spot. I'd be excited to go back. Star.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro Waffle Sandwich: $8.25

DW9S1dEyF2kgIOEY-MwN_Q.text: So glad to have options here! The vegan maple bacon waffle was amazing (though I will admit I had them sub the baconut for regular bacon as my dietary restriction is in regards to dairy. I did taste the baconut and can vouch for it's amazing taste and similar bacon like texture!). Add vegan chocolate chips for a nice sweet and savory balance. Can't wait to come back and try their vegan ube ice cream!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forgot to take one before inhaling! Here&#39;s what I couldn&#39;t possibly stuff in my face lol. They are big and filling!

edajgeeje-yhPp8lt2mB_A.text: I was looking for good breakfast places and came across this not too far away. It specializes in smoothies and waffle sandwiches. The waffle sandwiches actually are better for lunch or dinner. It has a pretty large menu for being a small place. Most items here are vegan.   I like the smoothies better than the coffee. It's about $6 for a smoothie. The banana peanut butter is my favorite. It's made with non dairy milk. This is a pretty good size. It has lots of waffles of course. They serve them as just waffles or they use them to  make sandwiches. I like the avocado waffle sandwich. It's about $6. They can make it vegan. Just substitute the vegan cheese. The check in  allows you to save 10% on an order.   It's one of the best places in Vegas for breakfast. It's actually good any time of day. The waffles are all vegan but they are made with gluten if you need to know that.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Peanut Butter Smoothie And Vegan Avocado Waffle Sandwich

1aSMu5PvanDfy9WxdE88KQ.text: This place is very quaint and cute. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and added turkey sausage and avocado. They were fairly busy so there was quite a bit of a wait to get my food. The sandwich was delicious. The only downside was that it was not hot. Not a big fan of warm food especially when I'm expecting it to be hot. That aside I will definitely be back to taste their dessert waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Sandwich

vOpdSwKgNr9mvcgVEOX21g.text: Very delicious place to take a few friends on their way to the airport.   I ordered the Groupon a few days ahead for us to use, which was a great deal. We all did either a waffle or waffle sandwich with a small or medium coffee to go along with it and with the Groupon ended up spending only about a dollar extra at the register. The Groupon deal we used was 3 $8 vouchers for ~$14, so each voucher cost about $4.60 or so. If you see the deal on Groupon, I highly recommend it, I'm going to be looking for it again, so I can go back on my own too!   I ordered the banana Nutella waffle, which was a made-in-house waffle with banana slices, Nutella drizzle, almond slices, and whipped cream on top. Definitely something I'd get again. It was perfectly topped, any more toppings would've probably been too much. I also got the snickers iced coffee which had hazelnut and chocolate syrups and was absolutely delicious.   The waffle breakfast sandwiches my friends enjoyed looked super delicious as well, and I'd like to come back to try one of those or one of their more lunchtime type waffle sandwiches.   Overall, I'd recommend this spot. It's not far from the strip and is only about a block away from UNLV. They make great waffles and coffee and the staff are friendly and helpful. All of our items came out in about 10 minutes for our 4 separate orders. I'll definitely be back and can't wait to bring more friends too.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella waffle
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snickers Iced Coffee

I2jBdk7CQPMqKxHDBgUdFw.text: FOOD: Multiple unique waffle options ranging from sweet to savory. I had the Thai chicken- great flavors with peanuts and basil.  SERVICE: order at counter. Could be better, staff seemed more interested in talking to one another but our food came out in an appropriate time.  EXPERIENCE: small indoors seating with multiple tables. Nothing terribly exciting about the wall decorations.  VALUE: most waffles were under $7, add chips for $1. Coffees around $2. Definitely appropriately priced.  SUMMARY: Great breakfast place with interesting waffles at an awesome value. Perfect change of pace for tourists who are sick of hotel food!

NzSXvly43RxW0cbccxJruQ.text: Waffles Galore Great service, delish options for any palate  .. used a Groupon & they have Yelp Checkin discount great job inspiring  Our orders; Tiffs macchiato, Viva la Elvis , Maple bacon waffle, strawberry banana, butter pecan waffle... all delish

_4t_vRBLQbMCM5nxmCnkTQ.text: Got the Elvis waffle and thought it tasted extremely good. I would definitely have this again however it wasn't completely filling since the waffle is a thinner waffle. The price was a bit expensive for a single thin waffle, $7.25 or so. The peanut butter seemed to have tasted uniquely strong and the overall plate was nicely sweet. The restrooms and restaurant was clean and staff were friendly.

Ba6WS9p5SR8Lah0CVgwd3Q.text: There was no time to take a pic of the Bananutella Waffle as we inhaled it as soon as it came to the table but the Breakfast Wafflewich survived just long for one.  Not only was the waffle delicious, but their coffees were absolutely wonderful as well. The Java Jolt is pretty strong so be prepared to bounce off the walls.  This place gets A- in my books.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast Wafflewich

hA8YXHSWxnSSA4MXNObz8g.text: I gave this place a 4 star because I haven't tried everything! I saw a kale chocolate chip cookie I want to try next time I'm visiting! Anyway, came across this shop while looking for some good coffee in LV. This one had a lot of amazing reviews so I knew it was a must try. I was greeted very nicely by the guy in the back. He said he would be with me shortly so I went and looked at the menu. They had a few signature drinks that I was so intrigued to try every single one! Instead I had the first one which had cinnamon and vanilla with a waffle. My husband needed the extra kick so he got the java jolt. I wanted the cinnamon one with soy and the guy forgot that he didn't put soy. He was nice enough to give me the one he made for free and made me A new one with soy. I love excellent customer service! The excellent customer service came with good tasting coffee as well. The waffle was also good. I wish I could try all the other drinks but I guess I'll have a list when I come to visit next time.... can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Java jolt when u need that shot

vGBJNGPyKyQHM2TdtrPdiw.text: Sorry, but I'm not impressed by the food at this place.  I'm wondering if the other Yelpers only gave high stars for the aesthetic b/c I can admit, it's a cute restaurant but for me, it's mostly about the food.  I ordered the Viva Las Elvis waffle (banana, peanut butter, bacon, and honey.)  The ingredients paired well together; however, the actual waffle itself was hard as a hockey puck.  I could tell it was cooked a little bit over.  To make matters worse, there was no syrup offered and I was told by the postmates driver if I wanted syrup it would be an additional charge.  Uhh..no thanks.  $7.50 for the waffle, no syrup and no side items.    The snickers iced coffee was also on my radar, but again I was disappointed.  For it to be snickers, there sure is no sweetener.  They could've simply labeled it iced coffee and I would've known to add my own flavour.  Since chocolate, hazelnut, caramel, and creamer are listed on the list of contents, I wasn't expecting to need additional sugar.  Boy was I wrong.  It cost $2.65 which I can get behind.  All in all, it was an average experience.  I most likely won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Viva Las Elvis waffle ($7.50) and Snickers iced coffee ($2.65)

x9hhgPdHJ1yn8UFjbxYcUA.text: Cutest place ever. So this place smelled so good when I walked in. I came in just to grab a quick coffee! When I started to look at the menu and read everything that was available I was like Whhhhhaaatttttt is this place. A Coffee and Waffle  bar Genius!   This place had speciality waffles or build your own. I wasn't hungry at the time so I ordered a coconut cooler for my daughter and a Coconut truffle iced Coffee. All of it was bomb. The coconut Cooler had fresh mint and some juices that came together very well I might say. Oh! and my coffee was Fabulous just Wonderful. I drank it so fast I should of savored it. Well since I am a frequent visitor of the sin city.;) I will be back to try a waffle and more coffee.   You will no be disappointed when you get here. Kid friendly and the waffles looked so good. I can't wait to come back. I need those waffles in my life!  Great execution on this concept! Kudos to you!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Cooler

gCs4YlgbOH5OwF4bBXS6_g.text: The coffee and food was delicious! Ambiance and prices are wonderful. The only thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars is the speed of service, they were just really slow at getting the drinks and food out. Everything else was great!

3rh89m2jT_pPXPCfq-ImBQ.text: Nice little spot off the strip, 5 minutes away. Located in the same center as Target. Workers are very welcoming and hospitable. Waffles are fresh and crisp. Very delicious.

KCRDfUjkSK7y59GVTfyp1g.text: I keep on coming back every time cz I started to crave waffles now that I know what they are. Feel like I'm invited to their house, and they're such amazing hosts. CLEAN and healthy. Very tasty .. The owner gave me this vegan cookie to try as a sample and I tell you.  It tastes amazing.  I'm not vegan nor vegetarian but I'm in love with this place.

kHCdUWAzS91TOGo9mYyZlQ.text: I'm never disappointed when ordering the churro waffle, vegan ice cream, and baconut. I absolutely love this place

O9QE8HcOcRxiPPtXMl4nGA.text: Stopped in thanks to other Yelp reviews looking for an afternoon snack and coffee during my travels.  I prefer to stop at local places wherever I go and this is a great spot!    At the recommendation of the staff I had the "west coast" waffle and an iced "Honey Cream Latte".  Wow!  I got more than a snack... I'll be having a late dinner.  I loved the savory option that had bacon and avocado (my favs!) on a waffle with a little cheese and grilled chicken.  SO good!   The drink was delicious as well, although I got it half sweet per my taste.  I didn't realize it was a breve (made with half and half instead of milk) but the treat was welcomed since it's so good :).   Great little place away from the strip.  Good anytime of day - not just breakfast!

rJQ15SvpAFJToBRRugO5dg.text: First time here and they are really good. Super nice, make modifications with no problem. The ambiance is cafe-ish and has a friendly vibe to it. The food is fresh and tasty. #awesome

rechGQU8V0D9Fey0L5kXLw.text: Best place in town an out !!! I recommend this place great service great food an they have vegan options !! An there waffles are vegan try there churrro waffles !

iqZqKbbTcg4iyNeElPaLgQ.text: Got here at 11:15am today for brunch. The cashier told us that it's gonna be a 15-20 minute wait and since we were hungry and didn't wanna go anywhere before my friend's flight, we opted to wait.   I ordered a breakfast waffle and iced coffee, while my friend ordered a smoothie, latte and west coast wafflewich. 11:45 and still no food or drinks. The place was packed and there's only 3 employees- 1 cashier and 2 food prep staff.   Since it was already 12:00, we decided to take our food to-go. Coffee was okay. Nothing special. The waffle was crisp and crunchy which was good. Breakfast wafflewich was delicious but needs a little maple syrup, which we didn't get to have anymore bec we took the food to-go. Prices are reasonable.   I'll think about whether giving this place another try. Otherwise, they should add more staff.

Dd7ADTyV90oKVLqbtZFZgQ.text: Everything we had was absolutely amazing. We ordered a couple of different waffles and sandwiches and none of us could decide on a favorite. They were all so good! The lattes were also delicious and the staff was so kind and helpful. We'll definitely come back next time we're in Vegas!

4U-1F6qIttEERoMjw4oDwA.text: Dropped in for a light breakfast based on other Yelp reviews one morning in Vegas.  Split the Western waffle sandwich with a friend and soon wished i ordered a whole one for myself.  Delicious!  The iced coffee was good too (it was hot outside already).  Will be back to try some other items.

LzRN8XTriyRRF9BEAt_AzA.text: Amazing restaurant! Two vegan wafflewhich choices, The Guru which I have had multiple times and always enjoyed, and the Savory Thai Basil can be made vegan with The Guru's patties and daiya vegan mozzarella. Scream for vegan ice cream!

3RMW3WnoqOzAxbmtU41_LA.text: I've been going to this place since the open in 2013 and it's stayed a favorite of mine. The staff is always friendly and before they expanded, it was the owners Tiffany and Mae working everyday and they would try to know everyone personally. The drinks and food are great but it's even better knowing you're supporting genuine people.   If you're into coffee, they have some quality beans and drinks for you. If not there are smoothies and teas. Lots of veggie options for food, which is nice but they pretty much cater to any preference. They are from Guam, and I've found that islanders have a pallet that leans more towards sweet flavors, so expect that when ordering food lol. It's not a bad thing, you can definitely taste that a lot of their inspiration comes from their home. Food is made fresh and to order.   Anyway, check this spot out and tip your baristas.

tLDOCVLL1dbQ3Cy1gurVRg.text: I just ordered coffee here.  I gave it three stars because the coffee was a little weak for my taste. I wanted the coffee with a little kick.   However, the service was very pleasant.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  Again, 3 stars strictly because of weak coffee Would like to try their food next time.  They have a interesting menu items I would like to taste.

aS7Ok3UJ0ugb3RxmYeBSpA.text: Place appears to have BOMB food options! Especially for Gluten free intolerances. Multiple waffle and coffee options, great for kids as well. They even have an array of shakes, and desert type waffles as well. Really unique teas, as well as cheap coffee choices.

4dm8N_Cx0BpxbXD5ao-xxQ.text: I was craving a good breakfast place when I found this little beauty. Oh man, did this place not disappoint. I got the maple bacon waffle. First off, I like bacon, but most of the time I feel like people overdo it. This, however, was the perfect amount of crisp, fresh bacon mixed into the BATTER and then cooked into an amazingly soft but crisp waffle. Offset the saltiness of the bacon with a sticky sweet maple syrup and you have a perfectly balanced waffle. I also got the honey cream latte. I do feel like the honey needed to be intensified a little more to cut through the bold taste of the espresso, but overall it was a nice fresh taste on a normal latte. Will definitely track this place down again the next time I'm in Vegas.

F8xfXtSg8T8bO84lKnVftQ.text: Just ate here first time. Foods are okay. It just took so long to get our two orders. Waited abt.20 min. Long long waiting while not many customers and its Monday late morning.   I received the reply from the owner to my review bi think we have to try the place one more time. Hope it will be good next time.    Since the restaurant left me msg, we will try one more time when we go to LV next time. At least they care of review. That is good to know.

x5FzTfa2EGFP51RZ28DL3g.text: Absolute best place to get waffles in Vegas. The waffle has an excellent texture and is soo tasty. The whipped cream on the top is one of the best parts. The sandwiches are also really good.  The kale champ smoothie is good if you're a fan of kale. If you don't like kale try a fruity smoothie because you can still taste it. So far I haven't had a bad meal here!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Chick sanwich on.a waffle
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananutella Belgian Waffle

EKD_dcCnOplItlN5e3noEQ.text: This place earns its five stars. It is so delicious.  I can't eat dairy, so waffles are often off the table for me. When I found out about this place on my last trip, I was excited but I had no idea what was waiting for me. These aren't just waffles. They are delicious, fluffy, soft waffles with just the right amount of crisp and crunch on the outside. I got the Thai chicken waffle sandwich without cheese. It was the best food I've had on my vacation by far. You can get a more classic waffle dessert with different batter options and customized toppings if you want more of a dessert. Also, yes, they have vegan ice cream.   The drinks are nice too. I've tended to stick to tea blends to hydrate on hot days, but they have a few interesting looking blended drinks and, of course, fun coffee options.  The waffles take a little bit of time to make, so go in with a little patience, but know that it is so worth it.  I fully recommend this place to anyone with a mouth who enjoys food.

vlRh9tu7SPdjkEFc4Wh8yg.text: I bought the Groupon and was not ever disappointed with any of the waffle choices and even the sandwich was delicious. The coconut with basil was very refreshing and the staff was very nice. I have already taken two friends and will continue to recommend.

5ASH2wxi5AQyPzCdAKHTZQ.text: Tried this place for the first time! Nice and clean on the inside. I order the West coast waffle it was delicious. Everyone in our group loved the food. Definitely coming back!

NYt6yxxQmLL0TAH1ldWzXg.text: The Good A very pleasant and nice staff with reasonably priced items.    The Bad The food and the wait. My wife ordered the banana Nutella waffle which came out first and the waffle was overcooked and very dry. The Nutella was flavorless and limited as it was drizzled on. My only other experience to compare this type of waffle with was at Disneyworld and there waffle was moist, soft and warm with the Nutella adding a great accent.  I ordered the hashtag waffle and a banana Nutella for me. The hashtag was again an overcooked, dry and burnt in some areas waffle with turkey sausage that tasted like they came out of the frozen foods section at Von's supermarket.  Completely flavorless. The egg that came with it I cannot not even explain what it looked like.  My banana Nutella waffle did not even look like my wife's as by the time I got it I was told they were having issues with there waffle maker. It reminded me of one my 12 year old made me for Father's Day.   The Ugly Due to technical problems everything took twice as long as long as it should.  I even saw A gentleman get up who had been waiting there before us asking why was it taking so long for his food.  For my inconvenience of waiting so long they offered me a cookie. At that moment they should've offered to discount my food at least.   One of the things I hate having to do on a yelp review is do a negative review. Hopefully, for others they will not receive this type of food or delay.  My goal is always to stay away from the chain restaurants and find those little hidden gems in the city.  Unfortunately, I didn't find the gem.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Here&#39;s my hashtag with the burnt areas.
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good but was very dry and overcooked.

3Mro0pZ92NZYadmgcst9IA.text: I heard great things about this place from a lot of UNLV students, so I had to check it out. I expected it to be just a waffle. While I really like waffles, I can also make them at home, so they are usually just okay, in my opinion.  I ordered the waffledilla sandwich without tiabi sauce. It was spectacular. The flavor of the waffle is off the charts. It had just the right about the sweetness, and the texture was a perfect balance of soft and crispy. The chicken was also moist, and I really enjoyed the whole thing. The chips are also pretty good too, which was unexpected as, again, they are just chips.   Finally, for dessert I had the cinnamon sugar covered waffle with ice cream. It was really good. I surprisingly enjoyed my sandwich more, though, because the sandwich was more so something that I would not be able to replicate at home.   Tiabi also frequently has living social or Groupon deals, so this place ends up being super, super cheap.   I will definitely be back for more.

eblYhXjagOhreROuLsLRDg.text: A casual place for great waffles! Each waffle is made to order, so be prepared to wait for a little bit. The ladies behind the counter are friendly and have great recommendations if you want to try something different. This is a cool local spot to go with your friends and just hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden waffle with mocha almond ice cream.

Uqg4fIgNStc8UFgp41h2bQ.text: Hmm where to start. This was my second visit here.  It's a lovely upbeat place with excellent customer service who doesn't give yu attitude when yu have a "complicated order".  We both ordered the Frankenstein thinking it was going to be a hot coffee.  Our cold frothy drinks were presented to us at the counter.  We didn't realize that a blend means it is blended with ice. We thought it was a blend of roasts.  We spoke to the nice gal behind the counter and she explained the differences to us.  My friend then ordered the Java Jolt (which is out of this world good).  The cashier brought out the J.J. when it was ready and wanted to make sure we were satisfied with our drinks.  We tried to pay for the third drink but she refused and said it was on them and apologized for the confusion.  We also asked for a low carb option, she said they could do a sandwich without the waffle, so we opted for that.  It came out perfect and the eggs even had the waffle iron griddle marks.  They have earned a spot on my list of local favorites to visit for Vegas.  Thanks again and keep up the great work.

D8ep2vtl5CFtfmGRYc9EaQ.text: This place was pretty good, good coffee waffles were a bit crunchy for my liking however that's just me. The Churro waffle has the perfect blend of cinnamon sugar, add some banana on top and a scoop of ice cream makes it perfect. Would recommend to any waffle and coffee enthusiast. Picture: (Churro waffle with Birthday Cake ice cream and Banana, Coffee: Snickers iced coffee)

PRaMrbraT-CgWeRRW_CY_A.text: I've been coming here since they opened almost 4 years ago. Always amazing service. Great food. Favorite place to grab something to eat and talk.

8OrocpQDZGSRGNkjuDkqkg.text: The unique menu options and affordable prices make this place a great breakfast joint in the Las Vegas area. Though the preparation of the food isn't speedy by any means (~15-20 minutes), it's well worth the wait. It's uncommon that you find a place with exceptional coffee options AND tasty breakfast food.  The breakfast sandwich I chose was well crafted with the perfect balance of each of the contents inside. The coffee was also noteworthy.  Another aspect of this gem of a restaurant is the prices. For being situated in Las Vegas, the prices are reasonable for the amount of food you get.

vKxb6gAVH_Ry86I1VPOM9w.text: It's super good food honestly recommend the bannatella it's super good it's a waffle nutella drizzle almonds and whip cream and also looks super appetizing so is strawberry kisses

MWPddJmc4UNbIemQqveiIQ.text: First time here! Yelp made me want to try it. Their tiff's waffle coffee looked really good

Sb7C_Zg01XYDCnSATqrZHQ.text: This place seriously has awesome waffles. Can't even believe they are vegan. My favorite is the west coast waffle. Also their smoothies are made with fresh fruits. Had the strawberry sunrise and was really good and refreshing. Highly recommend.

anE7cn0bTrqOIqHSP3Bijg.text: Absolutely unbelievably delicious. Can't imagine not coming here. Bless your taste buds and come here!!

wOnUpk-m7uS6D2cRvDC-Lg.text: Nice concept, average execution. So far we had  - The West Coast with chips - Hashtag breakfast sandwich with chips - Golden waffles - Bananatella - Waffle macciato  The savory items had the potential, but it was a failure due to the lack of freshness. ti6ZDp_OlDBToVU_p9R3FQ.text: Best waffles in town hands down!!! And they are veggie & guilt free too. I will be going back a lot for the iced coffee too!

pJ2YkwYZwiU24YgbFeYhVQ.text: This is the spot!  Would be nice if they went organic- and some better options for sweet syrup, but great for vegan selections while passing thru Vegas on a road trip.    lots of fun options, especially the Churro waffle.  we had the vegan wafflewich too, it was super tasty.  chilled out space, cozy seating, good music, wifi, and outlets.  good for travelers and study

sqojD0TuwoY6MJy32jGjEQ.text: So it's located in the plaza with Target on the Maryland Parkway side. It'd be easy to miss it if you don't know where to look!   It's a small cozy cafe with seating for around 30-40 people? It's super close to UNLV which makes it a prime place to go to for a coffee break and possibly to study. They do have free WiFi! And the owners are pretty cool and really nice.  I ended up getting waffles and tea, more specifically I got the vegan version of Viva Las Elvis with vegan ice cream. It's a waffle with peanut butter, honey (agave if vegan version), and coconut bacon with a scoop of ice cream on top. It was pretty good, nothing too spectacular. The peanut butter melted into the waffle which was pretty awesome, because I mean melted peanut butter on anything is delicious! And the ice cream was well vegan vanilla ice cream and wasn't too special to me.   I'll probably not get tea again, only because it was $2 for a bag and one cup of hot water. I'm not sure if they'll give you more hot water, but one bag and one cup of water doesn't seem like it's worth it.   My biggest gripe was that it was DIRTY. I mean the tables, I went through two tables and they were both dirty. There was dried syrup on them and stains from the last customers. I looked down to see if there were any other tables, but most of them seemed like they were dirty to me. I tried cleaning some of it off, but most of it didn't come off with a napkin and some water. That to me is disgusting especially since it seems most people leave their dishes and the owners clean it off. That's just how it looked to me, when other customers ate and then left. When I got there the whole cafe was empty but as I sat there there were people that came and go. So they didn't really have an excuse to be dirty.   I do however want to try some other menu items the next time I go. I just hope it's cleaner this time. I like the owners, they're pretty nice to talk to. I like the atmosphere. I like the location. I like some of their food so far. But I don't like dirty tables where I'm going to eat especially at cafe/restaurants/etc.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Viva Las Elvis vegan option with vegan ice cream

s9u7EcQlliz55Qh9CSNUOA.text: The maple bacon waffle was terrific. My husband and I both loved it!!  They are specialty coffee drinks are delicious and smooth.  Everybody was really friendly and the service was fast. Nice quick casual place away from the strip to grab a good breakfast or lunch!

c_9xPfCfGPFBTAuJKBz_Ug.text: Went to this place during a birthday weekend after I bought a Livingsocial deal, pretty awesome little spot!   Exceptional customer service, great food, and cool atmosphere. I love small businesses like these, especially in a place like Las Vegas, they are diamonds in the rough!  Trust me, we went to some pretty bad spots using Livingsocial/Groupon deals before here.  John, our cashier was very polite and friendly, and the food was pretty unique. Definitely recommend hitting up this little gem next time you're in Vegas and don't want that tourist Vegas service. :)

tAwSyDFupwXUx2zNeji0rg.text: I do like this place, but I docked another star because of a recent time I came in, and it was not too busy (there were three customers sitting down at two different tables) and me standing at the register. It took almost a few minutes before someone even acknowledged me, although the girl who finally took my order was apologetic. Also, today we came in and were told we couldn't order food because of a catering order they have. I do love the honey cream latte and waffle sandwiches, and the owner is really nice.

pbdo8MK5IvjbrELgvRAStA.text: What is tiabi you ask? "To inspire and be inspired." What an awesome statement. This little waffle shop/cafe is a vegas gem. It's one of those home town places where you want to bring your friends. You can hangout and have brunch or stop by for a late snack and dessert. They have all different types of waffles that will satisfy your craving. I personally love the waffledilla. It's the cheapest waffle sandwhich and will melt in your mouth! It's chicken, cheese, special sauce (that is sooooo yummy) in between a waffle folded in half and is super scrumptious. You can add a fruit bowl (variety so I'd ask what kind they have that day in case you are allergic or don't like a certain type of food) or homemade chips just for $1! Sweet deal! And it's pretty much a meal. They have a water pitcher towards the back. But they also have teas and smoothies. I haven't tried the smoothies but I want to! I like the "Just Peachy" tea. It's not too sweet but has a good taste. I always suggest this place because it's very central, it's cheap, they have dessert waffles too (try the red velvet) and they're friendly. It's located inside the Target plaza so there's a lot of traffic goin on around the place. But definitely a place to try if you haven't!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White chocolate tuxedo
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waffadillllla

mvpJcHDOppKe8UYsmhmXMw.text: Delicious wafflewich!!! Yanel and Jay are very sweet and were really accommodating with our custom orders, they provided us suggestions to make it more yummy by adding more toppings! We tried the guru burger/wafflewich with Tiabi sauce and extra avocado and the breakfast wafflewich. If you are vegan/vegetarian then this is for you :) we are surely coming back.

FX8zqcwvddHCHVDZBNKoeg.text: Ordered skinny pistachio latte, it was so good with the waffle on top , a small joint .  The pictures looked lot fancier than the actual place tho.

GzEtw2Tk4rsOfTXADiokpA.text: Great lattes and frappes. Good waffles. Prices are reasonable and they have vegan options. Waffle sandwich was good and so was the red velvet frappe.

K18N1c1zIjVL7JE0y-MoWQ.text: I had high hopes because I believe that waffles are the ultimate breakfast food, but I was sadly disappointed in every aspect of my experience at Tiabi.  The gentleman taking my order had visibly unwashed hair with very bad dandruff.   My waffle sandwich was extremely dry with a poor quality of sausage patty and overcooked eggs.   My iced coffee came after my meal was served and was watered down.  I still have high hopes. I'd like to see Tiabi turn it around. They have a great concept, but they're not executing it very well.

9kt-Xr8guAWusrKnP4iDJg.text: How have I forgot all about this place! I'll be spending almost every morning here. West coast is my go to !

Ty591OUqXMIEc3AGabR4eg.text: This was a gem I discovered by accident through a coupon. The staff are friendly. They offer a great selection of waffles and blended coffee. They have plenty of vegan options and also make gluten-free waffles on request. My boss eats gluten free and forgot to mention it, but they switched her waffle out with a gluten free one with a smile. I love the laid back atmosphere and the 70s music!  The waffles taste great and you can find something for almost anyone as long as you like waffles. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #vegan chocolate bacon.

OKRSsbgZrd6PNzEgY8Yauw.text: They wrap up bacon, cheese, chicken, and veggies in a waffle. This really should be all you need to know about this place to make you want to eat here. But, I'll expand. They wrap bacon, cheese, chic...  I decided I needed a pick-me-up and Tiabi popped up on my coffee radar (the yelp app) and I headed that way. As I parked my car and walked towards the door, I became skeptical about this place considering this neighbor can be non-friendly at times. I walked in and did the classic Hanna-Barbera/ Scooby Doo surprised look. This place was clean, inviting, and I was greeted with a giant smile and brief intro on the place. Great way to start my waffle fueled experience.    I ordered the, "West Coast Waffle Wafflewich" and the "Stiles Java Jolt". The "West Coast", I was told is the fan favorite and if you read what I wrote above, that's easy to believe. This sammie is big, about half the size of an average dinner plate. The tasty ingredients are added to the savory waffle, then folded over to immediately give you this pocket-like snack item. As I ate, I was afraid of two things; all of the food falling out of the opposite biting side, and a weird sweet waffle paired with cheese. My fears waffled away as the crunch of the bacon filled my ears, the tender & juicy chicken, cheese, and veggies came together in the warm waffle. This sandwich was fantastic, and turned out to be one of those food items you realize you haven't put down since the first bite. This Wafflicious sammie was paired with seasoned homemade waffle chips. Fantastic mutated breakfast/ lunch combo.  The Stiles Java Jolt was delicious. Espresso, coffee, and just a tad of vanilla flavoring. I went half on the flavoring, because I don't have a huge sweet tooth, but Normally it comes with four pumps of vanilla. I could have drank two more of these delicious caffeinated bullets, but then I might turn into Spider-Man and climb the walls.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazimg cup of Joe.
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The West Coast is the best coast.

rbRbyEph37y7VGogQjq2ug.text: TIABI is in a niche of its own! Where in the valley can you find great tasting waffle sandwiches??? Nowhere! Love, love, love them! You will too!

gBCB3s6TlOZx-IeOFXg2tg.text: Not only does Tiabi do amazing waffles they also hold the coffee game down! "To Inspire And Be Inspired"! I love the quote and your food and coffee are inspirational to me!!!!  So far I have not tried the sweet waffles, but on the savory waffle front I'm in love with the Waffidilla add the avocado and the West Coast. Both full of cheese and meaty goodness inside a perfectly cooked waffle.   The coffee is amazing! On your first visit you must have the Tiffs Waffle Macchiato. It has a churro waffle in a very strong, slightly cinnamon flavored coffee. My favorite is the Espresso Frankenstein. It's perfect if you enjoy the taste of coffee. Plus, as sweetener they use is agave. Yay!  The service is spot on and everyone is talkative, energized and helpful. If you go in often you will get to know them and how sweet they really are. The atmosphere a is pure coffee shop, random tables that don't match and chairs that are odd. I do love the long wood bench that runs the length of the wall. Plus, the cool art on the walls are really unique and cool.   My love of coffee shops runs deep and Tiabi Coffee has definitely become close to my heart!

bEu5hcLq_CD_YCkC38EUNw.text: I had a maple bacon waffle and it was amazing! However I thought the portion was a little small. I think it's the best waffle I've ever had. Period.

fOAcaa2yIjnH9q8GPbMDdg.text: Last time I was here I got the red velvet waffles and they were amazing. I really like the atmosphere, they have games and the inside is nicely decorated. It is kind of hard to see from the street, it's too bad because I feel like they deserve way more customers. Can't wait to come again.

lhuXVOxyTxAhJtOcvTprZQ.text: Loved this place!! The nice man there gave me 20% off because of an order Grubhub had to cancel, which wasn't even his fault so he didn't have to discount my order but he still went above and beyond to do it. That's first. Second! THE FOOD THERE WAS AMAZING!! Me and my friend ordered the west coast waffle sandwich (amazing) and also the pistachio latte (super amazing). I highly recommend this place for amazing service and amazing food altogether. You won't be disappointed :)

DpuFRMmKC3kvG0IsX7iJ-A.text: Traveled off the strip on our Vegas trip to this cute little waffle shop and we were not disappointed. We got the Viva Las Elves waffle and the Bananatela waffle. (I substituted the Nutella  for chocolate) Both were excellent !!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vmz8VVlILIbv0XpUSqJ46A.text: My girlfriend and I found this place on Groupon and I'm am very happy we did. For a while we were here every Sunday. What I love about this place is how affordable it is. It's good filling food that doesn't break the bank. I love the lavender latte and I get the West coast waffle sandwich. Both are awesome. My girlfriend gets the bacon waffle. The bacon is inside and is the perfect blend of sweet and savory. The staff is friendly, and very quick about getting the food out. Hope you enjoy as much as we do!

IGpScuiDBKG3sxzwMDf9jw.text: My first time here! Coming to get a cup of coffee and waffle before going to wait my lunch at Oyster bar. The staff was super nice!! I had so many requests and she was very patient to listen to me and explain to the barista! Will come back again for sure on my next Vegas trip :)   Nutella waffle and honey creme latte are recommend!

ZCehIdzRLZ_ik40GA6qvjw.text: Great coffee shop close to UNLV. Awesome food and nice place to come and study or just hang out. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend for anyone who loves coffee and/or waffles.

wd2cn0bBmFIdsoKv3KqJTw.text: Great waffles and coffee specialties. Nice atmosphere and very friendly service!  We came here on a Tuesday morning and it was not crowded at all so we could order right away.  We had the banana waffles and the one with strawberries. Both were really nice. The latte and the cappuccino were very nice, too.  I can definitely recommend this place if you like a sweet breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kisses - waffle with strawberries, whipped cream and chocolate sauce

i4DHNpb6QLqpee2phcklDw.text: If you are really hungry. This is not the place to order, waited for my food about 45 minutes. It was not as good as the reviews made it seem. I deff recommend Bruxie on Las Vegas Blvd, I mean it's very Good.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RUkswvG0qVGfThATCgx0CA.text: Tiabi is an oasis of calm and deliciousness in the whirlwind of over-priced and under-delivered breakfast joints littering the desert of Las Vegas. I enjoyed the $6 Strawberry Kisses waffles, which struck an impeccable balance between sweet, filling, and light on the palate. A perfect antidote to a night of regret or morning preparation for wandering through the sinful daytime sun, the iced coffee is also refreshing and prepared with care and attentiveness.

Nx9tv--bwovTXqyub-JxXA.text: Can I have a waffle, a waffle, and a side of waffle? :D  This coffee/waffle inspired shop is a hidden sweet tooth haven. It's tucked away in a plaza off by UNLV. When you walk in the aroma of hazelnut, baked goods, and coffee tingles your nostrils and it's goood. I ordered Tiff's Special which if memory serves me right is a caramel vanilla machiatto topped with a waffle and I had to get a loaded waffle dish (Toppings include: bananas, Nutella, almonds, and whip cream). You get two waffles which is perfect if you're hungry or to share if you're just looking to snack. The coffee was fresh/strong/sweet/milky which made for a great combo. If you're looking for sweet, comfort food on a chilly day this is the place to be.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel vanilla machiatto with a side of waffle and an extra side of waffle with bananas and Nutella.

COLK1PqDjj6XhKgo76fTYw.text: We randomly found this place on google and thought we'd give it a shot. We're always looking for local restaurants to try in Vegas and this one did not disappoint!!   The staff is incredibly friendly and genuine. You can tell they at happy to serve you. They smile when they work and seems like they all love what they do, like it's more than just a job to them. They also take the time to get to know their customers. While we were there, they greeted multiple customers by name and had casual conversations with them.  There are a lot of options on the menu, for both drinks and food. We got the Viva Las Elvis (amazing), Tiff's Waffle Macchiato (amazing), Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich (good, but sausage seemed like it was a frozen patty), and Snickers Latte (good, not too chocolatey).   Overall, this place is a gem! We'll definitely be coming back :)

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #Tiff&#39;s Waffle Macchiato. Tasty tasty!
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Viva Las Elvis with extra bacon. Amazing!

efeYMH5fO6cCAnAAVhUXeA.text: They have great filling waffles! Their coffee is very good with some neat variety. We love coming here to grab some coffee and waffles. Cute and clean coffee shop. Sometimes the service is slow, but they take their time making great waffles.

YHSUQw1u07-07p_C_rmnFQ.text: My girlfriend had a groupon which landed me here on a Sunday morning, well morning for me, which was 1 PM. The place was slammed and the four employees behind the counter were busy making fresh smoothies, espresso, waffles, and the like.  My iced honey latte was perfection. Fresh espresso, cream, and a touch of honey. It wasn't overly sweet and it still tasted like coffee. Really enjoyed it. It was just too small. I had to order another.  I got the Hashtag Breakfast Sandwich. Really nothing too special about it. Fresh made waffle, egg, cheese, and sausage. Wasn't awful, wasn't knock my socks off. It was offered with either a side of fruit or house made chips for $1, I opted with the fruit (because this was a total fat kid breakfast).  As I stated previously, the place was slammed. My friend and I snagged a table after a group of four left. We stacked up the dishes and ate at the "dirty" table because we are savages and needed the immune system boost.  We sat at that dirty table and the place had died down, not once did the 4 people behind the counter begin to clean the place up or even clear our dishes.   Decent spot, coffee was the bombDOTcom, food was meh. Definitely would go back for the coffee, but I'd skip the food.

ud5xAyMyKT7qTrr_Ye72hw.text: Food was delicious.. Very nice place with a friendly staff. I'll be back when I'm in town

WTnrcSbNicVj-z8yjdYEXg.text: The West Coast I had was amazing!! Perfect meal to start the day, or the long drive back to Ontario.  Coffee was so good, some of the best I've had. This is definitely a must have next time we're in town.

OiYaKYJcYzviQdVYtXRu_A.text: We chose to eat here at tiabi before our first day at Edc, with my husband and I from Sacramento and a bunch of our friends from Los Angeles, we were really excited to try out this really cute waffle shop. Seeing the pictures and menu on Yelp, I already super intrigued by the banana and Nutella waffle.  With a big group entering the shop, we were sort of aware that maybe we would have to split up our group to sit down and eat.  It was self serve, so we each ordered our meal, standing around at first trying to find a spot to sit. Eventually we found a table big enough for us if we all squished together.  The food sort of took a little while to get to our table, but we did get our drinks first.  I ordered the Serena tea (or something like that I don't remember), but it was super refreshing. Especially against that Las Vegas heat. Some of our friends had also ordered several other drinks, and they loved theirs as well.  When our food finally came, we got the sandwiches first. Most of my friends had ordered the west coast sandwich, and they were super pleased with it. Another one of my friend ordered the Thai chicken and he was really glad with that one as well. Overall I'd say that tiabi was pretty satisfying for my group of friends. Although small, it does give off a comfortable vibe. Very easy going and relaxed, the customer service was also pretty great.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananatella waffle :)

UpEXPxI1yoZQFOAhJKX9Fw.text: If you love waffles, you won't be disappointed. I was visiting Vegas for a week and just stumbled on Tiabi. It was so good, I returned twice. The breakfast sandwich is a standout. My one complaint is the time it takes to prepare your food - about 15-20 minutes - even though the restaurant had no more than four patrons on each of my visits. One person prepares the food and another your drink, and either one is also taking orders, all of which makes for slow service. So if you're in a hurry or just want to grab something for the road, it's probably not the best place to go. If you're not, it's worth the wait. I'll definitely return whenever I'm in Vegas.

YnAakuWiMlu0aTCR41uYpg.text: Such good customer service! Staff is welcoming!  They have great tasting waffles and loved their latte!

gTsKlw68lVjCsuf9Yk8LyA.text: Came across this cafe on yelp on my weekly Monday breakfast adventure...and I was definitely happy with my visit. My husband I went shortly after they opened and we were the only guests dining in - there was a couple take-outs while we waited and dined (their website permits for online orders).  We were assisted by Mae (one of the owners) who was incredibly friendly and welcoming about our first visit.  My husband had the red velvet waffles, I had the #breakfast sandwich. I had a Carmel apple cider (by far much better than Starbucks) and my husband had a mocha latte (great also).   While we did wait about 15-20 minutes for our food (not bad by any regular standards) - Mae was apologetic for our time waiting and treated us to a sample of their Churronimo (delicious!).  Will definitely revisit in the future!

74BW1oQWwdnpls6dCh8CyQ.text: Oh my goodness. Let me start by saying good job on the vegan options. It's difficult going out to eat being vegan you have to consider so much. I was happy with knowledge and choices of vegan options here. I Love waffles so this place differently hit the spot. Good job guys keep up the good work.

V68UWj5-8ZFyZIY9f1ijNw.text: Outstanding waffles with different styles & flavors. Light taste for waffles. Venue was a little small but highly recommend it for a different breakfast.

S3s_LAKXMBrqLX8QT5kdJA.text: This place is amazing great vibes and even better food. Everyone was very helpful and super friendly. The food was so good and I was surprised that it was all vegan. It tasted better than most regular waffle I've had. I can't wait to come here again and soon!

z6nZiig_hzKXOJ0Dzjxn5Q.text: The food was great but I waited for 35 mins just to get my west coast sandwich and plus its not even busy!

WgMHVfdutz4EB9CYpxV91g.text: Love this place. Friendly staff and the dining room is always clean. The West coast and Waffledilla are my go to a when I come in

LUj9uPvWXJ2J2kyIDMNteQ.text: We decided to go off the strip for breakfast this morning and I was looking for a good vegan fare. We stumbled upon this restaurant. It was great! Great service and even better food. They did take a little while to cook but their waffles are 100% vegan. One of the servers forgot my side of chips but besides that everything was great!   Next time in Vegas,  we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rWtGLaff6wu4nRY6bIpE3Q.text: I'm a sucker for a lavender latte, think it would have been even better with an extra shot of espresso tho.

vgw9jw4H4eeKBxa4znCqsg.text: This is a very small place with two ladies working the orders.  They are pretty slow, but everything is made fresh to order. They have playing cards on the table, and after a 20 minute wait, we found out why.   I got the Mango tea, which was very good.  I am not a big sweets person so I put very little sweet and low in my tea if any.  This flavor did not need any sweetener.   Then I ordered their B.A.T. on waffle instead of bread. It was just ok.  The waffle seemed overdone to me and the sandwich was lacking taste.  Nice fruit side bowl, but strawberries were on their last leg.   I think most of the positive reviews were for the waffle desserts. So if I ever come back again, then I will stick to the sweet side of the menu, even though sweets are not my favorite.

Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making fresh waffles

iyQMZAGMtiGiWbcdaDrRZw.text: Had such a great dining experience here! The food was awesome and service was excellent! We ordered the kisses, bananatella and break-the-fast waffles. The waffles were light and very flavorful! Crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, the toppings were fresh and goes so perfect with each other. For drinks, we had the purple ube frozen frappe, dom's chocolate caramel frozen frappe and tiff's waffles hot machiatto. Each drink was unique and super yummy! (didn't drink them all by myself - shared them with friends) My fave would be the chocolate caramel!  The ladies of the cafe were all so nice even though we used their livingsocial deal. They were also very accomodating to customers with kids. TWO THUMBS UP to TIABI!!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Drinks!
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Generous Portions!!

qVxf3qlyiqjeZ7ri9okRSw.text: I'm all for helping out small, locally-owned shops, but to get me to visit a second time the food has to be good. With Tiabi, I'm on the fence. On one hand the B.A.T. wafflewich ($4.95) with its bacon, arugula, and tomato was delicious. I don't know what the Tiabi sauce in the wafflewich consisted of, but in combination with the other ingredients it made it unbelievably tasty. On the other hand, the Break-The-Fast wafflewich ($4.95) was a complete disaster. The whole thing looked sad. The sausage was barely warm, the cheese looked like it was straight out the fridge having had no contact with any heat to melt it, and the scrambled eggs looked like prepackaged/pre-cooked eggs found at McDonald's.  Somewhere in between in quality were the two waffle dishes I tried. Ordered as a Belgian waffle, the maple bacon waffle ($5.99) was thick and soft, as expected, with large chunks of bacon in the batter. The savory and saltiness of it in combination with the sweetness of the batter and syrup made it a solid choice all around. The red velvet waffle ($5.50), ordered as a classic thin waffle, lacked any crispness around the exterior. The flavor was well balanced with a moderate amount of chocolate chips and whipped cream giving it enough sweetness without making it too overindulgent.  With classic, Belgian, and vegan waffles, specialty coffee drinks and frozen drinks, there's plenty of promise here. Unfortunately, some of the execution on my visit was lackluster. And, don't expect fast service. Even with three employees hustling in the back we waited a while for our orders despite being the first ones through the door in the morning.

w1OeuB5wW-QoUYP7RsGUDQ.text: I tried this place because of the positive reviews on yelp and it looked amazing. The food was pretty tasty. I told the girl that was taking my order that this was my first time here and I wanted to try something like a breakfast and waffles. She said they have a breakfast waffle so I tried that. My fiance tried the breakfast sandwhich. I guess they are both the exact same thing except mine had bacon and hers had Turkey.  It's basically the items put on a waffle folded in half. I ordered a pumpkin latte as well which they forgot about. The guy manager (who wears a beanie and glasses) was busy talking to the new girl about how great of a "hands off" manager he is and if she had her shift drink instead of making the orders of the people standing in line. The trash cans and tubs of plates were overflowing.  Instead of talking please take care of your customers and clean the place. Nobody wants to eat in a filthy establishment. I dont think I'll be back here.

_rxSaDwA0ZokHuwPjIx-cw.text: Visited Tiabi with my father last week. He got a regular coffee meanwhile I ordered an iced mocha and one of their specialty waffles. My waffle was obviously homemade from scratch and even featured house roasted pecans and caramel drizzle. Both my father's coffee and my iced mocha were absolutely fantastic as well. We were very impressed by the friendly ambience and tasteful signage throughout the establishment. Would recommend coffee and waffles here for any one any time!

W7gs1u8MBbjIOYVkQySL_g.text: Absolutely love the place . Delicious waffles. And the I ed coffee too. Our favorite place. Make sure to visit

9gAiZq-GCqDhxi5lgChPLQ.text: This little gem was amazing!!! We found it on yelp. It was off the strip which was a nice change. It's by a target shopping center. The place is small and intimate. The menu is on the wall and very easy to read. I got a coffee and it came with a churro waffle! See the picture. It was sooo delicious! My banana waffle had bananas, nuts, and nutella drizzled on it. It was so amazingly good. I would have gone again if we were staying longer. Definitely will go again next time I'm in town!

L7TcnxZRwQ9KAwwbyhiAaQ.text: My favorite place to get coffee in Las Vegas. You must get coffee and a waffle. Nice place to stop and get away from the strip for some quiet. You must get a waffle! All of them are excellent.

CD7nZ34Fh7mjIdCKUrGOnA.text: BOMB. I got churro waffle and wildberry lemonade on my way to the airport, and it made me want to stay another day! The churro waffle was perfect! Delightfully cinnamon-sugary, but not overwhelming. The thin-ness of the waffle makes it even and crunchy all the way across, and the fruit & whipped cream on were presented beautifully. Owner (?) was super patient, kind, and helpful, and even went back and printed a receipt when I forgot to ask for one initially. This place deserves to be way bigger and pricier than it is.

lvUglfzhM5zfSi93DFEcmw.text: I hate leaving negative reviews, but hopefully this well encourage management to make some improvements.  First of all they're basically a self-service breakfast restaurant. I wish I would have known that before coming, because the last thing I want to do when I go out to breakfast in the morning is carry a bunch of stuff to my table. For instance, my order required 3 plates, how was I supposed to carry that, they didn't provide a tray.  The floors were dirty, my table was dirty and the tables all around me were also dirty. It's hard to enjoy a meal when there's so much uncleanliness around. Please clean your floors more often and take the time to clean tables once customers leave. Small details like this say quality. My waffle was also crunchy and cold... Sorry, again I don't like leaving negative reviews. The restaurant was super cute I think the self serve concept might be good enough for some people but when you're half sleep and just want some food it's not ideal. They did complete my order very quickly.

It's in a great location and prime for locals. The menu and I always have a fight due to so many choices. They drinks is amazing and the prices are exceptionally reasonable, too reasonable if you ask me. The crunch and flavor is everything. To top it off the customer service is the greatest. There were 2 people working only.  We waited about 30 minutes before getting our drinks. Then another 10 minutes for our food.  My drink was okay, but my guy said his coffee was good though. cvWjuvlJnzjm7Kx78KVqQw.text: TIP: get 10% off by checking into Yelp.   Waffles have a wonderful texture and taste.   Waffle Dilla (chicken, tiabi sauce and melted cheese) - chicken was moist and chopped up and the sauce/cheese/meet proportions were just right.   Viva Las Elvis (bananas, peanut butter, chopped bacon and honey on a waffle) - peanut butter was warm and creamy, bacon was thin and crispy bits. Overall, it was pretty good.   The prices match the serving size. It's a tad on the small side, but I didn't mind because it allowed us to try more items and not be overstuffed or have leftovers.  I didn't care for the pistachio latte. The pistachio taste was really difficult to find.   We went at an odd day/time, so service was fine. After we got our food, the line was super long. Since they have limited staff and equipment, I can definitely see them getting backed up.

-jV6JbH7s3ymt-TMwQD4hg.text: Awesome staff. Amazing food! I'm vegan and my partner is flexitarian and we both found stuff we LOVED. So much that we had to come back for breakfast the very next day. I got the Viva Las Elvis waffle with vegan coconut bacon and cold brew with soy milk. Soooooo good! She got a maple (real) bacon wafflewich and an iced Earl Grey tea latte with lavender. We were so stoked after breakfast that I had to get dairy free horchata gelato and a vegan cinnamon roll to sate my desire for more more more more more. Love this spot, and can't wait to visit again next time I'm in Vegas!!

UrRnUZH-n6C4ncg6RH5eSw.text: Tiabi aptly stands for "To Inspire and Be Inspired" and I was inspired to stuff my face hole with waffles.    Visited on Sunday 6-26-16 at 10AM.   $28.34 got us a breakfast waffle sandwich, two drinks, a side of fruit, a cookie, and a variety waffle. This restaurant is located two doors down from Sakana on Flamingo & Maryland behind Target.    I had the viva las elvis waffle for $6.99 which is a waffle topped with honey, peanut butter, bananas, and chopped bacon.  I was literally in heaven.  It's one of the best things I've ever eaten.  My only complaint would be they serve real maple syrup which I hate...I'd rather have the fake Aunt Jamima stuff clogging up my arteries and killing me slowly.  #DIABEETUS  I also had the Tiff's Waffle Macchiato for $3.95.  I had the iced version and it was wonderful.  I loved the whipped cream topping and the waffle on top was still warm and covered in cinnamon and sugar.    Service was fast and friendly.  I highly recommend this place.

Y0HISZjtMn8qISvGwoOPZA.text: Second time at Tiabi and we keep falling in love with the menu. The fresh brewed coffee is amazing. If you are Vegan then enjoy the Veggie Waffledilla that's on the menu. The snickers iced coffee is also a must.   Come here...enjoy the atmosphere and enjoy the food. Tiabi has the best waffles in the area...and they're 100% Vegan!!!!!

WA3GiuyK1Tf3u1_afrn5ng.text: The service was great, they gave us a free sample of the coconut refresher and the churro waffle, those will definitely be my choices next time. I just wished the waffles were a bit fluffier. Waffledilla was delicious!

HXuBo0FYFvWlTC82VlnJAg.text: Visiting Tiabi makes me wish there was one in Arizona! I love the concept here- all things waffle and coffee related. I came in with a suitcase as to make a quick last minute stop for breakfast and get a caffeine fix. The girl at the front was so friendly and welcoming!   What I had:   Breakfast Sandwich + well done bacon + extra cheese:  This was the perfect combination of sweet, fluffy, and savory (and crunchy from the bacon). One thing I was worried about was the waffle being too sweet, but instead it had subtle hints of maple flavoring. Perfect.  Tiff's Waffle Macchiato: A cinnamon vanilla macchiato topped with a churro waffle. A perfect creamy consistency, and the churro waffle adds the perfect touch of crunchiness- if you dip it into the drink. What dreams are made of.   Whenever I visit Vegas again, I'll definitely be stopping by to say hello again!

6s5xHb-wP7ZI9f8vfmMlaQ.text: So delicious! It's hard to find a coffee shop with good deserts but Tiabi really goes above and beyond. The waffles smell amazing and taste even better and the coffee and coffee drinks are equally delicious. Also a super cute place to hang out at with wi-fi. Highly recommend for breakfast or anytime of day to relax or for dessert.

0pYCWb-Ne4ADeVbXu0qZ6Q.text: Let's start it off by saying this: I friggin love waffles. I dream about soft waffles. I love waffles, I love strawberries, I love tea, juices, sandwiches, quesadillas... so I was REALLY looking forward to this place. We came in and we ordered the strawberry kisses and the west coast. Get a taste of sweet and savory. We also got the snickers coffee and some juice that was seasonal.  I'll start by saying I liked the snickers thing. But then I have to move into the bad part.  They seem to use the same waffle mix for their sweet and savory waffles. What does this mean? It means my breakfast was too savory and my lunch was too sweet. And I was very bummed. I swear, I wanted to like it. I might even try it again some day, in hope of a good wafflewich. But it fell short. The strawberries on top helped amp up the breakfast, but the lunch could not be saved. So be it. We had a great time at SeaQuest afterwards, but I'll keep dreaming of the perfect waffle and hope Tiabi can make it in the future. Still rooting for you, but can't justify more than 2 stars for now.

WejjU35noNkU1ItZNZ81vQ.text: this place is delicious! it lets you get your cup of Joe and a little more! the customer service is great!! they're all so nice! The ambiance is relaxing and you can just sit around and read your favorite book :)

W_6Dt0lIHBjaRBHLSMTm3g.text: Tiabi is located in the heart of Las Vegas on Maryland and flamingo in the target shopping mall. I like to support independent coffee shops, Tiabi is unique, and they have a variety of coffee flavors and a very large variety of waffles. I ordered the Churro-mon in which was a waffle with cinnamon sugar, I asked for the non-vegan waffle and whip cream on the top. I also ordered the lavender latte hot with almond milk. I had an enjoyable experience the waffle and the coffee were good. The place is clean and the staff is warm and friendly. My only issue was the location. I went early Sunday Morning around 830. There are some homeless men in the area but this part of Vegas has not gone through the revitalization that Freemont East has enjoyed yet, I do like the fact that Tiabi is located there, the area needs businesses like Tiabi to revitalize the area. I would like to support this local business, but I won't return. I was very uncomfortable with the homeless men in front of the shop. There was even a homeless man inside trying to make a purchase with change, he didn't have enough money and went back and forth with the cashier half the time I was there. I wanted to make sure I left the restaurant before Him so that I could get to my car. While He was talking to the cashier I quickly grabbed my purse and went to the door to leave, the homeless man was right behind me. Luckily He went the opposite way from where I was going. I was a little scared by this. I went to my car and locked my door. I noticed the homeless man that I saw inside was near the shop yelling and cursing at an invisible person. Also noticed that there was another homeless man in sitting in the parking lot singing very loudly to himself. Unfortunately I won't be back unless I go with a group. The neighborhood is too sketchy.

WrFBV8ngzeeFqKnskFQQXg.text: This place is the best! They have a very friendly staff and their waffles are on point!! I love their red bull apple cider and their waffle sandwiches!

EEy6qVJBGZIV2VjECGyPFA.text: Had probably the best waffle ever! Loved this place and the coffee was very tasty! Hubby had the waffle sandwich which was surprisingly great!

LqsFnNHhOVomd1JJJcDIug.text: The only negative I can think of is there's no storefront visible bike parking, though I can easily lean my bike and against the window and lock the tyre to prevent theft.  This place makes a bomb espresso for your training espresso shot.   This is my favorite place to grab lunch or breakfast in Vegas.  I live within walking distance and go about 1-2 times a month.  The staff always remembers me and I don't even have to mention that I'm vegetarian since my first visit.  My favorite is the Viva Las Elvis, they make this awesome vegan bacon that is made from coconut flakes in place of all their regular bacon items.  Another favorite of mine is the Guru Burger.  They are happy to try new combinations too if you ask.  My roommate is a carnivore and we always go together.  He really enjoys their non-vegan options as well.  Edit/Disclaimer.  I work here now as of a month ago.  This review was prior to my employment.

Fe7wbeV6LtCyjPBE3OL1Gg.text: pistachio Iced Coffee is better than #sex this place has so many creative options from down right satisfying to vegan options. I'm in love   Banana Nutella Waffle

q8fhFwfmrg13aoSc9aKMpA.text: Delicious food, vegan and gluten free friendly. Great service! Try the coconut cooler for a refreshing drink.

lt0kfgcGbgkKM-8KvNyn9g.text: Came here after reading Yelp reviews (thanks!) and was so glad I did!  The Westcoast was amazing! Staff was so friendly. I'll def b back.

ydK4uyvNUuBUQ0qCkmL0Xw.text: This place is great! Friendly, attentive staff and nice, relaxed ambiance. But the real star here is the food! I am an admittedly picky diner as I am a pretty good cook myself...Bacon-stuffed Belgian waffle was cooked to perfection!! Wanted to eat the whole thing but was pleasantly stuffed after adding a fresh fruit cup for a dollar and a caramel frappe. :) Fruit cup was amazingly fresh, tasty and ample (for only a dollar extra, mind you), and caramel frappe did not disappoint! Total cost was under 15 bucks with tip. -Not bad for Vegas fare!! Eat breakfast here over the Strip!!!!!

PfA1PWbRKozqi96X3m_NBg.text: I only visited this place due to a friend wanting to try it. I've had better. The waffles came out dry. I  ordered from their savory menu and to be honest it was disappointing. The items felt like it came from a box and wasn't that much of a difference from a fast food breakfast "sandwich".    I do not like the type of groupon they put out. You have to literally come back a couple of times to use all of them. The instructions are there but from now on I'm literally avoiding all groupons that expect you to come back each time to use. Actually I'm not even a fan of groupon but a friend convince me to try this place with her. Even she wasn't impressed due to the fact that she can make waffles at home that tasted better ( her words not mine).    Coffee drinks is a hit or miss. Some tasted ok and some tasted bitter.

rrgNy_b4dJ9btf8XkAyswQ.text: Came here for the first time the other day and really enjoyed it. I got the Guru Burger and thought it was quite good- this is definitely a compliment from me because, honestly, I'm not usually a huge fan of waffle sandwichs! My previous waffle sandwich experiences have always left me feeling like I could have made the sandwich at home with two Eggo waffles (and it, honestly, would have probably been easier to eat than the folded, taco-ish style they all go for!). This waffle sandwich blew my Eggo creations to the wayside- their waffles are really flavorful and fluffy, better than I've had in ages. I also had one of their seasonal lattes- the Fa La La Latte, because I'm a sucker for anything mint!- and a bit of the lavender latte on accident... which, leads me to my only complaint about this place. I came with a friend who has a very similar sounding name to mine and when the barista called out her name, we both thought it was mine because I had ordered a few minutes before her... well, we were definitely wrong! I thought the latte didn't have much mint to it (but it was damn good, either way!) but didn't think anything of it until the barista called out my name followed by the name of my latte about 5 minutes later. That could have been avoided so easily just by writing the name on the cup. Having to remake a drink sucks way more than taking the 5 seconds to write a name on the cup! Either way, great coffee and great waffles- would recommend! :)

Zfmpz3h0IZ8pVqkzuk-QjQ.text: It's pretty good, but not a place I'm dying to come back. Very low key place. Staff are friendly. Still on the hunt for a waffle place that meets all expectations for sweet and savory.

7G_5MaSBFfSFVPN8ZohO-A.text: Delicious pumpkin latte best I've ever had. I order this at many different coffee shops and always get a sugar punch to the throat. This one is not over syrup grossness, it's perfect. The organic toasty Tokyo is light and delicious too!

Bqe3Ndag_1NsrB44ZJMPvA.text: Where do I even start? I've driven by this place a zillion times & never knew it was there. I'm so glad I found out about it. A bunch of us went one day for lunch & the ONLY unfortunate thing was that it was already crowded so we waited for our food for quite a while. But it was worth it & I can't wait to go back & try more items! I had the west coast wafflewich which was seriously delish. I tried a bite of a friend's waffledilla which was also yummy. The owner (?) brought out churronimos for the table due to our long wait & holy yum. Appreciated the acknowledgement & gesture. Looking forward to my next visit!

bjWBusaLcBXZwRxP1stK9g.text: A good quick quiet brunch stop. Clean, soft good tunes, a gathering place with cards on the table. Simple tasty waffles. Coffee better than Starbucks - and I'm not saying their coffee is bad.

HsQqCNLc6t8udinL0kFjXA.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my waffle sandwhich and drink! I had the west coast wafflewhich (the tiabi sauce was AMAZING) and I had the strawberry sunrise smoothie. After I had those two I felt energized and ready to take on my 3 hour drive! This was a great place to stop and eat! My husband had the hashtag breakfast sandwich and kale champ smoothie. We both agreed my drink and sandwich were better but his was good too. You definitely have to smother the hashtag breakfast sandwich with maple syrup! YUM!

84pqENx7BzTbHY1chI_H6w.text: My best friend and I came here for brunch probably around 10:30am, and it was amazing! We both had the Dirty Mocha Chai, she had the Kisses and for me, Churronimo. Dirty Mocha Chai had good flavor, right amount of strength and not too sweet. The waffles were delicious! The staff is super friendly and the place had a great atmosphere. When we went it was easy to find seating. It was a really nice place to chill and hang out. I would definitely want to stop by again.

qUx88fTj3fJsfkFe_uZG9Q.text: This place is new & can get pretty busy.... But the food is awesome & the employees are Great....
