cVDYiZ9d4deTEruhkhrJfw.text: Disappointing. We ventured outside of the strip to try something different. In the mood for waffles so we tried this place based only on the good yelp reviews. It's only 3 miles from the strip but it's located in a very ghetto area, very seedy, didn't feel clean or safe. The waffle place was ok, low end diner. Food was average, nothing special. I don't think it's worth the drive outside of the main strip.

NYDFkfgUjQYXkhBGb3I-dw.text: Quaint little spot by UNLV, good coffee, enviroment and people; would come again

gIqCz5E2JTV4LvbleTqyDQ.text: Cool little cafe in the target plaza center. The cashier was nice and friendly. My hubby had the hashtag breakfast waffle sandwich which was awesome. I had the smores waffle which was a little too rich and sweet for me and I have a serious sweet tooth. I also had the green nut smoothie which was pretty good as well. The wait however was pretty long like 45 mins to receive our food and I was almost late to an appointment. There's vegan options for vegans that I thought was cool. I'll give them another try though to get my own breakfast waffle sandwich.

5nzFCakqzyLXvlvqBzzEnA.text: Food was good, place was decent, waiting for waffles to be prepared was a bit tooooo long. With lots of good reviews, they need to buy more waffle makers to speed up service

mZxJ8JviolMXe4YIyStRdA.text: I love that there's a breakfast place near UNLV that has vegan choices! Actually their yums, including waffles and smoothies are great all day long and their dishes are artfully displayed (like their vegan waffle with strawberries and bananas on top)! I love their vegan waffle burger, and my go to smoothies of theirs are the kale champ and the banana berry ones. Mae and Tiffany, the owners of To Be Inspired And Inspire are always happy and positive and their helper bees are great too! They also play a great mix of great tunes in their shop!

DmKzV17dxdra3KtwjDGJtA.text: Found this place on yelp when I didn't feel like walking 2 miles to dunkin donuts. Right from the start great customer service. Incredibly friendly cashier and most importantly amazing food. The waffles had the perfect texture and the fruit was so fresh. I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for breakfast in the area.

ZOzJRa0Cb2VyApZGOP1yWA.text: I Don't Live in Vegas and found this place off the beaten path. I love it! Vegan or non-Vegan you can go and have a great meal a good cup of coffee/smoothie in a very pleasant setting. The staff here is some of the best I have encountered in Vegas. They're friendly, helpful and always seemed to have a smile (even when things got busy and everyone was under pressure).  I now make this a place I stop at when coming to visit a few times a year. So, my only caveat to anyone reading this is this, if you are in a super hurry call a head, everything is made to order and it takes some time to cook those amazing Belgian waffles to perfection. So kick back and enjoy, I did!!

8VCnxYsTGh9IdU6hNPC3FQ.text: The food was great. But had to knock off a star for the service. Maybe could use another personnel be out on the floor to clean up especially on weekends. I mean why give the customer a wash cloth to clean the table themselves. Other than that it's a must to go try out the food.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very very good!!!

FokIBUGo_6MNx2SCQUxv_g.text: Friendly service with sweet treats. Enjoyed my coffee, I forgot what it was called, something like a Joe Special I think. Remembered it was sweet and satisfying. My friends had their own coffee and waffles and were happy. This place will make you smile :-)

isC1m-WOci1xjDsHGAKH_w.text: This place tries to be different and the prices are very reasonable which is nice. The food feels terribly pre made and the salad I ordered was a joke.

3glR_dHZqq4jUJzSwu-dtg.text: I love their waffles, crunchy and light! We had a golden waffle with green tea ice cream and a West Coast Wafflesich, the food is clean and fresh. If you like something light and refreshing(more of a Japanese taste than American style), definitely come here!

OS7X4dJor3MUwjLS4E0YJQ.text: This place is a must when you visit Vegas. Its a little way off the beaten track but worth the short trip from the strip.  My husband and I got the west coast and hash tag breakfast sandwich and strawberry sunrise smoothie. The west coast was good BUT the hash tag breakfast sandwich was hands down..the best waffle sandwich I ever had. The waffle was so airy, fluffy, and buttery and the sausage and egg was puuuurrrfect. The smoothie was the best I ever had.  The guy at the register was so chill and patient while we couldn't make up our mind! We also had a red velvet lollie and it was was such a treat. I give this place 2 thumbs up!

OSU34ur_YeQnTmFOiuVZQg.text: Totally random in a weird little shopping plaza. Quaint inside, but everything we ordered was delicious. Hard to find a good vegan waffle and this place has it! Also, the woman behind the counter that served us was super nice.

vcNicVajq6W2d5ZXnxo77w.text: Vegan Belgian waffles with tasty toppings!! Fun little place with excellent food, great coffee and reasonable prices. Always hit it up when I'm in town. I recommend the Vegan La Elvis.

c-pxN3oBB0Mua1xEX2y2CQ.text: So cute and so yummy! Always have gotten the West Coast sandwich and check in for a free lolli

TnnfGhN5TiNEef_UEE3M8Q.text: My friend and I were looking for a new coffee shop type place to go to and we came across this little joint. It's very hidden, in the ghetto. It's on Maryland and flamingo in the target shopping center. We walk in, there's no where really to sit. It's a very cute shop but really small. Super clean. Everything on the menu sounded sooo good. I literally couldn't decide for like 15 minutes lol. The service was great. I got a waffle and coffee, and my total came out to like 14 bucks! I was so confused. I could've gotten Starbucks and a Belgium waffle from Egg Works for less than that. Definitely not worth that much money. I would go there more often if it wasn't so expensive and in the hood of Las Vegas.

9pFebl2fkCAsCNUTNcwb4w.text: The atmosphere was perfect! It was just the right amount of cozy and chill, and the noise level was just right. The brew of the day was Guatemalan which I loved because I could drink it black. It wasn't too bitter and I felt it was sweeter then most other beans. I had the hashtag breakfast which was tasty. The waffle had a good balance of softness and crunchy. I also had a side of chips which I believe were barbecue flavor and it was way better than the Lay's ones. 10/10 would want to come here again to try their other items like the normal waffles or the dessert waffle taco.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hashtag breakfast sandwich with a side of chips and coffee

UjtFxroxP2naqhoxlhYcdw.text: This place is my new favorite for breakfast or lunch. Their waffles are EXCELLENT, and who knew you could make a slammin savory sandwich or burger with waffles? SO FREAKING GOOD!! The smoothies are also delicious. I'm vegan and gluten free. The waffles are already vegan, just ask for the gluten free mix. They are super friendly and accommodating. Try the coconut bacon and the banana peanut butter smoothie. And the Tiabi sauce is great. Yay, waffles...!!

AWK9Use4FyRRziZAxLQukw.text: Tasty and inexpensive, this little gem is a great spot for a coffee or yummy waffles.   Be sure to note the Vats of Nutella.  :)

iN9HMPDBEj6nB87KqoR8NQ.text: SMOOTHIE IS THE BEST THING HERE......not coffee....or waffles  For a place that is specifically a coffee and waffle place... Both the coffee and waffles are not that great. The coffee is mainly milk and barely any coffee. We tried a skinny latte, iced coffee, tiffs coffee with a waffle on top. The coffee flavor is not strong at all but mainly milky ... Maybe next time we should just order black coffee.  The waffles on the other hand are kinda soggy. They are topped with so much whipped cream and sauces that is what probably took out the good crunch in the waffle.  The best thing at this place was their smoothies surprisingly. I would give their smoothies a 5! The Green Nut is absolutely the best smoothie ever! And it is healthy with almond and kale it is so refreshing!! I would highly recommend it to anyone. I would come here again but ONLY to get another smoothie not for anything else.   Also there is a good groupon for this place my friend and I tried it out we each bought $24 worth at this place. But interestingly enough the Groupons  come in three separate Groupons worth $8 each. I am ok with that because we can come multiple times, but when I came with my friend he had his groupon and I had mine and they had the audacity to question us and tell us that we cannot use it when coming within "one visit" well he bought his separate and I bought mine. It is a different transaction who cares it is also separate visit because it is his visit, then my visit.  Also,what if I wanted to use my second groupon would it be considered a "different visit" if I walked out the door then came back in? They are sticklers about this rule so if you bought a groupon then watch out they are going to grill you about it!

GeGHcEcH0XgrhMj8lIAyiw.text: I absolutely love this place! Great location right next to campus. So on long school days, plan on stopping by especially during happy hour and grab a great coffee along with a little snack (the waffle that comes along with the drink!) Service is amazing and the baristas are always super friendly.

I1IP0Ds04U7DxAsScbdURw.text: I've always come here for drinks. First time I tried food there was yesterday and had that West Coast Wafflewich. Amazing! Not too heavy for all those flavors and that Tiabi sauce was out of this world! Had a Sirena Tea to go with the wafflewich, very refreshing. A must-return-to-restaurant for sure.

gFjk2LPQsb25cnSPrD2oGQ.text: Used to love this place. The food tastes delicious and they have wifi, so I can study here. I introduced many of my family and friends to this place.  That being said, the service is below average. Not only is the wait time long (they only had 2 or 3 waffle makers, understandable bc they're a small mom and pop shop which I loved), but the owner/worker takes customer requests and suggestions personally. I asked for strawberries and Nutella on my waffle, as I always ordered it. When I received it, there were no strawberries. I hate to complain about food bc they have the power to spit in it when you're not looking, but I thought they'd be ok with me asking since I'd been there several times previously. When I asked, they took a few minutes and handed over a small bowl of sliced strawberries. I thought they were going to add it to my plate, so I brought it up to the counter. When she saw I did this, she grudgingly said,"Oh, you wanted ME to put those on there?" I replied that I could do it, a little embarrassed.   The reason this was a red flag for me is because one of my earlier stops there, I heard the staff talking about a recent Yelp review. The review spoke of the bad service the customer received. The girl in question defended herself and stated she did nothing wrong. I didn't think anything of this the first time. A subsequent time I was there, a foreign couple (Italian accent?) was asking why their 2 waffles were not similar and if they could remake one because they enjoyed the crispier one. The same owner/worker who didn't take criticism well kept insisting that it was made the same and they just had to let it sit longer to get the crispy consistency.   At that point, I hadn't been crossed by one of her moods yet, so I continued visiting to get my delicious coffee, waffles and to study. Then, that day hit as it inevitably would. I haven't returned since and don't intend to. Customer service is key, any business owner should know this.   Since I know you (the owners) read the Yelp reviews, I'd like to offer up some constructive criticism: you should cater to your customers. If you take these comments personally and become defensive, your customers will only continue to be dissatisfied with your service.

JUbQEVLH0f7RIS_psVC9VQ.text: I had their best seller, Banana Nutella waffle and Caramel Machiato.  Waffle was good, coffee too. Ambiance is alright, casual but the music was a bit too loud.  I'd like to come back to try their savory items.

Eb6o9FGdAmwoWSQ9OMeZoQ.text: Located in a strip mall on Maryland, tiabi offers good breakfast food and smoothies at a good price. Good customer service and good music, I definitely recommend

YqKhMglrfu9cJgsJe7dUEw.text: Words cannot describe this place the staff is amazing and the waffles are to die for ( taste them before you put syrup on it ) I had the butter pecan and my son had the banana tella both were amazing and we were glad we didn't put syrup on them because they were loaded with flavor from the first bite to the last

S_woSaJGAenigoiUODVnCw.text: I was looking for a place to do some work i with tables and Wi-Fi and came across Tiabi.  Had a great early dinner here consisting of the recommended West Coast Wafflewich with housemade chips and a Just Peachy iced tea (with less sweetener).  The Wafflewich was good (wasn't the biggest fan of the tomatoes, as I felt it was too much of a soft component, I took them out and replaced them with some chips and added the crunch I was looking for) and the peach tea was great. (next time, I'll get all the sweetener--who am I kidding).   Later, I additionally had an Almond Milk Green Tea Latte and it's possibly my favorite Green Tea Latte I've ever had.  It was refreshingly nutty and not overly sweet.  The owners who had served me were great and friendly personalities and I can't wait to come back here again with others.

JpjVJmKhQAMnpvDibYLk6w.text: Good coffee and good waffles.  Impressed with thr vegan waffle.  Service was excellent

5dpnfO4hP5GAF-4McbvVSg.text: We found this hidden gem on happy cow on our way back from Hoover Dam. Its in a small strip mall. We walked in to a fun and compfy shop. We were greeted with happy smile and very friendly service. We ordered the West Coast for me and the vegan Guru Burger for my boyfriend. Both were amazing and super tasty. We also split the Green Nut smoothie. I would tell everyone to come and try this gem whether your vegan or not, there is something for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The West Coast with fresh fruit

X3OCruAMSTTQc_-HW4dTAg.text: Dang ... finally a place dedicated just waffles ... The Bananatella and Waffledilla is awesome...

7J52cUaNgzZE5j1FdjvbFg.text: WAFFLES + AMAZING STAFF = Why are you not here already? Selene (sp?) was terrific... She has great energy and was very friendly along with the rest of the staff! Customer service is very important to me and they nailed it.   The texture of the waffles was so so perfect. Soft on the inside with a slight crunch on the outside. I ordered the hashtag and was pretty sad when there was no more left after I engulfed it all. The ambiance was also nice- upbeat music and fun art on the walls.  Definitely an excellent choice for a cheat meal or any day!

puW7QxkkNUJVdE10PvMaNw.text: I love waffles! I saw this on Yelp and I had to make a visit. It was a cute place. Good atmosphere. I got the hashtag breakfast sandwich, which was good, but it wasn't amazing. It was a waffle sandwich with turkey sausage, egg and cheese served with fruit. Something I could make at home. I also got the "Honey I'm Home" dessert waffle. It was like a churro waffle with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and I loved it! TIABI is good, but not amazing compared to other waffle sandwich places I've visited in California. Their waffles aren't as good quality. Other places are more light, crispy and fresh.

nZon_yd4dbLp2W3Hukup7w.text: We found this place on Groupon it is Delicious if you are in Vegas you need to stop in we (4 of us) had the Butter Pecan Waffle, Wafflewiches, Strawberry kisses, latte, macchiato OMG this was awesome.  The staff was the best J is so cool. Will visit when we visit Vegas again.

OQLkNUDRqaqyVyUCCjiCRg.text: SOOO good! I got the Elvis waffle- very good. Great staff!!! The manager is literally the nicest person in the world- Recommend this 100% !!!

33L3pJWrl1RidXADxOJjyQ.text: Very good food and service! The waffles are perfect consistency and the drinks flavorful.  Please build one in Henderson!!

qsSTD5k_uFyTY9CqP47ffg.text: I love the small business feel of this restaurant. Reasonable prices for great food. I almost always order the vegan version of the Viva Las Elvis and it never disappoints. If you're confused on any part of the menu, they will take the time to explain anything to you. No pushy upselling either which is definitely a plus. Be prepared to wait based on the amount of people ahead of you since everything is made to order. However, definitely worth the wait!

TljVT68Qo4bRVo2A3zCXQg.text: Great waffles, coffee and vibe. 5 mins from UNLV can't wait to go back and try a waffle sandwich. The waffle macchiato was amazing! Wish the cashier was a little more friendly considering it was our first time. Didn't really give any suggestions.  Deff worth checking out!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pac man waffle n coffee.

J3TseQyS-TkfilS8g3MI_w.text: We drove 20 minutes from our hotel to get to this little spot and I'm glad we did. It's unique and the waffles were worth the wait. West coast waffle and the chocolate coconut latte were amazing!!!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon waffle, red velvet latte and bananutella waffle

qA3o8N1IJfHneoXOsgRQ9Q.text: Food was actually a little bland, waffles had no flavor to them unfortunately, my sister & I got the red velvet waffle to share, she got the vegan sandwich & I got the breakfast sandwich. If the breakfast sandwich didn't have bacon on it, I would've tasted like I was eating nothing.   Coffee was excellent definitely would return just for the coffee alone. Great atmosphere & the ladies working were very pleasant. Just wish the food had more flavor.

QkV26gepucAKt7UhxQGDyQ.text: It has a very unusual menu...My husband and I are seniors and this is in a UNLV neighborhood by Target so we are not their usual clientele.  But, if they come to Henderson I am there.  They have waffles for every kind of meal from breakfast to dinner.  I had the bacon waffle and my husband had the Western waffle (chicken bacon avocado etc) and their coffee is excellent and he had lemon ginger tea.  Kids would love that place.  The only thing that keeps us from giving it the 5th star is that it is too small and the tables and chairs are not that comfortable and really no decor...so you are there primarily for their menu and they don't let you down there.    PS...if you order something that requires butter, have them butter it.  Those little butter things are a bugger to open and they said they don't mind pre buttering for you.

U9u-UJjeN7KEdo06doDbRg.text: One of our fav breakfast places- you order and sit so it's a great place to go with kids because you won't have to wait a long time. Healthy options as well as sweet ones and we've always had nice customer service.

rxzMrXT3hA2ihUUMHR7ASQ.text: This small, locally owned eatery is close to UNLV.  It is in the Target shopping center and is difficult to find the first time.  But it's worth it!  The food is spectacular!  The waffles are crispy and chewy, the coffee is delicious, and the ambience is fun and quirky.   It is apparent that customer service is very important, as all customers are treated well.  Both the savory and sweet waffles are fantastic!  It should be a must go for every Las Vegan!

ki5V0nr0jtQvQTg8IIAF_g.text: WAFFLES. But with a twist. Tiabi Coffee & Waffle presents some of the lowest priced yet uniquely invented waffle creations in Las Vegas. Their menu boasts inventions like the Maple Bacon, in which they cook the waffle with bacon inside of it! Strawberry Kisses is one of their signature waffles with frosty white whipped cream on top of sliced strawberries topped with a chocolate drizzle. It's simple, it's delicious, it's unique, and I keep coming back for more!

f91lXsgnv4DxPv-tNfgwSg.text: get the breakfast sandwich with bacon or turkey sausage and a small regular hot coffee. promise you won't be disappointed. this is now a regular "going to vegas" staple for breakfast/brunch.

1K6ZZF9sPV0TxQ0RKCUQGg.text: Came here on my recent trip to Vegas because I didn't want the traditional pancake breakfast. This place is located in a strip mall so it was a little tricky to find. No menus just stand up and order from the board. The iced macchiato I ordered was absolutely delicious & came with a piece of churro waffle. My waffle breakfast sandwich was also very tasty and my grandparents loved their meals as well. My grandma had a red velvet waffle and my grandpa had a blueberry waffle. Cute little place and I would return next time I'm in town for your not so traditional breakfast experience.

6SFDZroSUqS2_hlwAupd-w.text: This place was my favorite a couple of years ago when they first opened and had only one location. Today I had a random craving to get the one drink I sideways get from them, kale champ smoothie.   Out of all the kale drinks I have tasted and tried theirs was by far the best and I literally had it every other day. Today though, years later, my bf went to pick one up for me.   When I first saw it my initial reaction was that it looked more green than usual. And then when I tried it, it was definitely NOT the kale champ I knew and loved. It was waaaay too bitter and I felt they left out an ingredient, maybe banana. Had I gone there and ordered it myself and tried it before leaving, I would have asked them to recheck it or add something to it to make it drinkable. I feel it's a waste of money just throwing it out so I'm forcing myself to gulp large amounts of it. I may have to adjust it myself too but it's just disappointing...

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Way too bitter than usual, must&#39;ve left something out. I can already tell by the deep color..

ekI6jGnoaGHCJ52sLZjRqw.text: Searched on yelp for breakfast places when our first choice was closed. From the look of their waffle pictures, I knew my search was over. Crispy on the outside and fluffy in the inside and best of all, their waffles are thin! Menu is to your left as you enter, went with the breakfast waffle. Scrambled eggs were cheesy and slightly undercooked, which I also really love (don't judge please)... they were yummy, but the bacon was super thin and I seemed old. 4 stars because the lady who took our order never took off her glove and after she touched my cash she went to the coffee machine and touched some things. Unsure if she quickly changed it when I turned around but I'm leaning towards no because when I watched her in the kitchen prior to waiting for her to take our order, she touched some waffles to check if they were ready then she came to the register and took our order. :/

rZCMmYXxV_29rfrUN4k5NQ.text: Get the hell off of the strip & check out the bomb food places around Vegas and Henderson. This place has good prices, good portions, a comfortable feel, & good people working the shop. It puts all that mega-hyped bourgie trash on the strip to shame. Fuck all that noise. Come here, get a westcoast waffle sammich, get some coffee, get happy.

oDviyXeYKzUXWrme2Xy0iw.text: Best waffle spot in Vegas.  Hands down. The waffledilia with avocado is always a good choice.  The Thai basil waffle is also tasty and zesty

uybH8hvM1lSpeE-y3sAQ3w.text: Ambience and the vibe is very nice, food came out fast as well. Great place to hang around in between class.

6TiY2jSivV8l47E6EuEDeA.text: This place is super adorable and has amazing food! Great location to get away from the main strip for a little while. Service is quick and food comes out fast.

L7TloceRRn5l2pI1nf4XPw.text: I was so excited to try this place. I always try to find unique places in Vegas and this placed sounded just like that.  Why three stars? Well, it's a great idea for a business using waffles on every single plate but unfortunately their waffles are not unique.  We ordered: - Kisses Waffle - Golden Waffle - Waffledilla  - South West Sandwich - Breakfast Sandwich  - Americano - Chai Latte - tuxedo frap - waffle caramel ice coffee  While the whole menu idea is creative, some of the waffles were burnt and crunchy. The kisses waffle, golden waffle and Waffledilla were so toasted that it would hurt to eat them.  All others were soft and done the right way. Flavor was ok but nothing to wow anybody. I just feel that they are missing something that makes their waffles in general stand out.  Their drinks were amazing. I would definitely come back for drinks. Tasty and several options available.  The Good: - Great cafe in a random strip mall - Nice Staff - Great Drinks - Only one of the very few places that have Stevia  The Bad: - Burnt Waffles - We got all coffees on to-go cups although we ate there.  - No High-Chairs available

4RCvBpPYFIMa5rlRhJ3Cxw.text: This is an adorable little coffee shop!! You really feel the love for the bean while you are here!  The french press coffee was SO GOOD! It made me want to go out and buy one! But having one here is way more fun!!  The lattes and espresso were amazing as well. Watching them swirl your latte into a beautiful drinkable piece of art!  And tastes so good! Amazing!!  Oh....And don't say no to the Waffles! Made to order delish! Love Tiabi!! It is a really special place!  And the owner Tiffany told me they are getting ready to open a roastery too! Take my money! I can't wait! I hope they have 5lb bags!

The Waffledilla sauce was like a chipotle sauce and my son said really good!  Will be back...need to try desserts next!  Return visit:  always good! Prices are reasonable plus we got a 10% for checking in !! Food tastes great you can taste the flavors from fresh strawberries whip and all that !! If I lived in Vegas I would definitely be here all the time !! Definitely recommend !! :)

The lavender latte was good, not too sweet and had a good taste of the espresso. Mine tasted only like a shot of burnt espresso.  I'm giving 3/5 stars for the concept, but I won't be a regular

kC-tAUS3hRbAvgQXqEKbZw.text: Great waffle! Good prices. I had a vegan waffle with strawberries, whip cream and drizzle in chocolate. Amazingly tasty. I had a similar waffle on the LV Strio for a lot more. There are other vegan choices as well such as the guru burger. Well worth the drive to find this place. Will definitely return when back in town. Wish I had one near my home.

The grilled chicken I had was similar to the grilled chicken at Subway and the back is extremely thin. The Tiabi sauce I couldn't even taste. The sandwich should have better quality of ingredients and more sauce. Staff was very nice and patient, gave great recommendations.

qQ_IsxbH1xFMBNd9T5td-g.text: This is the best waffle place I've ever been to. They had sweet and savory waffles. I ordered the savory Thai basil a fb my husband ordered the guru burger. They were both phenomenal!

YzQRrz1y9bwxBW1kdZZ0Lw.text: A couple of months ago on a beat the street campaign (as I like to call it) a young lady came into my gym and handed me a flyer to this coffee and waffle bar.. Well, fast forward to today and I decided to come in for a coffee and bite to eat. I was instantly met with a lovely charm that was warm and refreshing to my soul. Adrian greeted me with a smile and kind patience as my indecision kicked in. I ordered a white mocha with almond milk (huge win) and the flavors that came from my cup tickled my senses and angered me because I deprived myself for so long from this treat. Anyway.. I look forward to being back soon and seeing where else this Vegas gem can take my senses..  Thank You Adrian!

qu7Db4dyEiBbov8cHxwDxQ.text: This is my second time here and it is great! The waffles are really good, I never know what to order because everything sounds delicious. Would recommend if you are in the area! :)

huN2HN5A-oo0sMj_3IH8Uw.text: The waffles are magic in your mouth. I'm not a big waffle fan, but this place does it right. Crispy on the outside and nice and airy on the inside. There's a variety of waffle sandwiches and waffle desserts and the coffee choices makes it hard to pick just one.

3sVPsLl6dUU5TGAg-J6VWA.text: What a delightful find! We're semi-stranded waiting for a tire change and Tiabi came to the hunger rescue! Loved out waffle-sandwich and kale champ smoothie!

mmzIKMkf3f31AsOoYY7Kvg.text: Cute place. Nice selection of waffles, waffle sandwiches and other items. Happy they have vegan options. The waffles were the perfect texture, light and crispy. The coffee was really good, too.

32NMtYynG7g1iImVQAbVFA.text: We were looking for a simple breakfast place in the land of Casino breakfasts and we are glad we found Tiabi! Excellent service and very yummy food. The maple Bacon Waffle was great and reminded me of when my Dad used to make bacon waffles! Ah, sweet reminiscence! The West Coast Waffle sandwich was also delicious and it improved on a very decent chicken sandwich with the addition of waffles. If you're liking for a giant Denny's style breakfast menu this is not the place but if you want some really good waffles Tiabi is an excellent choice!

Xw5Co-WOxB5QGErnMMnwNQ.text: This place is great! Today I had the west coast sandwich and it was amazing. One of the best sandwiches in the area. The chicken is perfect for the sandwich. The smoothies are really good as well the first time I had a smoothie with tofu I didn't think I would like it because of the tofu but it gets better ever time! nNAI01ax0xfxaiN1ufvkKg.text: I really want this place to succeed (who wouldn't want two young entrepreneurs to be successful?)  but some improvements are needed. We were lured here by a Groupon offer. I hope this critique is viewed by the owners and taken into consideration with this in mind. I love the concept of a waffles and coffee shop. Our coffees and waffles were very tasty and we did enjoy the food (maple bacon and red velvet). However, a place that specializes in waffles really needs more than one regular waffle iron and I would also like to see the option of a Belgian waffle added. Heck there are even waffle irons that make waffles shaped like the state of Texas...that would be a fun addition. Invest in more waffle irons! When ordering coffee to drink in the restaurant it is much, much better served in a glass coffee cup/mug. The paper plates and very cheap plastic utensils did not provide the best presentation. At the very least try to budget for a better quality of eating utensils. Again- the coffee (an iced snickers coffee, a latte and a cupcake coffee) were all very good, so maybe glass mugs can be added to make them perfect. The atmosphere is okay but I would encourage the addition of some cozier seating and decor...I would have ordered another coffee and stayed longer. I liked the chalkboard wall. The place was a bit cluttered with trash, overflowing trash cans and our table was sticky with dried syrup from what seemed to be days old. There were no pastries in the pastry case which made me sad. The music was too loud at first but was adjusted and included a nice variety of genres. This place has big potential. I realize it takes a lot of money to open a business and hopefully the owners can make some adjustments and improvements to make Tiabi a place to return to. Good luck girls!

iQDp9vBChTfeOimcPlpPSQ.text: This is a cute coffee shop that makes amazing drinks and food. The atmosphere is very nice. The food is made so fresh and it is a great breakfast and coffee shop! Definitely worth a try!

The two ladies working also seemed to enjoy their job and life in general, which is nice to see. The only deduction made was due to the wait time.   Only one worker to prepare food?  Seems inefficient, particularly during a morning rush.

ZCTWPCtDCCIYEhH2XohIcA.text: Delicious food with plenty of vegan options. The smoothies and specialty coffee drinks are also great and reasonably priced.

biwtbMU4gUN6Dkmt0ZyRCg.text: This is a great little coffee shop near my house. In a really great area with great music and a great atmosphere. Interesting food options as most of it includes waffles as a burger or sandwich or an open faced waffle. I love that they offer student discounts and discounts for checking in on Yelp on top of that. VonWs6HJW4ZmSJNwQzOnUQ.text: Items ordered: "Snickers" Iced Coffee Lollies - Red Velvet, Nutella & Almonds Kisses - Sliced strawberries, chocolate drizzle and whipped cream, served Belgian style Viva Las Elvis - Bananas, peanut butter, chopped bacon and honey Honey I'm Home - Vegan Churronimo waffle tossed in cinnamon and sugar topped with vanilla ice cream and honey  Tucked away in a small strip mall off Maryland Parkway and dotted with cute decor plus paintings from local artists it was alongside two friends that I sat down for a midday snack at Tiabi Coffee & Waffles and as much as I really wanted to like the kitschy little spot and their menu of made-to-order takes on the European classic our experience could best be described as mixed, an effect of dogmatic rules regarding the use of discounts and coupons alongside batters that proved utterly unremarkable, the toppings alone serving to save the day in the case of standard and $1-upcharged "Belgian" options, both.  Apparently named as an acronym of the underlying motto "to inspire and be inspired" with free WiFi and an innovative drink list including a rich caramel and cocoa infused iced coffee for myself plus a heavily praised honey cream iced latte for my friend it was after only a few moments of indecision that our order was placed and chatting while we waited the tasting soon began with a duo of $2.50 "lollies," the single strips of spongy dough pressed between hot metal proving paltry in portion and largely flavorless save for the sweet finishing drizzle that unfortunately warned of things to come.  Entirely eschewing savories in favor of items far more sweet it was after perhaps a twenty minute wait that our proper order arrived and beginning first with a doughy Belgian topped with fresh berries beneath artificial tasting chocolate I quickly turned my attention to the alternatives, the Elvis faring a bit better by balancing sweet and savory over a slightly more study base while the "Honey I'm Home" proved the best of bunch in its sugar-crisp coating overlying a somewhat dense crumb - its "veganism" thoroughly compromised by honey and ice cream but the result all the better for it.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lollies - Red Velvet, Nutella &amp; Almonds

vfqJdSlMYiXiBgkFx4uh3A.text: The place has a really nice vibe to it. Very laid back, but the wait was a little too long. My girlfriend and I waited for at least 20 minutes for two sandwiches and a shake. The sandwiches and their prices were good, but they weren't that very filling for a person who is hungry. I'd like to come back here, but maybe on a slow day or when I'm not in a rush.

_ro0ywt6ieZcDeDg2ExA0A.text: Time to update. Yesterday's visit wasn't very pleasing. I cannot believe how long it took to get my food...and the nice gal at the cashier took down my name incorrectly so after waiting an excruciating long time for my food, I wasn't sure if my name was being called. They keep calling "Maria" when my name is "Nadia"...I looked around and noticed no one was responding to "Maria" so I went up to the counter to clarify the name...With an attitude, one of the girls making a drink said "isn't that what you  ordered?" (as if the sandwich was exclusive to me alone)... I said "yes, but before I take the food I want to make sure it's actually my order and not some Maria that could be nearby". After taking the food I sat down and immediately overheard the same girls  gossiping about me, laughing and saying my name. Whatever. At least wait until the customer leaves to trash talk. The Thai sandwich was just okay. The waffle was too soft and when I bit into it it was unpleasantly soggy. It's been that way on each visit. The idea of a waffle sandwich is good, by if it isn't cooked crispy enough, it ends up tasting like dough. I think I'm going to scratch this place off my list.

1qkM9h8L7J2YLUvuCUyVWw.text: As I sit here recovering from the prior nights festivities, relaxed, content, and belly full from a hashtag breakfast sandwich(photo will follow), I'm actually debating whether to have a waffle dessert.  Being that I'm always in search for new and exciting places to experience, this place is now my goto coffee spot for the Vegas Road Trips.   If you love Belgian waffles, you will enjoy these.  They make the Vegan batter here in the premises.  I'm not Vegan, but I am for the period of time it takes to scarf one. They have many of sandwiches and desserts to choose from, all made with waffles, including the Churronimo(a waffle churro), which I wolfed down yesterday.    The coffee items that I've experienced so far are the Red Velvet Latte, speaks for itself, and the Espresso Frankenstein.  One would think the Frankenstein to be a very strong and intense drink, one would be correctamundo.  Four shots, ice, and agave, all blended together into a very light and frothy monster of a drink...don't be scared, try it!  Even though it's strong, it's not bitter strong.  You can really taste the roasted smoothness of the beans.   Yes TIABI has hit a home run with me.  The staff is lively, informative, accommodating and diligent.  To the owners Mae and Tiffany I thank you.

The waffles itself reminded me of the HK egg waffle taste, except not as sweet.  For my drink I ordered a Dirty Mocha Chai. It came in a cute mason jar cup. I could mostly taste the mocha but not so much the chai. It was a good drink but don't think I will get it again.  Can't wait to come back and try some of their waffle desserts!

-KOvE5k-0OrURcuviDvPGA.text: There's only one waffle sandwich I order here and that's the waffledilla. It's exactly what you think it is: a waffle quesadilla. It's a subtly sweet, overly savory serving of food heaven layered in a healthy serving of cheese, chicken, and their very own Tiabi sauce all densely packed in a crispy yet soft waffle, usually accompanied with a side of deliciously flavored kettle chips (add $1.00).   I guess the only complaint I have is that the sandwich isn't big enough to satisfy my hunger, and at $5.79, I really wish it came with two waffledillas. Heck, I'd pay a little extra if there was a special two wafflewich combo. Make this happen, guys! There are too many times where I just end up ordering two anyways.

They have daily lunch specials for around $6. so i ordered the signature tiffs waffle macchiato (its topped with a CHURRO WAFFLE!)  And a waffledilla ( yes a quesadilla but with a waffle! E5U80nRYNnQlxt3lVbUM8Q.text: If I could eat a waffle a day, I'm pretty sure it would keep the doctor away. Tiabi is a cute little cafe/waffle bar located near UNLV that offers an array of waffle treats, cafe drinks, and waffle-caffe drink treats. I ordered the Strawberry Kisses waffle with vanilla ice cream. A thin, soft & warm waffle covered in strawberries, cream, ice cream, and chocolate is a great afternoon treat. They also offer vegan ice cream ;)   The space itself is cute and surely a spot you could hang out for a bit and read a book, but it might be more of a quick hang-out & eat spot than an all day hang out & work spot.   Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LLlq00YsKMuqZCw79lPyYA.text: This was my second visit to TIABI...I went last year when I was there for a conference...this place is hands down the best breakfast and brunch place in Vegas...they may not have a HUGE menu, but they have multiple options for breakfast and lunch and drink options. Last year I had the red velvet and this year I had the pecan waffle along with a smoothie...great food and great service.

NanSW9LgwLJefhYxUIdQtA.text: You MUST eat here. Not only so delicious and good customer service- it's not pricy at all! . Not only is the food amazing- the coffee is spectacular. This is a must try. Wishing there was one in Chicago!

OdJNmU4s8_9Hw8B02F5B7Q.text: I love this place!! It's one of the first cafe's I visited upon first coming to Vegas & it's by far one of my faves. I tell everybody I know that they MUST come here at least once! The entire staff is always so pleasant & eager to please. It's a small, family run business. Their waffles are sooo good. They also make delicious drinks & some vegan options as well. It gets pretty packed during breakfast/brunch & on the weekends too. Definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella, banana &amp; almond heaven!
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frankenstein Blended Coffee
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elvis Waffle

XTGq6ngnL3-TtQzOPtkxxA.text: I had an avocado and cheese waffle for breakfast. It is tasty though a bit lighter than you might expect--I would recommend going with a protein-infused option if you're hungry. This is a nice place to hang out in since it has a community feel and doesn't blast music or AC. Didn't see any outlets but they do have WiFi.

ep5Dak5Vy0nuBOg4B4p1hw.text: Asked for a for here cup, didn't get it. Showed our yelp discount, didn't get it. Rude staff, hot building, and it's not in a great location. You're better off going to the boba place across the street. We were really looking forward to visiting here, so we were really disappointed in our experience. Drinks were not great nor were the waffles.

QqCIMVZTwPa7rTiat1a-kA.text: I used to visit the Aliante location on a weekly basis and I'm still bummed that the location has since closed.  My go-to drink is their Espresso Frankenstein (4 shots of espresso & agave blended with ice).  This location doesn't have it on their menu, but they're willing to create it on request.  I love this drink and will add my own scoop of protein powder to it. TIABI specializes in latte's and great coffee.  I'll make the trip out here at least once a month for their Americano.  They also serve waffle sandwiches with a creative touch. As for service, it's the best. The owner, Tiffany, and the staff at TIABI know me by now.  They know that I'm here for either the Espresso Frankenstein or a large Americano.  TIABI, I will see you soon.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mel C was here!

C2qYKNz9KfVEL48BxNJL9w.text: Friendly staff.  Average waffles and coffee.  Ordered the bacon infused waffle with an egg.  The egg came out about 8 minutes later.  That is after half of the waffle was eaten.  Poor planning.  The quality was good.  Nothing better than I could have made at home.

15GIDGfjDHO8l-IaeUQPrA.text: Super delicious and cost place. Service is patient and all smiling. So happy I found this place. I hope they remain clean and delicious.

rTHt8MOsF7q6K7wsNXpzjQ.text: Went here solely based on the reviews. We wanted something local and off the strip so we ubered over.... We used a Groupon to purchase our breakfast. The food was good, I guess but definitely not worth all the rave reviews. Not necessarily a place I'd recommend or return to... It's just ok

KR29mvpmwGxGUkw2Q4KbAA.text: Food was very tasty ..  seating is limited so get there early especially when you have a party of more than 2... they have a good selection of different beverages made with the coffee and teas and the option for vegan style foods..  i will return the next time I'm in Vegas

ULAUVP0dZTVRQmzETFIIYg.text: Definitely a must-try!   The waffles here are the bomb but what really surprised me that I loved was the coffee. As a barista, I can be a bit of a snob when it comes to it but every time I have gotten the coconut truffle iced coffee here it has 1) woken me up and 2) made me want to come back for more. This is a small feat considering how high my tolerance is for caffeine. I love it.   The atmosphere is great for having a conversation, grabbing some lunch, or lounging about and I love the Guam seal incorporated in the back drawing! Also, Tiffany the owner is often working along with the other baristas and is great to have a conversation with, always remembers me, and the other baristas are friendly as well.  My fiance loves their black coffee and waffles too. I am pretty sad that I'm not near UNLV all the time any more during the day so stopping by for now will have to be a treat but whenever I'm in the area I will make it a point to swing by!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cali waffle sandwich add egg
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious waffles

pvJzZ0_xrpEANkWMwRsx_Q.text: I found this place on yelp while I was sitting in the car and wanted something sweet ....   It's in the shopping center with the target on the side   The ladies working were very friendly and nice took my order right away I ordered the kisses waffle and the snickers coffee both were yummy :) I would come back to try out other items they have breakfast waffles as well if you don't want something sweet you are in luck don't worry

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VkdU9CW0izuoA3aTF3wCtA.text: Really convenient location about 10 mins from the strip. Very reasonably priced and the food was amazing. My waffledilla was mouth watering and the waffles are great. The inside is very cute and they are on group on. Only small issue is the food did take a minute to come out but it was worth the wait.

vmUv00_K39wna5f0ppV8CA.text: This place was delish! They have savory and sweet options for the waffles. Fresh ingredients and vegan options to make you feel like it's healthy lol. The coffee is also super good- this is a nice friendly artsy local coffee spot to check out when in Las Vegas. The staff was super friendly and helpful when we asked for some directions! Really went above and beyond.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MV9Hwk75h3BlRPFMk-wH2Q.text: My last visit was not on par with my other visits. Service was okay, waffle was okay, and it was pretty slow getting my order even when the place was empty. Plus, the waffle wasn't the gloriously crispy goodness it usually is.  Maybe it's because it wasn't breakfast time, but it was a disappointing meal and I won't be rushing back anytime soon.

6PbIyh0g6ND0GhrvrJ7I4g.text: This is a really friendly coffee shop. I visited this summer to attend a Kiwanis meeting in the venue and I had a delicious beverage. The staff were really friendly and helpful. As a tourist who had never been here before, I was made to feel welcome and I rather enjoyed my beverage. I didn't try the waffles (as we had other dinner plans) but they did look good. I like how community minded they are, providing the space for this Kiwanis club to meet!

RmNVg0814BSZkRhLkC_KCw.text: First time here. Very friendly and helpful staff.  Clean and cute atmosphere.  Their waffles were not only delicious but also vegan!!! All their waffles are vegan! I love how they have vegan alternative for their food items,  usually a couple dollars more.  I had their vegan avocado grilled cheese with chips and three vegan pastries. The best part was the avocado grilled cheeses, which was incredible!  It wasn't too heavy or grease. It had lots of flavor.  Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan pastries
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan avocado grilled cheese
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegan pastries

ik82xGdgWTRhGj7jcAEZHQ.text: It was my first time coming to Tiabi. Ashley was really nice and made the experience awesome. 5/5 customer service, would recommend to anyone in the area. coffee was really good

E19IoTDfuaNyOMqJk4KT-g.text: Good began options here and a variety of waffles to choose from. Not too far of a walk from UNLV if you want some quick breakfast before class.

0NTinZbxfrzNw-NC8XfDYg.text: I stumbled on this cute little spot after going grocery shopping nearby for our stay. Their espresso is nice and strong, just what was needed after getting in late the night before. I originally was hoping to find an avocado toast here buuuuut I found something even better. Who would've ever thought of making a grilled cheese with avo on a waffle! So much deliciousness in each bite, wow! I'm sure I'll be back before leaving Vegas and whenever I come here in the future!

P0mvE6pOoiI8xxndCdbbbg.text: I got the waffle with bananas and Nutella and my mom got the strawberry smoothie. Both were really good especially the waffle. It was just enough toppings without being too much or making it too soggy. The waffle was light and had a good crispiness to it which I like. If you like more of a big fluffy pancake then this really isn't the place for you. The location of this place is a little weird it's almost like a hole in the wall. Inside is nice with good music and cool decorations. I also got an iced latte and it was good too, I would compare it to Starbucks ice latte. Staff was friendly.

WbWF__-7IZVx_IyR7ld8WA.text: I would definitely recommend others to give it a go. For sure, I will return again and again. This place has great customer service and very delicious food. We ordered the "West Coast" and the "Waffledilla". Also had a side of chips, a 12oz "Lavender Latte" and a "Tiabi Green Tea Latte". Since I like to explore new drinks I also ordered a large "Just  Peachy" and a large "Coconut Cooler" to go. They even have special menu items too, like "The Frankenstein" and more.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ixPjgRC0PXnpJavnaE14LA.text: If you're in Vegas go to this place. My boyfriend is a huge waffle critic and raves about this place. We went on our first day in Vegas and went back three times during our trip. Every combination of waffle you can buy is good, prices are fair, staff is super nice. There is also no waiter it's just a walk up order and you can sit and eat it in the restaurant with silverware. The coffees are so interesting and amazing we tried three different kinds, Java Jolt was my favorite. To make it even more appealing, the atmosphere inside is very hip and enjoyable to dine in. Not enough good things to say!

gBkk7--qWzMcHXZJT6r-rA.text: I will start this off by saying I love this place! They have amazing coffee drinks (all the signature drinks are delicious!) and all of their waffles are good too. I've had the avocado grilled cheese and a few other different sweet waffles too with ice cream  so good! I came here once with my mom and husband and used the groupon for 3 $8 vouchers. The next time I came in here my husband tried to use the vouchers and the guy with the cross earrings was really rude and aloof about the whole ordeal. He told us we couldn't use the three vouchers at the same time (last time we did three different transactions and lady was super nice and chipper). He said we could only use two in a visit, to which we replied ok no problem. We told him what order we wanted on the first voucher and he asked us for the next order. He tried to put the entire order under one voucher after we explained our situation. He didn't seem to understand what we were trying to do.   I usually love this place but during this visit, it was not a good time. I come in here even without the vouchers to spend money because I love this place. Unfortunately the last encounter left me with a sour taste.   Side note...if you're out of something for over a week (like all other flavors of ice cream) why not take it off the crumpled paper that you put all your flavors on? Or maybe cover it with a post it note? So all your patrons know you only have one flavor, vanilla.

MsCxl7lIlaAa_--sjuFFWg.text: Came here with a coworker for a quick coffee stop. About 10am on a Tuesday, and the restaurant was not full at all. My coworker ordered the banatella waffle with a reg coffee, and I ordered at twilight lavender latte with a muffin from the counter. The wait was surprisingly long--about 20min for the waffle, and after another 20min, the latte never came. I asked the cashier about the latte, and she admitted to making a mistake of omitting the latte from our order. She asked if I still wanted it, she would have to ring me up. This was after waiting for 40 minutes. No thanks.

w-3NotlZP57Bd3Nlkv2bmg.text: This is a really special place. The coffee is consistently good and prepared with care without being obsessive about it. The food choices are at once extraordinary (in the sense of out of the ordinary) and comforting (in the sense of comfort food). The atmosphere is always relaxed and friendly, no matter how crowded it is, and the service is friendly, personable and prompt. The wifi is usually strong, and the music is eclectic without being obtrusive. Its tucked away but close enough to UNLV to be considered a "college" coffee shop. I personally find it a good place to work, to schedule meetings and to bring my kids -- sometimes all in the same visit. And I always leave feeling better than when I came in!

gR9jNLD-4CrpsRot028diw.text: I'm surprised I even have a photo to attach. This waffle was so good, I finished it before my friend who referred this place could even ask how it was! Great selection and absolutely delicious. I also had one of their specialty drinks, a snickers iced coffee and it was amazing. A lot of sugar for the day but totally worth it. Decent parking and very affordable and quiet place.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nXScoVbzdVXF1TYgY4XhTg.text: Excellent waffles and tasty coffee. It doesn't look like anything from the outside and would easily be overlooked but the service is great, people are friendly and the food is great for a reasonable price. Nice atmosphere makes you hang out ;)

NqLSpl_2AfcCObmSfQUhHg.text: Honestly not even a waffle person but I want more of their bacon maple waffles. So delicious. My taste buds weren't overwhelmed- as I did taste the bacon, sweet syrup and waffles distinctly. Also perfect coffee and friendly staff!

JX0IGafCH06yNZxS4nGM3A.text: I'm from San Diego so whenever I'm in Vegas, this place is one of my "Go To" spots! Love the West Coast and I gotta have the Pistachio Latte.. Tonight I had the Bananatella and it was Yummy! The staff is very friendly :) They never disappoint !

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananatella, Pistachio Latte and West Coast

digJeyAhH692IARqBskmTg.text: I love the service and I especially love their churro waffle I usually add in some of their ice cream. I've tried their sandwiches and plenty of their deserts my second best would have to be their strawberry and kisses if I'm not mistaken. I can't wait to go again and order that churro waffle.

UF2GkTp13xMm6TlPsSJJlw.text: Had the veggie breakfast sandwich not expecting much and was pleasantly surprised by how DELICIOUS it was! The waffle (gluten free for me) was soft inside and crispy outside, and it paired well with the egg, cheese, avocado & tomato. SO good!

ofRAdqJZTB_7wYMVdJLy8w.text: The food was soooo good and very reasonably priced. I will be coming back anytime I'm visiting.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cHaPedLtmz9nLQ6_aDpNXw.text: Very locally owned small business feel which you can love or hate. I love it!  The place is small with limited seating and heavily in need of crowd control but the bites are worth it.  Coffee is locally roasted but pretty bland. What you want to come here for is the red velvet vegan waffles.  I don't even like pancakes and waffles but I fell in love with these bad boys! Drizzled with chocolate and topped with ice cream it's breakfast heaven.  The music also tops but if you want to get to know the service staff it's a little had with the noisy back bar/prep table.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QxqIaWUUxQM4u9ZiWXSt6g.text: I used to hate waffles once upon a time. I've never been a breakfast gal, so waffles never tickled my fancy.  But in 2014,I found myself pregnant and working in Alaska. I happened upon a waffle house and ate there with my co-workers. They had the best pancakes I have ever had, with a ham and egg waffle that was divine.  Since then I've been on the hunt for a waffle that could compare. I thought maybe those waffles tasted good because I was pregnant, like how many foods taste better when under the influence of certain substances.  But I persisted. I have eaten at a few waffle places here in town and the waffles here are the best ones I have had yet. The maple bacon waffle reminded me so much of the waffle up in Alaska that it is all I can think about wanting for breakfast. The only thing that stops me is that I live in green valley and I already drive for a living so I avoid it at all costs.   COME HERE AND EAT THE WAFFLES. Take it from a formerly-pregnant-lady-turned-mom-who-used-to-hate-waffles-but-now-only-likes-the-really-really-really-good-ones.

0bCp44XFgIGClXxq5VIpOQ.text: Inviting friendly staff, made to order fresh yummy food.... Very clean , up beat, comfortable atmosphere!!! Will definitely be back next time we're in town!

hsIPCO2TwBAWEwPApo9uFA.text: Second time coming in and I can truly say I'll be coming back for a third, I had the breakfast wafflewich with bacon, sausage and veggies. 10/10 I loved it! I also decided to have a coconut iced coffee, best one I've had!

edGjVXJ0ynGkeEGMTp3kPA.text: Just moved to the area and needed a good breakfast. This place hit the mark! I had the Elvis waffles (pb, banana and bacon) and a Snickers coffee. Both were delicious! The only reason I'm giving it a 4 right now is that I still need to explore the whole menu!

u9mbsRphb_qP-jGLozLtxg.text: Cool ,cute, unpretentious lovely little place with wonderful workers, chef making waffle with his heart , taste all good ingredients are using for the creative waffle sandwiches , the honey creamy latte is fantastic  The owner and workers there so pleasant, friendly and passionate about what they are doing, I respect people like that. They got it right , focus on few things and make it toward perfection! I am going again tomorrow try other items on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

h2pJDbk9odz5nd6ei-DwcA.text: Small seating area. Menu is on the left side when you enter. Order at the counter and find a table.   Utensils are very dirty. Bad dishwasher/ dish washing? I used napkins to wipe them down.   Decor is boring.   Food didn't take long to come out, maybe 10 minutes.   We ordered a pistachio latte; delicious flavor, lightly sweetened with a beautiful nutty aftertaste.   Bananatella: these waffles are different from what I have had else where. They are on the thinner, slightly doughier side. Nice crunchy exterior and softness as you bite into it. The almonds on top added a nice texture to the bite. Fresh, firm banana slices.   Veggie breakfast sandwich: they use the same waffle for these sandwiches, which works great. The veggies were fresh, great tasting. No complaints.   We enjoyed this place but for $16.XX I don't think we will be coming back. I'm still hungry.

xFormR1FJu0IIvccR_qirg.text: I have been pining for a visit after seeing the wonderful Instagram photos from Tiabi Waffle. Today we headed over around 7:30 and finally got to enjoy a waffle breakfast. I had the Elvis which includes banana, peanut butter, honey, agave nectar. It was the perfect waffle and portions are just big enough to be very satisfying, and not so massive as to be overwhelming.  My husband gobbled up his bacon infused waffle and exclaimed this place a solid 4!! Now this isa tough reviewer, who when he sees the word 'vegan' scrunches up his face and his head folds into his shoulders. This is huge!  I want to return for their blendies, smoothies with a great variety of ingredients, and the black lemonade which is infused with charcoal for digestion.  The cafe is cute and staff are super helpful.  You may find us here pretty often now!!

LlXqkZVmt0j-ny_57Nl2Bg.text: Fantastic waffles.  Good coffee.  Chill atmosphere.    Tried all the Tiabi Classic waffles.  No complaints.  U don't like their preselected options, you can create your own.    Staff is always chill.    People sometimes complain about the wait, but that's what happens when your food is fresh and made to order.    If you're short on time, this is not your best option.  This is a dish best served when you've gots time to chillax... and then go hit the pools and get turnt up.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Waffle with whip cream
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter Pecan Waffle

B1O0MNFj4poUDz9Z9Dfi-g.text: Love the waffledilla here. The price is pretty reasonable. Love the tiabi sauce. They also have a veggie option!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the waffledilla here !

D-_yzGJBFgJOo_f_SQe7-w.text: My first time here, been wanting to try this place for quite some time!  Vegan tiabi waffle w coconut bacon & strawberries was amazing! Tasted perfect. The syrup is just right too, not too sweet or sticky.  Service was on point.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiabi waffle w coconut bacon &amp; strawberries. SO good!! :)

-nGV5V0AZPBu8IMeZfqSIg.text: Great local spot off the strip for classic waffles and creative waffle sandwiches with different options for toppings too. Also lots of coffee creations and tea choices. Awesome music playlist and local art on the wall.

1b_kTeCuTUp_P7pgs_GQjg.text: This place is amazing. I've had lots of waffles in my day. This was by far the best waffle I've ever had. (Maple Bacon) and the signature drink, Waffle Macchiato was amazing too. I wish I ordered two of them. Me and my wife was Visiting Vegas from San Francisco and we will be back to Tiabi!!! 10/10!!!!

GiXOOwzmUjNBCo66ZbkAFQ.text: If you are coming for Belgium style DON'T they stop serving them over a month ago due to taking too long to cook according to the staff.   My wife LOVES breakfast so I found this place for her. The atmosphere on a weekday morning is quiet and empty but I hear on the weekends it is a madhouse.   We shared everything today. We started with a maple bacon waffle. I really liked it but my wife said it tasted like an eggo waffle.   We both had a west coast sandwich despite it being "breakfast". Both really good. Warm waffle as the bread and creamy avocado with bacon and chicken unside-Yum!  We also both had coffee. I had a honey cream iced latte- awesome! My wife had a regular latte with sugar free caramel-also awesome! There coffee is amazing. No bitterness in our milk drinks for sure.   Overall we loved this place. Great coffee and pretty decent food. Me: 5/5. Wife:4/5. I round down.   We will be returning for sure!  Btw it is counter service but it was friendly and quick.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great coffee!!

i-74dSj1WSQ9i8HhSqo1zg.text: Amazing waffles. First time this morning and did not disappoint. I ordered the banana Nutella.

Ktz3t3Q9JSVVXObNkwf4KA.text: Good food and nice people.  Well worth the trek off the strip. My favorite is the classic waffle and my kids love the churro waffles

VY8_2WebX6SxoOSphzsoDg.text: Oh my damn! This may be a hidden gem on the east side of lasvegas how did i not know this place extisted i have no clue! I went in with a coworker to get some brunch. We walked in and some nice tunes was on the radio so im already grooving while standing in line and feeling the environment. The cashier was friendly took all my orders quickly there was only two working at the time so we were in no rush. The lay out of restaurant gives a nice mellow vibe has some pretty cool stuff on the walls....now on to the food. Lol  One of my coworkers and i got the Westcoast Wafflewich bannatella waffle maple bacon waffle and a veggie sandwhich peach ice tea redbull cider and tropical tea (i cant remember the whole name) While we were waiting the family before us had their order come out and their stuff looked amazing! So i became anxious to eat my wafflewhich before i got to the office. Anyways i get back unwrapped it took a bite and a chorus of hallelujah went through my head. It had the right amount of seasoning the waffle itself was nice and fluffy the chicken had seasoning it was just awesome and awesome doesnt even do it justice.  My friend loved her veggie wafflewhich and the whole office was happy about this place. Oh and the peach tea was good also. One thing is that if they could have an option of battered chicken to give a little crunch that would be good!

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside of the wafflewitch
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of the Westcoast Wafflewhich and just peachy tea.
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Check in photo comics on the wall

DJ2iuMNn-falMonM17yF8Q.text: This Waffle joint is a bit off the Strip in Vegas but well worth the time! Service was good and food was fresh. Coffee is locally roasted and very good! Toni B and I enjoyed the place and food. I recommend taking the time to find this olace.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WC8t1qXjs4tPLtuiF6AAsg.text: Delicious coffee and waffle sandwiches. I was nervous to try a hearty sandwich on a waffle that was sort of sweet, but this place did not disappoint! Staff was super friendly and helpful as well!

8Rq3dAGWoEnRjvwUcuh_Wg.text: i appreciate what they're going for, but the waffles are just so bland & soggy. coffee is fine the baristas are nice & won't hesitate to fix your drink if there is anything wrong with it. the food is just bland & the waffles are a bit soggy

SL1jSDix-58sS4JmSNdBrg.text: Such a cute and vibrant place. The service is so nice and fast! Not to mention how good the food is. It's my favorite place to go for sweets, coffee and a fun game of cards.

photos.caption: Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect place for a sweet tooth

RxWLbyZWMwgnO7eE5CsoIA.text: Amazing small business owned by 2 women of Guam!! I first found this place in search of white espresso! I moved here from Seattle so you can imagine we are well known for our love for coffee. Anyway, the yummy looking food and coffee pictures is what summoned my family and I! As we pulled up we seen a Guam sticker proudly represented on the entry way! It made me feel proud to be a Chamorru but even prouder to see a small uniquely owned island business in sin city! Strange how this place stuck out and so happened to be of the same cultural background. Amazing customer service by the young lady and man who was working. She thoroughly explained good items in which we were interested in regardless of how many questions we threw at her. I myself being a server in the food industry know how tedious it could be. We ordered a few items off the menu!  Red velvet waffle  Maple and beacon waffle  Southwest waffle sandwich Banananutella And the Tia waffle iced mac. Coffee  All tasted lovely and reasonably priced! Go support a small island owned business!

C8s6zfXxHXVcgvWt8zHZxA.text: They have the best tasting waffles I've ever tried. It's just like a hole in the wall but they offer the best breakfast ever. Will definitely be back with more friends in tow.

RHDZuYJgLENnB98jge50BA.text: This place is really cute- the atmosphere is hip and eclectic, and they even have decks of cards to play with at the tables. The establishment is clean, and they have a few  yummy looking things for vegans on their menu. The staff is passionate and friendly, and I loved the small business vibe that it had.  I didn't personally have a great overall experience there, but I realize from other's reviews that my experience was definitely not the norm.  When my fiance and I ordered our food, I didn't think it would take much more than 20 minutes to get it on the table, but the guy working there did warn me that it might take a couple extra minutes. No big deal. After waiting about 45 minutes, I needed to leave for work but we had already paid for our food- which I found out hadn't even been started yet. There was only one other couple in the restaurant, so I went to find out what was going on. It turns out, the one person working there was filling a 30 sandwich catering order before making our 2 sandwiches. The owner/manager person came out to see what was wrong, and ended up basically yelling at her employee for not offering us a free upgrade to Belgian waffles so that he could use the other iron and get our sandwiches out quickly.  Now, yes, that would have been a smart thing to do, but what about the possibility of putting the only two waffles ordered in the last hour in front of the 30 catered waffles? Or the possibility of not charging for the meal we had to take to go and I still ended up late for work? Or at the very least not chewing out your employee for a unfortunately handled circumstance that could not have possibly been covered during training?   Also the manager/owner lady was worried that I would give her a bad review on yelp, and kept bringing it up and asking that the employee's mistake wouldn't cost her a good review. I don't go on yelp just to give people bad reviews, but it's not often that I have an experience this bad either.  The sandwiches and coffee themselves were absolutely fabulous, and since the service was definitely situational, I would not be opposed to going back sometime to give it another shot. Even more than being late for work and not getting any sort of complimentary item as an apology, I just really don't appreciate the lack of professionalism that the management showed the day I went in. I've been in situations where my boss embarrassed me in front of customers before, and it's really the worst thing.  But like I said, it was just a poorly handled situation, and the food was so dang good that I would not be opposed to giving them a second chance- I'm just not chomping at the bit to walk through those doors again.

4Y5muc28ZfAPxq4_wrS5aQ.text: So very disappointed.  Maybe we came on a bad day.  It took 10 mins before either of the guys behind the counter bothered to look up and say hello.  We ordered waffles and regular coffee.  25 mins to get the waffles and when I asked about the coffees, the guy behind the counter got really snarky.  He said the were slammed and the coffee would be up soon . Seriously??  It was regular non fancy coffee !?  It finally came 10 mins after we got the waffles.  Coffee was like warm and the waffles weren't very good .   Oh  and there were maybe 14 people in this place, and 7 of them was our family !

kXVltHJ3hOPsiNg25azWAQ.text: Gluten free waffles at affordable prices in Vegas? What? And Nutella? Sign me up! Great coffee for an amazing price. Staff is friendly. This hole-in-the-wall coffee shop is definitely worth venturing off the strip to go try.

lvDjwZWCyXSGYwpomJMASA.text: It's been a while since I wrote a review, but I wanted to write one about my favorite cafe - TIABI.  TIABI - "To Inspire And Be Inspired". I discovered this little place through a student organization at UNLV. They are super close to campus and an excellent place to "be inspired," in my case this is the only place where I know I can sit down and focus on writing and studying. I've been here several times already and have accomplished so much (yelping reviews is the bottom of my list up until now).   First, the only downside I can mention is that there is only one wall outlet (that I know) where I can plug in. That little area has become my personal spot. Other than that, I thoroughly love this venue.  Location/Open times: TIABI is down the street from UNLV. It is in a secluded area of the Target shopping plaza right next to a great sushi place. As a potential schoolteacher, the 7am open time is right when I have to get to class but it is open until 8pm on most days making it a good place to have breakfast on my off days, lunch, or chillax after class/work.  Aesthetics: Local art, waffle "hashtags" everywhere, a couple of couches and sturdy tables and seating. The wired art light fixtures  add a nice rustic look (though they tend to accumulate dust quickly). Nothing is too distracting, and I can zone into my work or a conversation easily. Their playlists are provided by Pandora and varies by the people working, but I have enjoyed the musical tastes of the staff thus far, ranging from islander to indie.  Food: In the words of a lego dude, "EVERYTHING IS AWESOME!!" There are plenty of options, especially health and allergy conscious, handcrafted on the spot. I have always enjoyed that "fresh" taste and have never suffered a regretful feeling leaving (as is sometimes the case with Chipotle or even Starbucks). As I am writing this review, I am having their red velvet waffle (so sweet and delectable) paired with a new beverage, the Frankenstein frappe, a cool and refreshing drink lightly sweetened with agave but not so much as to overpower the taste of the coffee. I am enjoying myself and am getting my morning kick (which is why I can write).   Service: The owners, Tiff and Mae, are both super awesome and have taken care of me on numerous occasions. Their staff are just as kind and sociable, and I haven't had a problem striking up a conversation as I am often here alone. I feel as welcome as sitting at a desk in my own living room. I'm surprised that not as many people come to just hang out, but I'm certain that will change as more people come to know about TIABI.  I like small hole-in-the-wall local places, and I feel especially at home at this one. Hope this review was inspiring!

_wKYCJg2HQlgQ7iB-9DvWA.text: Great place to get some waffle sandwiches or delicious drinks.  Also, the music had me feeling nostalgic, all hits from the 90s, which is a good thing. 3OVYLSU90clhzhiD9ein2g.text: Tiabi Coffee & Waffle is a hole in the wall venue that I am glad I got to visit during my short stay in Nevada. My family and I make a semi annual trip from CA every year...and we usually always settle for the renowned hotel buffets. This time however I decided to change that, and we stumbled on this location for breakfast.  I was fascinated with the originality of their menu, especially with waffles. Savory or sweet...many different options were available to satisfy. I appreciated that this restaurant was vegan friendly for my own personal choice. But my family loved it as well. Although a little pricey, the food we ordered  was indeed very filling and delicious. Anticipate an average wait time as they make the vegan waffles by scratch.   The restaurant itself had a very welcoming cafe environment. And the employees were kind.   I highly recommend the visit and the try the Waffledilla and the Twilight Lavender Latte! Heaven!

QXRdaCtH5XrYfqffOo-eaQ.text: Still full of Awesomeness...no matter which waffle I try I have yet to be disappointed.  And you can get anything you want gluten free and vegan.  On this particular visit 3-7-16 I believe one of the owners was in the store because the staff was not as warm and friendly as in the past.  There was a totally different vibe in here then in the past 3 or 4 visits.  Not sure what was going on but the food was still amazing, the drinks were amazing and this is a place I not only highly recommend but will come back to as well.  To me this is one of those places you just cannot seem to get enough of.  You can get breakfast or lunch stuff anytime and you always leave satisfied.

n3H4D6EOG-wgjdquUfooNA.text: It's really chill here, and the food is tasty. Everyone is very attentive and kind. There are great vegan options, and the food is fresh. Large variety of coffees. Try Wednesday bogo 1/2 classic waffles.

7yhS5hfoNvCSZpxphECNgw.text: Decor: 4/5 -looks like a local coffee shop with large tables and benches  -Service: 5/5 -Israel greet us as we walked in and took our order. Our drinks were done in a few minutes and the food was ready in less than ten minutes  -Food: 4/5 -Snickers ice coffee didn't taste like snickers however it was a good sweet ice coffee drink -The west coast wafflewich was great. I'm a big fan of avocado and bacon. The chicken was not try at all. Recommend this one -Savory Thai Basil - I tried this one because it was unique. Overall I felt the flavor was slightly lacking but can't put my finger on it. I think it needs more crunch and flavor. -I was impressed that the waffles stayed crispy on the outside, soft on the inside

wEOFYPCZkgUpq4IJCR8E0g.text: I came here with some friends yesterday and we shared a number of items. As I walked in, I noticed how lovely it smelled and was excited to try their waffles.   We sat and perused the menu for a while and I was a little disappointed that no one really checked on us or even asked if we wanted waters or more menus than just the one for our group of three. We finally figured out what we wanted and went up to the counter to order.  The lady behind he counter kept interrupting my dining companion as he started to order by yelling behind to another person who worked there. I thought that was a little rude, so that definitely put me off.  Our food took a while to come, but it looked really pretty.   What we ordered: -red velvet wafflenut  -Nutella and almond wafflenut  -The Fat Elvis waffle -Strawberry and chocolate waffle -Vegas churro waffle with honey, cinnamon, sugar and vanilla ice cream  Everything was solid. The consensus was that the churro waffle was the favorite and I personally enjoyed the strawberry waffle, minus the chocolate sauce.   Service needs work and the location is awkward, so I don't see myself making much effort to come back to this place in the future.
