Photo of TIABI Coffee & Waffle Bar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon and kisses waffle combined.

4UL5CjLieODRjW1GIEQHlw.text: The food is amazing, the drinks are even better. A little pricey but totally worth it. I recommend the Butter Pecan Waffle with infused Bacon and ice cream. Also hot espresso with a scoop of ice cream.

Mou2NXPLBAE5aQeeHQQvxw.text: I love this place. Waffle flavor is on point. Vegan options are available. They were out of vegan ice cream last time but I'll be back in to try it soon. Try the Oreo coffee. Soooo delishiousness and the environment is chill. My only complaint is that I wish they had longer hours.

YG64iMq2KdU8FJCV2Yl3rw.text: Great food! Great coffee!!! Love their Espresso Frankenstein, it's pretty is AMAZING! It's the perfect blend! We came to visit Las Vegas and had to come back a 2nd time while we were out there!

aS8Uf5cpoze86Ricb53qdg.text: When I first walked in, I thought, Crap!. Crap! not again.. Another crappy-overpriced hipster wanna-be "cafe" . . .  chalkboard paint, hand-drawn menu, attractive employees that are smiling. Dammit. I reluctantly ordered the Vegan Waffle-"burger", with a side of peanut sauce, for 6 bucks. For 6 bucks, that's amazingly cheap for Vegas. Ok, then I added the Frankenstein and my friend ordered. A Steel Pulse song came on the overhead, and now, breakfast for two, was under $20. Yes. This, is what is up. Definitely my new go to spot.

toKtrO2pMGzsrjKlOwEdhQ.text: OK, this is a lengthy review.  here's a summary:  The wait is FOREVER.  If you're disabled or in a hurry, skip it.  If you're fully-abled with plenty of time on your hands, Tiabi is probably worth the wait.  Now for the actual review:  This place is very popular - there wasn't an empty seat in the house.  This is a problem for me as I'm disabled.  I was feeling halfway decent today and decided to take my daughter out for a (long overdue) mommy/daughter date, since I don't get to do that very often.  We went inside and stared at the menu for a few minutes.  It's big and on the wall near the front of the store, which is convenient.  After deciding what we wanted, I walked around to find the area for placing an order.  There are 3 sections where the counter is open, so they all appear to be there for communicating with the people behind the counter.  After examining the other items at the counter (there's stuff everywhere), however, it wasn't obvious where to stand to place an order.  One of the staff members saw the lost look on my face and directed me to the right place.  Once there I noticed an ipad on the counter which I assume they use to take orders.  We moved to the appropriate counter spot (which is at the front of the store, by the menu), and then waited to be helped.  I was able to wait for 10 minutes, but that's when my back issues kicked in.  In that time, we were given an apology, but no other eye contact or acknowledgement.  I got the impression that they were overwhelmed and didn't WANT to take anymore orders.  I've worked in retail and food service, so I know how that that is.  It was probably a blessing that they didn't take my order, as I wouldn't have been capable of standing around much longer to wait for the food.  In their defense, all 3 employees were shuffling around and working very hard.  The place was just seriously understaffed.  They could've used AT LEAST 2 more people today.  Since my back issues don't allow me to stand for extended periods of time, I hate to say that I won't be able to return to this establishment.  For anyone in the same boat - having limited physical abilities - I'd suggest ordering Tiabi for delivery if you live close enough, or just try a different waffle bar.  The one at Tivoli has plenty of seating and wasn't busy when I went.  I was very disappointed.  My young daughter was VERY excited to try some new and desserty waffles.  It kills me to get that far into the process, only to break her heart and go somewhere else.  It also sucks because I'm usually in too much pain (or too medicated) to even leave the house.  So when I do leave the house, every minute counts and is very special to me.  Don't take your good health for granted!!!!!!!!  Not entirely related, but worth noting:  Across the street from Tiabi, the wash runs between Toys R Us and Seafood City.  This part of the wash spawns a lot of water pokemon, which are hard to find elsewhere in the desert.  I kinda wish I could leave a review without giving a star rating.  Although I couldn't try the food, it's obviously good.  They wouldn't have been that busy if they weren't doing something right.  I just REALLY REALLY REALLY wish the owners would staff it better, or maybe expand or something.  We aren't all fully-abled college students with the ability to wait around all day.  I also want to mention that I'm NOT the type of person who expects everyone to cater to ME and my specific needs.  My belief - no matter what side of the counter I'm on - is that if your customers are important to you, you don't make them wait more than 2 minutes to be rung up.

CvJ9FCWA4Sa0CPSd5VAuVQ.text: Vegan waffles are hard to come by, especially at these prices. The coffee was so good. Would definitely go back.

YFs9gj6MUveTPjVoBQn0Vw.text: The staff is friendly and even came around with free dessert samples...which now I may need to get because the churro waffle was incredibly good.  The prices are cheap (2 people 2 lattes a waffle-wich and a waffle was just about $20).  The lattes are great and unique (never saw a pistachio latte before) and the food is great.  If you want a cheap great place with a very relaxed coffee house type atmosphere check it out!!!

I8q_wDAhUUgCYBi2gXlBIA.text: My TIABI experience was top notch! It's locally owned by these two young girls from Guam who works there too. Mae is one of the owner & greeted us with a genuine smile. She gave us recommendations for a health nut like me and I was not disappointed! I always opt for the gluten free options and I tried their Hashtag Waffle with turkey sausage & eggs- it was delicious!!! My friend had the West Coast Waffle that had bacon, chicken, avocado with their TIABI sauce & she was speechless! The waffles had the right amount of crunchiness & sweetness at the same time- & the portions are huge! We had the Kale Champ (kale, bananas, orange, almond milk) & Tif's Waffle Macchiato that came with a cute tiny churro waffle with the drink (like an umbrella in cocktail drinks but you can eat the waffle & dip it in your coffee- yum!). Kale Champ was a champ! No bitterness & just a tad sweetness. The macchiato- Wow! Smooth, aromatic with a hint of cinnamon. The price is very reasonable- where can you have gourmet coffee or shakes with an out of this world waffle entree for just a little over $10 bucks?!  The place is simple with a local vibe touch to the interior- chalk board with cute drawings, a locker that has graffiti signatures from customers, and couches to relax or study. It's right next to Target near UNLV.  We came here after our Spartan race yesterday because we were craving for some good waffles. We heard about this place from the locals & drove there from the race site as fast as we could without getting a speeding ticket :-) We were still wearing our medals. It was such a perfect place to celebrate another successful Spartan race!
